description:
I am super impressed with this place. It was heaven for my vegetarian friends who could share from everyone's plates for once.

Food: The Tom Yum soup was super yummy, very flavorful and the smell of ginger and the tang of lime did it for me. The see ew noodles were my second favorite, amazing stuff man. The Thai samosas were not bad either. In all this place nails it with the food.

Service: The food came faster than expected and this worked out for us since we were famished.

Ambiance: It is a small place tucked away next to other bigger restaurants but is a gem if you spot it.

In-all: I am super impressed with the food at this place, wish I lived in SF to be able to go here more often.
author: Vaani S.

description:
Ok, color I'm impressed. I did not expect the presentation of the food to blow me away as much as Thai Idea has. For a restaurant in the Tenderloin, it's a got a thumbs up if you want to be in a restaurant and forget that you're in one of the worst neighborhoods in San Francisco.

All of the dishes are vegetarian, with some vegan alternatives as well. I ordered the Pumpkin Curry, Pad See-Ew and Spicy Fried Rice. Prices of the dishes ranged from $10~$13. Food came out quick and was a great presentation. Service was good as well.

My only complaint here is that I wished the food was warmer and spicier. The food seemed to come out a little over room temperature, wish it was straight from the stove. I'll definitely be asking for spicy next time, though there was plenty of sauces that were placed on the table as well.

Apparently the owner (Pop) is the son of Thai immigrants who opened other successful Thai restaurants in the Bay. Another welcomed immigrant gem in the Tenderloin.
author: David D.

description:
Golden cauliflower you are soooo good. I could have filled up on only that for dinner. It's crunchy and delicious and had a lovely dipping sauce. 

My only gripe is the pad Thai, it had no flavor which was a bummer cause the rest was pretty taste including the samosas and the salad wraps.

I would go back but the menu was a bit limiting.
author: Heather S.

description:
I wonder how many times the employees see people dashing through the restaurant doors to avoid staying outside in the Tenderloin for too long. It was pretty much an adventure for us to get there. My friend and I saw a lot of sketchy people standing near the restaurant. Luckily, it wasn't too crazy outside. No one was humping a tree or shaking their booty while standing in the middle of the road this time. Welcome to San Francisco, :P. 

If you can ignore all the sketchy (and potentially sketchy) people, you should probably try this place. I ordered Pad Kee Mow ($11.25) and made it a little less spicy. My friend ordered Roasted Duck Curry ($11.50) with Jasmine Rice ($2.75). 

Both the Pad Kee Mow and Roasted Duck Curry were delicious and very flavorful. The veggie meats actually tasted slightly different from each other. 

The Pad Kee Mow had a strong bamboo taste. The vegetables were slightly raw but were still seasoned. 

The Roasted Duck Curry was sweet and not too spicy. 

The amount of rice my friend received was pretty huge. Potentially enough for two people.

The inside of the restaurant was clean but not the bathroom. There were a lot of flies flying near the toilet and toward my face, so I washed my hands as fast as I could. I recommend not using the bathroom here.

I will probably come back here but only in the daytime and with other people. I don't think I will be Thai-erd of this place any time soon!
author: Kristina M.

description:
Phenomenal curry. No, not phenomenal for vegannn curry. AMAZING CURRY ON ANY AND ALL SCALE!!!!

The Pros:
- Clean, date-y, candle-lit ambiance.
- Good, courteous service
- No wait - We came in around dinner time 7pm on a Friday and didn't have to wait for a seat
- Their Avocado Shrimp Curry is an absolute must. I still drool at the thought.

The Meh:
- Located in the Tenderloin.. just be wary of your surroundings when you leave
author: Vy T.

description: Best Thai food I have ever had! The waitress was super sweet and the restaurant is clean and gorgeous inside. We asked for recommendations and our waitress said we should get the catfish dish and I am glad she did because wow! Sounds strange to get vegan catfish but it is cooked perfectly and is nice and crispy with so much flavor.. I've never had anything like it! Also the Thai green curry fried rice was bursting with flavor! But the Thai crepe dish for dessert was INSANELY good!! The ice cream and strawberries with the warm crepe was one of the best desserts I have ever had. No complaints this place is magical!
author: McKenna S.

description: The place was extremely hot..I was actually sweating. The place has no ventilation whatsoever and I know that because I just got home and all.my clothes smell like food.....the wine was good for the price and they have you a large portion for 9 us ..my friend red thai curry soup was good...  but .my pad thai was glue together overcook.hey theres some idea open your windows and work on your pad t..just an Idea.and maybe I can come back.
author: Max S.

description:
I've come here on a couple of different occasions. I originally just had Pad Thai and wasn't very impressed, but once I branched out and grabbed some more dishes, I became hooked!

AMBIANCE is small, yet comfy with a modern feel. The spot is in the Tenderloin, close to Civic Center BART and AMC Van Ness 14. I've come here with friends and by myself, and have had a good time. The staff are attentive for the most part and make sure food comes out efficiently. 

ORDERED in the past: crab rangoon, chicken pad thai, spicy catfish.

FOOD is incredible! I recommend everyone try the crab rangoon (how is there not dairy in this?), and especially the spicy catfish- which has become one of my favorite dishes to date.

RATING is a fishy four. Fortunately this spot is within walking distance of my apartment, which means I won't be a stranger!
author: Nicholas G.

description:
Ordered pick up, was ready in 15 minutes. So can't really comment on service other than food came out quickly considering I also ordered it near closing time (sorry for being that girl).

Red curry/ pad see ew is what I ended up ordering and I was pleasantly surprised by both. Although my carnivore friend who ate some of my food was like, "Blah, still tastes vegan." I was pleasantly surprised! The curry was flavorful and the fake chicken was definitely more edible than some other places I've been to.

Loved the pad see ew. Definitely wonder how much sugar was put into both of these items because it was really good. Recommend giving Thai Idea a try if you need a break from meat.
author: Arezou A.

description:
Came here for dinner looking for something tasty for my vegan bf. Came on a Sunday night around 6pm and there was only 3 people here. The location is alright, a bit of a walk from downtown. Ambiance was quiet and calm with friendly staff. 

We ordered the pad Thai and a pineapple fried rice as they charge for a bowl of rice if you order the curry! -.- and it's  $2.75 for a bowl. 

- Pad thai: It came out in a nice presentation, steaming hot. Had a good flavor as I tasted the lemon. The noodles was good too, perfect texture and chew. The vegetables I wish had more flavor and was fresh (canned baby corn), green beans had no flavor as we did not include egg into the dish. 

-Pinapple fried rice: It came out looking alright.  The cashew and raisins really threw me off but it was good. The pineapples tasted old, 
as its been sitting out on the table after being poured from the can. The rice was good itself with a lot of flavor, so points there. My bf said it wasn't even hot though, didn't come out steaming. So I'm not sure if it was 100% fresh. 

Overall, it filled my belly but I was not satisfied after the meal. We ended up going to Ikes up the block afterwards.
author: Sharon L.

description:
This restaurant was literally right next door to our hotel, and we were way too tired to walk anywhere so we came here for lunch. 

They were pretty empty for a sat lunch, and the place didnt fill up till about 30 min later.  We ordered the tom yum soup, pad kee mao, and an order of brown rice. 

The food came out pretty quickly and was really hot and fresh. I added a few small spoons of the chili pepper to my food and it made it extra delicious and spicy.   The tom yum soup was a little salty, and you definitely have to eat it with rice. The pad kee mao wasn't salty at all and had a good flavor. 

I want to come back and try their fried dishes !
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
I first went to San Francisco in 2002 & during that visit made a pilgrimage to Eric Tucker's Millennium restaurant that was in the Tenderloin yet is now based in Oakland's Rockridge neighborhood.

The Tenderloin is still the Tenderloin as it reminds me of how Times Square in NYC used to be. Times Square has changed yet the TL still has a gritty edge to it along w/ being a great place to visit if you are a vegan.

There is Golden Era, Thai Idea Vegetarian, L & G for a tofu Banh Mi, & the energy of Millennium's legacy in the neighborhood. In fact it was countless visits to Golden Era over the last few months that have kept me from visiting Thai Idea sooner yet am glad I made the visit. 

Thai is always a good idea & is especially a good idea if you dine at an all vegetarian restaurant called Thai Idea Vegetarian. It is in fact an ovo-vegetarian restaurant that is vegan except for serving eggs & dishes can easily be made vegan be omitting the egg on selected dishes.

The website link to Thai Idea on Yelp was down so the prices listed on Yelp were in fact higher than prices actually are here. Besides that rice isn't an additional charge as rice comes w/ all the dishes except if you have brown rice there is a minimal charge of around .50 cents which is very reasonable.

Many of the dishes offer choice of protein as either: 
veggie chicken
veggie beef
tofu
veggie shrimp
veggie lamb

As is the case w/ dining at a vegan or vegetarian restaurant there is too much choice. I decided to go w/ the Green Curry as my server recommended it.

The Green Curry came w/ bell pepper, bamboo shoots, eggplant, string bean, baby corn, & basil. I opted to get it w/ veggie chicken. It was quite good & not too spicy yet spiced it up a bit w/ the spice condiments.

I look forward to returning here again in the future.
author: Shane S.

description:
Me and my friend are visiting San Fran for a few days, from Santa Monica. We came here for dinner and we were glad to see that their menu have a lot of options. All the meals there are Vegetarian, and they can make it Vegan for you.
I tried their soup and my friend had the Pad Thai. The soup was served in a big ball, its enough for two people.
Overall very clean restaurant and nice staff.
author: Yamit Y.

description:
Absolutely delicious!! Typical Thai fare with a few Japanese and Indian dishes in a very non typical manor...100% plant-based! Whether you're a veg-head or not, this place is definitely worthy of a try! Their use of plant proteins is so imaginative! Surely to impress anyone. 

All dishes are vegetarian with the option to make them vegan (ex. minus egg on pad Thai). Just ask! 

I started with some Thai lychee iced tea which was light, refreshing and delightful. For our party of three (with leftovers) we then ordered...

Tom Yum Soup: 
I must admit I consider myself somewhat of a Tom Yum snob as I eat a ton of it. The bowl here was up there with some of the best I've EVER had. Perfect flavor. Perfect broth. Perfect amount of spice and basil, and it definitely contained the most veggies I've had in Tom Yum, that's for sure. 

Panang curry with "shrimp" and avocado:
The "shrimp" blew me away. I've had my fair share of faux meats but this "shrimp" was not only of the same consistency, but the same shape and taste also! I'm so fascinated and highly impressed by this use of strictly plant based proteins! I also loved the addition of creamy avocado! 

"Shrimp" Pad Thai:
We opted to go ahead and add that delicious "shrimp" to their pad Thai which was perfectly peanut-y, but not overpowering. Noodles cooked just right and topped with fresh shredded carrots as well as the bean sprouts. Great kiddo option and big enough to split between two littles. 

Service was topnotch 
Street parking was easy 
Atmosphere was welcoming and clean. 
Food came out remarkably quick and was presented beautifully. 
Prices were reasonable. 

I honestly have no reason not to give this place a flawless rating and as much as I do not like to repeat restaurants when I travel, I will certainly hit this one up again. The Bangkok "duck", ahi "tuna" and "crab" cakes are next...
author: Sari Marissa G.

description:
Super exited to have tried this place as I was looking for something new to try near my conference and it was a Friday night and none of us wanted to fight any more crowds than we had to so this place turned out to be a hidden gem in a basically bad neighborhood.

So first off if you have a car this is not the best area to find parking that is both safe and within walking distance.  I had first thought that the spots in front of the restaurant were available to park but after a period of time one of the servers informed me that the car spot was not available, wasn't quite sure who could park there but I appreciated the heads up vs getting some nasty ticket which in SF is going to be steep.  The staff also warned me not to park around the corner because she said there are people hanging out and they will break into your car.  Again thanks for the heads up.  I ended up parking a couple blocks away and removed everything from my car and it worked out ok.  

So once you get the parking situation figured out the place is very modern and inviting and surprisingly not crowded or noisy.  The staff  are super friendly and helpful letting you know about the different dishes.  Was very happy with their suggestions.  We got the larb salad to start and it was incredibly good.  I have never seen a veggie version of this anywhere and wow they did a great job.  it was ground tofu with greens and lettuce and shaved beets and herbs with a super big kick of chili peppers.  Totally recommend this dish.  It almost can also be used as your side of rice as it really went well with the other dishes.  We also got the yum woon sen salad which is basically a glass noodle salad with veggie shrimp and chicken.  Again most places do not have a veggie version of this dish and it's light and delicious.   

For main courses again everything looked great but I decided on the jungle curry which seemed to have a lot of veggies and it was a lighter dish not having any coconut milk.  The dish looked great and filled with fresh veggies and it went great with the rice.  I'm not much of an eggplant fan but it was really good in this dish.  

One warning is the spice levels here are some of the spiciest I have had for a Thai restaurant.  I asked for Thai hot so just be prepared that if will get what you ask for. On top of that they will bring you all kinds of condiments to add even more heat.  I was pretty much asking for extra napkins.  

Prices are very reasonable considering how fresh everything tasted.  They will also give you to-go boxes if you want to take anything home.
If I lived in the City I'd be here a lot because there is so much on the menu to try and it's tastes pretty darn authentic to my American taste buds.  5 stars for sure.
author: Ron K.

description:
THIS IS FOR THEIR TO-GO!

First time ordering here and I ordered to-go:

Ordered a veggie pad kee mao, spicy and it was made in a timely fashion. Everything on the menu is reasonably priced. There is a plethora of Thai restaurants in the Tenderloin, so which one do you choose? Good question. If you are a vegetarian or vegan, then this place is for you! They have mock meat (beef and chicken, don't worry, it's meatless) so if you're feeling up for it, you won't miss the meat ;) Very interesting idea as I love thai food!

It is not that far from Market St. downtown, so it is highly accessible on public transportation. Keep in mind that it is not in the most safest of neighborhoods, but do not that deter you from getting your comfort food.

Happy eating!
author: Jenn N.

description:
Eh. There are some vegan spots that WOW me and go beyond a vegan substitute for something that usually has meat. Those are the places that convince folks that vegan food can be awesome. Thai Idea is one of those places that puts a placeholder on for the meat and convince people that vegan can be doable. Personally: I tend to be less excited about this type of vegan spot. The meat substitutes were... Ok? The flavors were... Fine? There are bolder flavors to be had in SF's Thai repertoire for those who consume fish sauce, but if you're seeking out a vegan version or wanting to try some meat substitutes: do it.

I will say that I have never been this excited about brown rice before... Not sure which type it is or how they prepared it, but that really was delicious rice.
author: Anastasia Z.

description:
I was SO IMPRESSED BY THEIR CAT FISH. please try it. One of my vegan friends recommended this place and swore to us that it's going to be good. As a meat lover, I was skeptical at first but thought, WHY NOT? 

This place did not disappoint. We ordered another meat dish and curry dish in addition to the cat fish, with brown rice on the side and thai tea. The whole meal was so tasty and fulfilling, and you can tell everything is of quality. However though. I HIGHLY recommend that you order the cat fish. It literally tastes like fish (and the texture too), but with less fishiness, why actually makes it amazing. 

I've only been there once so I don't have as much to say at the moment. However, I will say that I will definitely come back to this place soon. I recommend that if you are not normally into vegan food, come try this place anyway! Asian vegan food is very different than the american kind and I think it's totally worth a try.
author: Jen K.

description: Stumbled in here while looking for a Thai place to do dinner, and since I'm vegetarian it seemed like a win. I found the restaurant to be small but nice. The ambiance was great and all of the food is presented beautifully. We had the firecracker sushi appetizer, crispy duck with tamarind and green curry with tofu. The food itself was decent - but I didn't really find any of it to be memorable. The duck was a strange texture (not very much crispiness to it, I was expecting a bit more) and the curry needed more coconut cream and spiciness to make it more flavorful and filling. The vegetables were undercooked and the curry was watery, at best. I would definitely give it another chance and come back, but as there are so many other restaurants in the city, I won't be rushing to do so.
author: Noel P.

description:
(Backstory/Fluff)
I had plans to meet up with a friend this past Saturday and we originally wanted to go to Brenda's.  I've heard about lines from friends, read about them in the reviews, saw pictures, but like an idiot, I completely underestimated them because I thought nobody else wanted to eat at 2 PM.  What an odd time, right?  Wrong.  Completely and utterly wrong.

I found parking on Turk about an hour early and should have put my name down then, but I didn't.  I read in my car and then headed over at 1:45... only to find that there were 20 other parties ranging from 2 to 4 people ahead.  Dang.

So I opened up Yelp and just searched for restaurants nearby, restaurants that weren't going to be closed at 3/4 to set-up before dinner service.  And that, my fellow Yelpers, is how I ended up at Thai Idea Vegetarian, just one block up from Brenda's on Polk Street.  

The restaurant was empty save for a group of three toward the back.  I chose a table set up for four at the front near the window which, in retrospect, was not the best spot.  (Saturday was just not. my. day.)  As our late lunch wore on, my poor friend ended up being completely in the sun.  Our server, Nan, was such a sweetheart, though, and offered to help us move our dishes over to another table.  

Speaking of dishes, we went with the following:

tom yum soup w/ vegetables - 10.25
thai fried rice w/ "chicken" - 11.25
panang curry w/ vegetables and fried tofu - 11.25

Given where this story began one might imagine how easy it would be to be completely let down by every vegan bite when you had Brenda's as your original target.  Nevertheless, my friend and I enjoyed all three dishes even though if I were to come here again, I'd forgo any sort of meat substitute and just stick with vegetables and tofu.  The chicken in the Thai fried rice didn't look at all like chicken and while it tasted just fine, the visual piece messed with me.  

I hadn't seen this particular friend in a while so I was grateful for the more peaceful atmosphere at Thai Idea.  If we had managed to get to Brenda's we would probably have struggled to hear one another.  Things happen for a reason I suppose...
author: Iona C.

description: omg such a great vegan spot, i really appreciate that when you order something with egg in it, the waitress right away asked is egg OK? so if you forget to say something she will catch it! The firecracker balls (sans the egg) are so delicious! Love this place!
author: Kat C.

description:
A small, cozy vegetarian Thai restaurant.  Service was good and the waitress was very knowledgeable about soy, vegan vs. vegetarian and gluten allergies.  

Even though I was eating by myself and not picky about where I sat, the waitress saw another table open because the group of 8-10 was essentially just hanging around the restaurant and blocking people's paths for about 15 minutes (seriously - who does that?? Just stay seated at the table or leave the restaurant) and she offered to move me to a bigger table away from them, but I said it was okay as I didn't feel like I should be taking up 4 seats.  This definitely speaks to great customer service.

What I ordered:

1. Vegetarian Thai samosas:  these were okay.  I liked the crispiness of the skin, but there wasn't much filling inside so that was disappointing.  

2.  Spicy "catfish" plus a side of brown rice: OMG.  This tasted like authentic Thai food for sure.  I'm not sure I got the catfish taste or reference, but it was perfectly seasoned, lots and lots of veggies and some meat substitute.  The sauce and taste was so good, I had to add an order of brown rice to fully absorb the taste.

Verdict: If you want something different and Asian vegan, great place to try.  Also loved the decor.
author: Bernie C.

description:
We all have those omnivorous friends and family members who live in mocking disbelief that a meal without meat could ever be any good. All I can say is bring them here! This is vegetarian done right: respectable portions, tons of flavor, attentive service--there was nothing about the experience that I would change.

I wanted to try everything! The pineapple fried rice, the shrimp curry, the tamarind duck, and those firecracker balls looked bomb, but I settled for the pad see ew with both tofu and chicken (couldn't decide on a protein).

The presentation was beautiful; the plate was adorned with a fresh orchid and a little bundle of spiralized beet, which I actually ending up eating. The flavors were spot on. It tasted like classic pad see ew--very savory and a bit sweet, and I love that they're not fully vegan because this dish is not complete without a whole egg scrambled into the noodles. The protein / noodle / vegetable ratio was excellent too. A lot of places cheat you on the protein, but there was plenty of tofu and faux chicken. I was pleasantly surprised by the texture of the latter, but you should know that I can't stand real chicken. In all honesty I much prefer its veggie-based counterpart, which isn't very similar in taste.

The service was unexpectedly thorough. I requested chopsticks and she brought them, along with some red pepper sauces I hadn't even asked for yet but nonetheless appreciated. Several times, my water was refilled before it was empty. Price-wise it was average--fair, I'd say, for what you get. 

I'll definitely be going back.
author: Ellery D.

description: The place is small and quaint.The service was great. My server kept up on my water and checked back with me after my food was served. The Tom kha with tofu was delicious. The pumpkin curry with tofu was fine but the tofu was over cooked and tasted like rubber. I ended up picking the tofu out. The pumpkin, veggies and curry sauce were good. I was charged an extra $2.75 for rice. I am not a fan of having to pay for rice when curry dishes will usually come with rice. Overall the food was good but I don't feel it was worth $30.92 (not counting the tip). I am glad I tried this restaurant but most likely would not come back.
author: Kate G.

description:
Love the fact that it's a fully vegetarian/mostly vegan restaurant, but I was underwhelmed with my boyfriend's dish, Thai Idea Duck.  Then again, he was the one who ordered it and he liked it so maybe disregard my opinion of his dish haha.  My dish, Volcanic Beef, was really tasty and I thoroughly enjoyed it though it wasn't really "beefy".  It's also nice to finally be at a restaurant where I can order off the Chef's Specials section of the menu. 

The ambiance was nice, and I'd definitely go there again.
author: Rachel W.

description: This is one of the best Thai restaurants I have ever been to. I ordered veggie shrimp pad Thai and one other dish I can't remember the name of but they were both delicious even the veggie shrimp. Unlike some other Thai food, it was neither greasy or salty. I'm pretty particular when it comes to going out to eat especially since I'm completely vegan and hate it when restaurants put too much oil and salt. I'm definitely coming back here next time I'm in town.
author: Lydia C.

description: Ladies always give the best service and food is amazing. they are a mostly vegan restaurant but do offer some vegetarian stuff. my fave is the bbq rice. becareful when ordering a plate spicy bc they mean business!!! delicious food, amazing place, great service and they offer late night delivery too!!
author: Lupe V.

description:
This place has a lot of potential. Unfortunately, we were a little disappointed. We had been on a quest to find some of the best vegetarian/vegan food in the city and finished with Thai Idea. We ordered the pad Thai and spicy fried rice. I know it doesn't seem like much but the issue is that most of their dishes are the same with about one ingredient difference (i.e. carrots instead of baby corn) It seems like they have a lot but it really isn't much. The beef or chick substitute (not sure what it was) they had was pretty good but the flavor in the dishes was lacking quite a bit. 

We ended the meal with fried banana and coconut ice cream which was...different. I personally didn't like the bananas but the ice cream was okay. I wouldn't recommend it unless you know you like fried bananas. 

I like to describe this place as somewhere you know you can grab a quick bite on the weekend while you're tipsy & on the way home.
author: Brittany W.

description: This is vegan heaven!!!! I loved this place so much!!! I got Pad Eggplant with vegan beef dish, it was missing some salt for flavor but was so good. I tried my friends coconut soup with vegan chicken... This was the best dish I have ever had. I'm not sure how they make it, but it is so delicious!!!! I will definitely come back when I come back to the city.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night with a group of friends. We ordered 3 appetizers to share and some entrees.

Firecracker Balls - Couldn't really tell what I was eating, but it was a good fried ball piece.
Thai Samosas - Deep fried with some potatoes inside. It tasted a bit sweet which I found strange. Not really a fan.

Fresh Salad Rolls - Beautiful presentation, this was my favorite out of all the appetizers.
Pineapple Fried Rice - Typical pineapple fried rice.
Pad Thai - Nice presentation, was good
Pad Kee Mow - Good
Jungle Curry - Didn't like this curry, was a bit plain
Pad Basil (Kra-Praw) - Loved the veggie chicken in this dish.
Spicy Cat Fish - The veggie cat fish was nice and crispy. This was my favorite entree dish.

Great vegetarian Thai food place. I would definitely recommend if you're a vegan/vegetarian!
author: Jocelyn M.

description:
Writing this from the perspective of a carnivore. The food itself was just OK. We got the wing bomb, the samosas, curry + shrimp and Tom yum soup. The wing bomb was the best of these choices, best "meat" and best seasoned. The samosas were hardly filled and not very flavorful. Our main dishes had strange non-meat fillers that to us did not taste good. 
That being said, the service was great and the food came out extremely quickly.
author: Emma B.

description: We found this place randomly after searching for food post-movie at AMC Van Ness. Thankfully, we got there just before they stopped serving. I had the Thai Iced Tea which was made with soy milk. I could tell it wasn't real milk but it still tasted great! We got the Pad Thai and Cashew Nut stir fry. By mistake, she brought us Pad See Ew at first but had already realized her mistake so gave us the dish for free! That was really nice and we ended up loving the Pad See Ew, as well. Everything tasted amazing and even though I'm non-vegetarian, I honestly didn't even miss meat. Great flavors and value since you get several meals out of each dish. I highly recommend this place whether you're veg or non-veg!
author: Pooja C.

description:
First time I came here with my husband and I for a date night. I had absolutely no complaints! Everything was amazing. The service, the food, the efficiency. I mean I haven't had a 5 Star service like this in a very long time. Service was so good my husband tipped $25.00 and he is NOT a tipper !!!! The desert was so AMAZING! We booked our reservation for Valentines Day right then and there it was so good. 
Well we came back for Valentines a Day, it was a complete disaster. It seemed like a whole different restaurant. The waiters were rushing us. The lady took my plate away when I was in mid bite. I couldn't believe it. The presentation of the food was horrible. It was like night and day! She spilled the water all over the table, we didn't get silverware, the bill came out before my food. I was so disappointed, this was suppose to be such an amazing day for us, yet I talked about how disgusted I was the whole time we were there. The desert they brought out was unacceptable. The first 4 pictures are from the first time the picture after was Valentine's Day. Unfortunately, I will never be returning here. Sucks because the first experience was PERFECT !
author: Schanta L.

description: Visited Thai vegatarian for first time on Blue Angels Sunday, so it was not busy.  Great value if your looking for a low price restaurant.  My standards are no meat, no soy and no vegtable oil.  The waitress was kind enough to help navigate me through to find what I preferred.   Healthy size portions, fast service.  Very good environment  inside the restaurant.  They definitly deserve 5 stars because of the value that is delivered.  Delicious for a very fussy eater.
author: Gavin M.

description:
Been there - done that!
We were quite disappointed in our food - just did not like the way things were seasoned or prepared. The Thai Enoki (deep fried mushrooms) had no flavor at all - in fact we were not even sure that most of it was not just fried batter! The fresh salad rolls had very little flavor and we did not care for the sauces that came with them. The See Ew-Veg we liked the best. It did actually have good flavor. We would not eat here again.

https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60713-d2640636-r526153000-Thai_Idea_Vegetarian-San_Francisco_California.html#
author: Cinda S.

description:
Amazing service. Quick food 
Good convenient location.  No Parking in the area 
Had tom yon soup and pineapple fried rice.  
The broth is so tasty and delicious 
Amazing and very affordable. 
I will become a regular.
author: David C.

description:
I went here by myself on a Monday night and the place was completely empty. I didn't expect much but boy was I wrong. 

I got the golden cauliflower at the server's suggestion and she did not steer me wrong. The whole menu looked delicious but I opted for the sweet and sour veggies with tofu (my go-to) and a side of brown rice. I've been vegetarian for half my life and I can tell you that most places do tofu horribly wrong -- not Thai Idea. The tofu was the perfect texture! And there was so MUCH food I had to take half of it to go...and I ate it in my hotel room later that night. No shame.
author: Dani W.

description: Found this when we were just driving past and quickly checked the reviews and walked in. All three dishes we ordered were amazing - papaya salad, crispy cauliflower and the Thai fried rice.. was one of the better veg Thai restaurants we've tried in a while now. :)
author: Geetha B.

description: I LOVE 100% Veggie spots and this one did not disappoint. I was thrilled to have a menu full of all things vegetarian. To warm me up after a chilly stroll in the city, I ordered a delicious soup with veggies and noodles. My husband got broccoli and tofu and the sauce it was in was amazing - definitely one of the best I've had (and to know it was definitely vegetarian made it that much better). We also shared a pot of tea. I only wish there was a larger menu because I love having options but I still can't complain. I also wasn't a huge fan of the tofu in my husbands dish - maybe it was because it was fried or seemed to be sitting (she initially handed him a plate of broccoli and when he asked for tofu she came back out with it one minute later). None the less, there are still plenty of delicious options to choose from and it was all tasty and satisfying.
author: Ashley F.

description:
Thai food is typically a safe choice. Typically. I'm
A vegetarian. When I saw a vegetation Thai food place, I was excited. I am visiting from out of town; too tired to go out, I decided to order in via third party service. 

Good: the delivery was super fast. It came in within 15 minutes, which is quite impressive

Not good. Bad. Very bad: the food!!! I ordered fresh rice paper rolls. These are perhaps 2 rolls cut in 4 pieces, presented as 8. The rice papers are quite thick. Never had them these thick. The idea of rice paper rolls is for the filler ingredients to sing. All I tasted was the thick skinned rice paper. Thank goodness I asked for extra peanut sauce. It helped mask the flavor of the dish. 
I also ordered pad Thai. My go to main dish at Thai restaurant. It's hard to go wrong with it.  It's a safe choice. Well, not here. I added 'fake chicken'. Well, it tasted and smelled gross. I took a bite and set it aside and decided not to eat it. I decided to stick with the noodles. Well, there were not many. As the dish was overpowered with bean sprouts and raw carrot 'noodles'. And I believe they did not salt it. The dish was inedible for me. I felt bad but I had throw in the bin. 
SFO is a hub for amazing food , especially vegetarian and vegan. For the first time, I have been disappointed.
author: Ruhi B.

description: Dropped in just to order a Thai iced tea ($3). It was a bit too sweet, but delicious nonetheless. Server was sweet and helpful.
author: Adrienne L.

description:
Loved the service and loved the amazing food. We have tried quite a few Thai restaurants and this one has a really delicious food especially the coconut soup. Above all it's only vegetarian food...
The server was helpful and knew her stuff
author: Vitaliy P.

description: I dined between the hours of 2 to 5pm and there was only 4 other patrons in the place. It made the atmosphere more relaxing to sit and decompress from a hectic day. I was served immediately and the food was ready shortly after. I had Tea, the Thai Samosas,  and the Penang Curry w/o chicken. Only veggie and no tofu. It was very good. The sauce was flavorful and slightly spicy (love spicy) and was great over the rice. The Samosas was good but slightly flat.  I will visit again.
author: Mag D.

description: Hands down the sweetest little cafe serving THE tastiest Thai dishes around! SO delicious you forget it's vegetarian TOO! Best portions, healthyclean and tasty choices, classy service  and reasonably priced, Can't find better!
author: Eliane L.

description:
I feel like I need to preface this review by mentioning that I'm not from San Francisco and was visiting from NYC for several days this month.  I had no frame of reference for vegan Asian food and the only thing guiding me to Thai Idea was a quick search on Google, with sporadic WiFi while wandering around another neighborhood, for "vegan food".  i was able to see very good ratings and stars and all sorts of things that led to me saying, "OKAY, GPS, TAKE ME THERE."  And so I went.

I'm not one of these New Yorkers who thinks everything in "my" city is the best.  Indeed, I'm often willing to concede that, yeah, a restaurant in Indianapolis is so damned good and should find its way to the Upper West Side because I'd be there all the time.  That's how I feel about Thai Idea.  As soon as I walked in and was seated immediately by a very nice young woman, I felt at home and knew -- or at least hoped -- that the whole experience would be worth the trek.

And oh, it was.  This is a very casual place, and everyone already there seemed to be having a good time, eating their food happily, and even though I was alone, I felt like I would soon be joining their ranks and didn't feel out of place at all.  No one pointed at me and said, "Oh my god, she's not from around here and has never seen this menu before.  LOL."

The only problem with this place is that there are so many options on the menu and I wanted all of them.  Literally.  And I mean *that* literally.  I was in a noodle mood(le), though, so I chose the Pad Kee Mao with tofu (and veggies).  For the life of me I can't remember if I ordered an appetizer.  How is that even possible that I don't remember, especially knowing that 99.4% of the time I order an appetizer?

I don't like small food.  This portion did not disappoint.  It was the perfect size and wonderfully seasoned, the ideal degree of spiciness.  My mouth was singing a cute little song and I may have hummed very softly to myself as I took the first few bites, and thought, "Can I sit here all day and just order another entree every half hour?"

The service was brisk and efficient yet friendly without being annoyingly attentive.  I felt welcome and like a "native" here.  The entire time I was eating, I was thinking how much I wish this place existed in NYC and that no doubt I'd be a regular and thus have the opportunity to try every single item on the menu.

When I visit San Francisco again, I'll definitely be back, will make sure to order an appetizer, remember what it was, try another entree, and order another one "to go", while knowing that I'll be finding somewhere to sit about ten minutes after leaving the restaurant and eating it with my fingers if I forget to pack a traveling fork.
author: Jodi V.

description:
Not only did I find my favorite hotel ever in SF, right downstairs is this amazing vegetarian Thai restaurant. I've never been a huge experimenter with thai food as I can't stand when there is coconut in anything - like many of the thai curries. However, I was excited that this place was pure vegetarian. And oh man, their imitation meats were fabulous. I was so impressed.

I asked for a recommendation, and the very sweet server offered the Pad Kee Mow. It was pretty spicy - which she warned about. I am usually fine with that, it was just a bit shocking the first few bites. Haha. I got the imitation chicken inside it. It was a little darker "meat" than I would have expected, but the texture and taste was fabulous. We also got the roti. It didn't come with any kind of sauce, which was odd. But we used my boyfriend's yellow curry. That went together great. My boyfriend also got a soy thai iced tea. It was different for him, but we both really liked it.

I was really impressed with this spot overall. We were waited on attentively. There were only some small downsides, like the specials drink menu looking really crumpled and raggedy. Nothing too notable - it was pretty good!
author: Melanie P.

description:
We came here to Thai Idea because it was rated as "Top 3 Thai" places in San Fran. The vegetarian idea was not bad, I got all the eggplant and tofu I could eat. What I found interesting was an event that happened: We sat at table 2 next to the window. A homeless lady walked in, walked up to table 1, said "Excuse me I'm really hungry" and took a handful of food from table 1, and left. In the next second the waitress walked over and offered to bring a new plate of food out. All this took less than 10 seconds! I was a bit surprised by the audacity of what the destitude will do (But I'm not really), but really amazed at how well the staff handled the situation. It easily could have been me and my table (give I was 4 feet away). So I give Thai Idea Vegetarian 5 stars for the class. Oh the food was good too. Good Thai food, and good Thai Iced Tea.

The location is located on Eddy Street, in the middle of a not-so-upscale area. Parking is non-existent here. You'll have to find a lot. My hotel was across the street so I was lucky enough to just walk here. The restaurant is a bit small so there was a wait to get the table. However once you get past the standard stuff you'll enjoy a good time out. Great for dates or just a fun hang out spot.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Storage solutions. 
Let's talk about 'em. 

Ok, maybe not you and I but certainly this business who is next level using its bathroom as a junk drawer for random supplies and some cleaning products that I'm honestly a little skeptical even get used... or at least never get used in the disaster of a bathroom that is also swarming with flies, has duct tape over the otherwise open drainage hole in the floor, and is just not anything you want to see from a place you're about to eat in. It was cute when Carrie Bradshaw used her oven as a shoe rack... restaurants storing their high chairs next to the sh*tter is not. 

I'm truly astonished with the nearly 5-star review here until my dining partner and I took note of the completely empty dining room, less the people who came in to pick up carry-out items. I think maybe you'll enjoy the food here more if you never set foot in the bathroom... which on top of all the problems noted above also has a massive full sized garbage can in there that was overflowing with trash... at 4pm on a Sunday when there were ZERO customers in the place. I'm 100% certain the bathroom is never cleaned to any sort of ethical food-service establishment standard and 20% certain there was a single spider leg in my order of 'Volcano Beef'. 

Speaking of the Volcano Beef... I realize the place is vegan but the 'beef' was the worst veggie beef I've ever had. Veggie beef at Asian restaurants is pretty much my favorite thing ever since I stopped eating meat a decade-ish ago and this was by far the worst I've encountered. Maybe if they called it chicken I'd have been more forgiving but straight up it was flavorless beige protein chips that they dumped on top of a random salad mix that just got in the way of the only thing that might have had flavor: the thimble of sauce underneath all the garnish. 

What really bummed me out was that this was supposed to be a spicy dish noted for its "smocked" chili sauce. At first I'd assumed they'd just spelled 'smoked' incorrectly but when the dish came it was just the boring protein, lots of garnish, possible spider leg, thimble of sauce and then on the side they brought out the little community container of Sambal Oelek (but likely off brand or out of date since it wasn't as flavorful) and I'm like... what.the.hell? Did I order this dish deconstructed or something? Why are they serving the only thing that the dish was named for like an afterthought?

Service was fine but like, I've never gone to eat somewhere and been so close to walking out after seeing the state of their bathroom. For real, when I walked in the toilet seat was up so I lowered it with my foot and upwards of 4 flies came out of resting. And when we got the check there was a plastic spoon with a smiley face drawn on it in permanent marker attached to the pen and the spoon was full of dust, lint, and dirt and I had to wonder how many complimentary dust bunnies I'd possibly consumed on other plate-ware thanks to Thai Idea. 

And I know I sound like a real jerk off here but like... I'm a mess, too. I get it. But when people come over to my place I have enough sense and shame to try and spot check with some bleach and wet wipes and shove obvious traces of my hoarding into closets and then pretend like I'm in the middle of purging stuff to bring to goodwill and I definitely don't hand them dust-collecting dirty spoons with smiley faces drawn on them and there's just a level of filth so flagrantly present here that its beyond even my very low health & cleanliness standards which anyone who knows me can tell you that's really something. 

The nicest thing I can say is that I stole a piece of baby corn out of my roommate's dish and it was pretty darn good but if you're gonna get food here I highly advise you order for pick-up or delivery with blissful ignorance of the state of their standards of cleanliness.
author: Candice G.

description:
This was a short Uber ride from our hotel (not a area I'd like to walk after dark) and the food was good.  We made reservations on a Monday evening and did not need them.  We ordered the fresh salad rolls as an app, the yellow lamb curry w/ brown rice and spicy catfish for dinner.  

The rolls came w/ a rather thick peanut sauce that reminded me more of plain ole chunky peanut butter.  It had some spice to it but I would have preferred it thinner.  The rice paper was too thick too, which made it hard to eat w/ out cutting them in half but the innards were fresh and tasty specially w/ a smear of the sauce.

The curry and spicy catfish were both very good, tho the catfish was not a tender piece of 'meat'.  We renamed it spicy pork.  We had no trouble cleaning our plates!  I would come back again.
author: Mardy L.

description: Quick service, fresh food, taste is good!  Friendly!  Good Thai iced tea!  Affordable.
author: Molly F.

description: Great great food! The fresh salad rolls are by far the best I've had in the city! Definitely coming back here!
author: Mansi D.

description:
Totally pleasant surprise and find! 
The atmosphere is moody and rich, great soft music playing. 
Super friendly customer service - the food came out fast. 
We tried the yellow curry and the fresh salad rolls. Full of flavor and displayed beautifully. 
Super excited to come back.
author: Alycia S.

description: Great atmosphere, fast service, huge selection, reasonable prices, excellent noodle and rice dishes, and some delicious thai iced tea. I wasn't too excited about our table which was right in the center of everything in front of the door, but other than that the experience was great. Glad we stopped by!
author: Taya A.

description:
Good food 
Good service 
Restaurant not very clean
Area not very safe
Good vegan shrimps
author: Aurel H.

description:
I absolutely loved this place! One of my favorite things to do while traveling is to try at least one new vegetarian/vegan place in the area since I'm trying to cut back on my meat consumption. I was visiting a friend in Daly City, and we decided to have dinner here since they had a large vegan/vegetarian selection. 

We ordered the crispy chicken over fried rice and panang curry with tofu as well as samosas to share. All three dishes were amazing! The samosas came first. They had excellent texture, crispy on the outside and warm and soft on the inside. It was a great appetizer to start us off. I've tried a lot of mock meats in my day and the "chicken" they use In the crispy chicken over fried rice almost had me thinking I was actually eating real chicken. The fried rice in the dish was really flavorful and paired well with the chicken. The panang curry was my favorite dish of the night. All the spices blended perfectly with each other and the mix of tofu and vegetables tasted even better smothered in the curry sauce. Come to think of it, anything would have tasted good smothered in that sauce. My friend, who was skeptical of vegan food, couldn't stop raving about how great it all was. 

On top of the unforgettable and healthy food, the service was courteous and welcoming. The food was plated really well and some of it was even garnished with a large purple flower. I will definitely make it a point to come back and try more food on this excellent restaurant's (large) menu.
author: Miguel H.

description:
I really appreciate a great vegetarian meal. I wish I loved this place, I really wanted to. 

Thai Idea Vegetarian is a cutesy little spot in the TL that serves vegetarian food with meat substitutes. A friend and I decided to come here for dinner a few nights ago. 

We started with the Tom Kha Veggie soup with soft tofu which I thought was too much on the sweet side. Once I added jalapeño vinegar and hot sauce, the acidity balanced out the sweet and it was much better.

Next, we ordered two mains to share. The spicy string beans with shrimp and pad basil with beef. The string beans was the better of the two dishes, but felt pretty neutral about it. The beef in the pad basil was white, which seemed a bit confusing to both of us (did they really give us "chicken"? But the waiter insisted it was "beef") The pad basil was bland, the beef was boring, and the sauce at the bottom needed way more flavor. 

Just an FYI, the textures of the meat were nothing like real meat (if you're looking for that sort of thing). The ambiance is great and the staff is super nice. 

Not sure I'd be back. While it was fine, I just feel too neutral about it.
author: Shereen A.

description: This place is delicious to me and my girlfriend came by for a vegetarian dinner it is so inexpensive looks very modern and beautiful dishes waiters are super fast and super friendly not pushy at all I very much enjoyed this place and I will definitely come back again
author: Aviad B.

description:
Such a cute restaurant, don't let "tenderloin" area throw you off. It's another world there.
Their teas are delicious, great plating, with an assortment of substitute options.
author: Geneva M.

description:
Everyone in San Francisco should come here!!!

The Best choice I must recommend if you look for good Thai food and you are vegetarian. 

The staff was cute, kind and service -mind.

Atmosphere was nice!!!
author: Pat R.

description:
The good- food was tasty and beautiful presentation. 
Then it so good- does not do separate checks!  They forgot one dish and we asked to cancel, but they refused.
author: Lisa W.

description:
At first I was a little skeptical cause it was in the TL, but it actually wasn't that bad. I wanted to eat something healthy so I came here. 

They had a pretty overwhelming menu. And when I say overwhelming, I mean it as a good thing. There were so many delicious dishes I couldn't choose from but went with the Tom Yum soup & Cauliflower appetizer. 

The Tom Yum soup was deeelicious but the cauliflower appetizer was not as good as I was hoping it to be. I didn't know it was going to be fried, given the fact that we wanted to eat something healthy. That's my bad though, not theirs.

The servers were attentive & sweet. They always refilled our waters & took away any dirty plates right away.

I would definitely come back when craving healthy Thai food in the area!
author: Janelli B.

description:
I only got takeout from this place but he food was so fantastic I had to leave a review!
We got the pad Thai and pad pet and it was excellent. The curry was very tasty, even without the meats. The veggies were fresh, nice and crunchy. The portions were also quite big. 
I would definitely recommend this place, prolly he best Thai in SF I've had. 

From the pictures the interior of the actual restaurant ado looks good so I'd want to take family/ friends here. It'll be a little hard to convince them because it's vegetarian but I think it's definitely worth it!
author: Arjan N.

description: As a vegetarian, I wanted to love Thai Idea -- I really did -- but the food, though hardy and plentiful, just lacked flavor.  I expected the green curry fried rice to be an explosion of flavor, but it was underwhelming.  The other dishes we ordered were equally forgettable.  That said, my dining partner was happy with his meal.  And the service was fast and friendly.  If I'm in the neighborhood and need a meal, I'd give it another go.  Who knows?  Maybe this was an off night.
author: beth t.

description: I've taken meat eaters here and they spend the dinner in astonishment--the food is so delicious they can't believe it's all vegetarian. My favorite dish is the vegan panang curry with veggie shrimp and avocado. It's pure heaven on a plate! The service is also prompt and attention is paid to the environment, with a soft lighting, pretty playing, and tasteful decor.
author: Mars W.

description: This place is amazing. Loved the vegan veggie crab cakes and 'shrimp' Penang curry with avocado. Highly recommend!
author: Isha S.

description:
If it wasn't for the shady roads we walked on to get here I'd give it 5 stars. If you want to go here consider being dropped off and picked up by a taxi instead of parking nearby or walking to the place.

I won't go into depth about the food and service as both were impeccable. I would just point out that we did not order any food with non-vegetarian names likes 'chicken' 'shrimp' etc, even though they were made with vegetarian protein. Instead we stuck to tofu...and we were not disappointed at all.
author: A Y.

description:
I usually subconsciously stray away from places that are 100% vegetarian, but I'm so glad I gave this place a shot! Definitely better than most regular Thai places I've ever been to.  We ordered the Tom Kha with tofu, the prawn/avocado panang curry, and Thai Idea duck.

Based on reviews, I had pretty high expectations for the duck - expecting it to be more like fake meat. What it actually is, is apparently steamed bean curd.  I would not consider it to be anything close to duck, but it was still delicious and very well flavored.

The avocado/prawn curry- I probably would not get this exact dish again, although I would definitely order their regular panang curry again.  Adding avocado in curry was just a little bit off to me.  Overall still delicious though. Plus, my boyfriend didn't mind and he loved the avocado addition!  I will definitely be ordering here again soon.
author: Evelyn T.

description: Love that this is all vegetarian. The food was all fine. Would've liked it a bit more flavorful (spice it up!). Service was friendly and the presentation of the food was nice for casual Thai.
author: Piper W.

description:
Amazing service, very clean and so yummy!!! Will definitely be coming again!!! 
I tried the crab cakes and they are to die for, as for their rice it is so good!!
author: Sarah M.

description:
My current year resolution is to be a vegetarian. So I ended up at this place as I wanted to try imitation meat. 
Trust me: don't waste your money on imitation meat. Either eat meat or don't.
I tried the imitation chicken legs which were made from soy which tasted nothing like chicken leg but definitely tasted nasty. I mean it's just not meant to be. 
Also the pineapple fried rice had some imitation shrimp and meat in it, which I was unable to pass down through my throat.
If you wanna choke yourself make sure you come here lol.
The servers were nice and I am sure the chef is good too. But the imitation meat is something not appetizing for someone who has tasted meat before.
For people who have never tasted meat, I am not sure if you might like it or not. Try at your own risk.
author: Urvish -.

description: Food is always great, and the "duck" is fantastic. Good prices too, most entrees are between $9-12.
author: Lindsay O.

description: I really love this restaurant for his vegan choices. But my parents prefer the more conventional taste. Price is a bit high but accessible. Service is ok and ambiance is classic
author: Lorenz D.

description:
This place is fantastic. This is my number one spot for whenever I have a Thai craving, and I'm not a vegetarian. The staff is always so friendly and so professional, the service is quick, and you never have to ask for anything! They make sure you are happy and full! This is a must stop for anyone in the city, living or visiting. 

My go to is the duck curry with brown rice, although everything I've had is fantastic. I don't think you can pick wrong.

Careful about up heading your spice - which is good news if you're a heat lover. I am and the second level was still a bit much for me, although my boyfriend found it perfect.
author: Crystal L.

description: I came here one late night after a couple drinks with some friends a couple months ago be been meaning to write a review so here it is! I've recently turned vegan and had helped this place. The photos also looked really good so I had to give it a try. I ordered three dishes, the fried shrimp rolls, the roasted duck curry, and my friend ordered the Pad Thai. All the dishes were so flavorful and well made. Friendly staff who even reposted my food photos on their Instagram page. They've won me over. Definitely coming back!
author: HENRY M.

description: This restaurant has amazing vegetarian food. And a very nice atmosphere. I have the opportunity to try their crabcakes. They were delicious. I will definitely go back.
author: Yvonne B.

description: After reading rave reviews about this place, my husband and I decided to eat at this Vegan Thai place. Sadly it wasn't as great :-( the Tom Kha soup was really sweet, the Deep Fried Enoki a bit too oily. The flat noodles we're good though. Overall a bit too $$ for the quality of food. The service as in most Asian restaurants was quick and very friendly!
author: Aparna R.

description: Here right now..... just enjoyed an amazing meal. We had chicken & shrimp pad kee mow, shrimp green curry. I forgot to mention you have to try the golden cauliflower appetizer. Everything here is so DELICIOUS. DID I MENTION TVAT EVERYTHING IS VEGAN!!! Side note the parking is good too. I'll definitely return
author: Simone D.

description:
I came here with a group of friends the other night. About half of us were vegetarian, half were not. I'm not a huge fan of imitation meat, but I kept an open mind. 

I loved the flavor in the pad ped. I also tried a bit of the coconut soup and the green curry. The veggies and the spices are combined perfectly, but I was not a fan of the tofu. It could just be my personal opinion of tofu in general, but I didn't care for the taste or texture of it. The service was very nice though. 

I'd go back here again and try something without any imitation meat, usually pad Thai is my go to Thai entree. Since it's only 2 blocks away I guess that's a possibility for next time.
author: Megan F.

description: Super duper delicious! The panang curry was off the charts. The Pumpkin Curry was really good too. But the best part, the food came out almost instantaneously. Now you might think, hold on, I don't want my food ready so quickly. To that I say, you must not have a rambunctious toddler. Plus, it's all vegan!!
author: Greg G.

description: Delicious food! We need a Thai Idea Vegetarian in Marin! We ordered the spicy Thai fried rice, crispy crab wontons, shrimp and avocado curry... All vegan! All scrumptious! I'll be back!
author: Yvonne G.

description: I went there for my b-day dinner with the family. They accommodate us nicely. Food was good even for the meat eaters that were skeptical about it. Servings are big so make sure to not go overboard!
author: Deborah T.

description:
I love me my fruits and veges but when things are purposefully vegetarian, I'm not the biggest fan.

But I'm not a meat-lover only either and like to try new foods, so I roll into Thai Idea anyways.  The interior is well decorated with a spacious ceiling and the servers are very friendly.

Upon the first look at the menu, you'd think that this was a regular Thai restaurant, all of their dishes use regular Thai dish names with meat names in the title "Volcanic Beef" "Spicy Catfish" "Lamb Curry", but then the description says vegetarian beef, vegetarian catfish, and vegetarian lamb; which makes you wonder what is vegetarian beef? or catfish?

Well it turns out the dishes are basically regular Thai dishes but with substituted meats.  The dishes were actually very flavorful and all had a good presentation.

WINGS BOMB - looks like you're eating a roasted chicken drum but tastes like you're eating ground chicken wrapped in a tofu skin. Not bad...

PUMPKIN CURRY with BEEF - just like what you'd expect in pumpkin curry, pumpkin, great curry sauce, slightly spicy and then some beef which tastes a little like the "chicken" meat  from the Wings Bomb dish.

SPICY CATFISH - this dish was actually quite surprising.  The "catfish" is a deep fried meat substitute, not bad, served alongside a ton of other stir fried vegetables (carrots, onion, etc) then garnished with whole black peppers (which were still green and still on the stalk) and a lemon leaf?

The prices ranged from roughly $13 per dish which isn't bad for what you're getting.

Thai Idea is a nice sit down restaurant, good tastes, presentation, and service, a place you wouldn't mind taking your date to.

I probably won't be craving Thai vegetarian food anytime soon again, but I have to give this place kudos for doing what they do very well.
author: Mike L.

description:
The food is great a very small restaurant with actually quite a nice selection of vegetarian food. I decided to become a vegetarian and find it hard to find food that dosent Taste like weeds so this was a breath of fresh air and solidified my decision. The yellow lamb curry was pretty good with the vegetable egg rolls  being the best!
I will definitely come back next time I'm in town!
Oh hell na as I'm leaving the waitress takes my season tray and gives it to the next customer... yuck!!!! I was double dipping my egg rolls in the soy sauce and because of this I now give 2 stars
author: Myesha W.

description:
Went here for dinner last night after many many many years! Wow!! the decor has improved and the food is sooooo good which was a great surprise because my memory of the food from when I last visited unfortunately was that food was so blah! 

We ordered
1. golden cauliflower
2. Spicy fried rice
3. Vindaloo curry with chik'n.

OMG! I absolutely loved the curry! it's listed under chef recommendations and a must try.

Everything on the menu is vegetarian and most things can be made vegan! This totally made my day!
author: Kinjal S.

description: I'm from San Diego but I was in town for an audition and discovered this little gem. It's located in a rough part of town, but the interior, the service, and the menu is all top tier quality. It is one of the few Thai places that I've been to where I feel healthy after eating. Granted, the price is a few bucks higher than most other Thai food restaurants, but that's because the ingredients are fresher and healthier than other venues. I ordered a red curry and got 2 bowls of rice for $19 and it was the best Thai curry I've ever had. The girls who work there are absolutely the kindest and most attentive waitresses I've had, and deserving of a nice tip. A crackhead walked in off the streets and started tripping out in the middle of the restataunt, and that still didn't lower my score for this place. I definitely recommend it.
author: Daniel S.

description: Flavorful vegetarian food. Servings are good size. Service could be slightly more attentive. But would repeat.
author: Avanish M.

description:
LISTEN YELPERS I got the Pad Thai and it was one of the Worst Pad Thai plates I have gotten .. It had NO flavor , the tofu was dry and in general just not  good.

If you're looking for a good place to have Pad Thai eat somewhere else because this place is disappointing.. I don't understand why it has 4.5 stars . Maybe I should have gotten a different dish. I was truly upset because the Yelp hype let me down ...

The place was nice and the service was great other than that it does not deserve its rating . 

SAVE YOUR MONEY
author: Cynthia R.

description: Food was good!my favorite part was the appetizers: I really liked the firecrackers, and the crispy tofu! I did like a lot also the green curry. While the Bangkok Duck was good but not a favorite. I will definitely go back to try other dishes that sounded delicious. The ambiance was cozy and more stylish than I expected in a small Thai restaurant in the Tenderloin. The service staff were adorable,  knowledgeable,  and very attentive to vegans. It is quiet enough for comfortable conversation. And I would say is more of a friends and family place,  meaning I would not choose it for a romantic night,  rather a casual one. Really liked it overall. It is not a wine place. The wine list is essential,  and looking around at all other tables, those who ordered alcoholic beverages had ordered beer. I asked for the house red wine and it was alright. I drank it. Definitely a repeat overall and worth recommending others.
author: Anna P.

description:
Food was pretty good. The service was not. 

Came here for a friend's birthday. We had a reservation for 6:15; and showed up ON THE DOT at 6:15. They were not prepared for our party of 10 and asked if we minded being seated separately. We did mind, since we were celebrating my friend's birthday, so we said no. They kept telling us the tables would be ready in 10-15 minutes, which wasn't true. They eventually sat 4 of us down (which was okay, since our remaining friends were finding parking), because they said the people next to us were just about finished. Unfortunately for us, and by no fault of the party next to us, they were taking quite a while to finish their food (the party on our right side seemed like they had just arrived and finished before they did). The host moved us to the other side of the restaurant before realizing the area they had given us was too cramped for 10 people and moved us back to the initial place they had allocated (once the other 2 parties left). When we complained, she simply stated "it's Saturday night and busy. It's first come first serve." Except almost every restaurant in the city is busy on a Saturday night. Mind you, by the time we finally got our table/party together, it was about 7/7:10. 

We shared our meal family style. We got the Panang curry with veggies and with tofu, and we got the Pad Thai, and the Pad Kee Mow. We all also got Thai Iced Teas, which tasted pretty good to me (I go to a lot of Thai restaurants and get Thai Iced Teas); but it didn't sit well with my friend. Everyone else was fine. 

The restaurant did make up for it because we did bring a cake to surprise my friend and they turned off the lights. We all honestly thought the power went out because it was raining, but they sang her happy birthday and turned the lights back on. 

I would recommend the food but would not recommend coming here in a group of more than 6.
author: Deepti N.

description:
Really good. My meat eating wife loved it too. Bug portion sizes. Efficient staff. I had the "shrimp" and avocado salad. I think I prefer it to the "real" thing. Loads of flavour.  
The location isn't in a good end of town some cars have been broken into recently so don't leave anything on display and you'll be fine. Just go there and enjoy!
author: Chris S.

description: Stopped by on a Sunday afternoon and was delighted. Great service and food. They have an excellent selection of mock meats. Could have been a bit more spicy.
author: Meredith R.

description: Been here a couple times and I've always been pleased with the food. This is a great vegetarian and vegan-friendly Thai spot. All the "meat" on the menu is fake, in case it's unclear - shrimp, beef, chicken, even duck... is usually just opt for veggies because I don't like tofu and am a little wary of the soy-based "meats" haha, but my friends who tried the fake meat say it's not bad. You can vary the spicy levels, but beware they operate on true Thai spice levels! It can get preeetttyyyy burning hot :)
author: Grace D.

description:
One of my favorite spots of all time. If it's Thai we want, we come here. We have been to this place 10-15 times and love it every time. The staff know us and remember what we like. If you like spicy, they can customize spice level to set you on fire. 

My favorite items from here is the Cashew Nut mixed with steamed noodles and I get mine Medium spicy.
author: Prabha R.

description: Great food and service. We love the crispy Veg duck. Dinner this evening was lovely and thanks for the tea!
author: Lisa G.

description: Staff is nice and friendly, food is great. I always get the Pad Kee Mao Tofu and it is as good getting at other non-vegetarian places.
author: Vinod K.

description:
I'm a meat eater but found the food here satiating.

Crab cakes ($8.95) and samosas ($8.95) were ok. Didn't really stand out and were not bad either. The pad thai ($10.99) was quite bland. Pad see ew ($10.99) on the other hand was great. My favorite was the Bangkok "duck" ($13.95). It was pretty much fried taro wrapped in tofu skin. Tasted nothing like duck but it was great in it's own way.

They asked if we were ok with egg when they took our order. I think vegans could easily be accommodated here.

The service was good and the space was modern and clean. Street parking was easy.

I like that the menu indicated how spicy each dish was. More restaurants should do this.

Overall it was a great meal but it was on the pricey side for not having any meat.
author: Andy W.

description:
I just ordered a mango and rice desert 
The waitress was very friendly and my food came fast
The desert was very sweet .
I will go back here to try the vegetarian dishes.
author: Jennifer G.

description: What a lovely little place with excellent food. Everything is vegetarian so feel guilt-free to order anything you like. Especially nice to experiment too as some of the "meat" dishes are interesting takes on their real counterparts. For example the shrimp fried pineapple rice had real-looking/tasting shrimps and the blackened catfish has a great char to it. Also the duck confit had a crispy flaky "skin" and great flavor. Everything we ate was delicious, looking forward to going back next time!
author: K. C.

description: Really tasty food! The fake meats have really good appearance and texture (I think taste too but haven't had meat in years). Curries where really good and fresh. Ate with my girlfriend for less then $30
author: Emile G.

description:
"Chicken" Pumpkin Curry was delicious as was the papaya salad.

The place was cozy, but well designed, so it didn't feel crowded.

The wait staff was attentive and friendly :)
author: Craig J.

description: First of all, I am partial to any vegetarian/vegan restaurant. After 10 years of being vegan I can truly appreciate how many more options there are today for us herbivores. My boyfriend and I order delivery for Thai Idea last night. The food is well priced and they offer a variety of options. Sticking with simple choices, he got the pad Thai and I got the pad see ew. The pad Thai came with a great assortment of vegetables and was the comforting familiarity that is pad Thai. Unfortunately, my pad see ew was simply alright. Not much of the distinct sweet sauce nor any nice charred vegetables that I'm accustomed to with the preparation. We will absolutely order from them again, but I won't get the pad see ew next time.
author: Madeline F.

description: ugh so good. the pumpkin curry made me gay again, boyfriend? yes. the tom kha was no joke either along with UGHHH i forgot about the COCONUT ICECREAM!! IT WAS SO SO GOOD. the only discrepancy i have towards this place may be the price because just the icecream, soup, and curry came out to about $40 but whenever i'm feeling extra vegan or extra rich i love going here with the hubby. ugh can you believe? i'm in love^_^
author: Xavier L.

description:
Upon reviews for vegetarian food, we came here. We had the Thai Iced Tea, Pumpkin Curry and Tom Kho dish.
Our Firebomb appetizer came out first. It was just meh. 
Pumpkin Curry could use a little more pumpkin, I think there was 3 cubes of pumpkin total. But their Tom Kho was great, sour and sweet. Waitress was nice and the decor was clean. Great sit down place.
author: Kevin C.

description: Walked from union square to this spot about 20mins through tenderloin. Was worth the wait, got Thai samosa, Panang curry, pad Thai with tofu and Thai ice tea. Liked the side of white rice and roti too. Didn't have time for desert as was too full. Walked back to amc on mission and hit up the mall. Great evening and I'll be back to try the cauliflower appetizer.
author: David L.

description: The only terrible thing about this restaurant is that the meal ended. I am obsessed with the catfish dish, I still dream about it and it's been weeks since I visited. The firecracker roll was amazing too. I loved everything, wish i lived nearby so i could go everyday :(
author: J Z.

description:
I really liked their wings bomb!  It was piping hot, crisp and zestily sauced with basil and chopped carrots. 

Do order up the pumpkin curry - especially if the season is fall!  It makes it quite charming to commemorate the holidays with!

As for their pineapple fried rice, their substitute lobster and meat, was quite chewy and imitated well.  

They were still packed full when we arrived on a Wednesday night at 8pm for a party of 2.  Bring a small party because the dining is catered to the small crowd!  

Their Singha cold beer, was nice with the food that they served up!

Service was on point and I want to try more of their other creative dishes.  Until next time!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Ok-ish food. Great presentation and good menu but the flavors are not so great. A little too pricey for the location, ambiance and taste. We ordered the fireball crackers which were not spicy at all but came with a tangy sauce. For main course we got the veggie shrimp and avocado with panang sauce which was again not so great. The "shrimp" was bland and avocado was not toasted too. With the sauce it was just about edible. Even the tea was disappointing - hot water with a teabag! We were expecting tea leaves like in most Asian restaurants. I wouldn't go back to this place.
author: Lali K.

description: I had the Tom Ka soup and it was too sweet.  The ingredients in the Pad Ped didn't seem fresh and the sauce was too sweet.  I went for lunch.   Maybe it's better at dinner time.
author: Jane L.

description: The food was nicely presented, especially the potato samosas. It was interesting to see a mix of cuisines, they offered items that are typically considered Indian but with a Thai twist. I would not recommend the volcano beef, but the green curry fried rice was delicious! And they're great about adjusting the spice level for your needs!
author: Trishna P.

description: One of the best Thai restaurants I've been to across the states. I had their famous pumpkin curry as an entree and the "Wing bomb" as an appetizer. Pumpkin Curry was very flavorful and it is a dish that I have not had the chance to try in the East coast, so it was a plus. The wing bomb... Well, it was da bomb.
author: Dan K.

description: Great food. Great service. Terrible fruit fly problem. Owner, get an extermination service in. We batted flies away from our food for 30 minutes and then gave up and moved to another table. It did not make a difference and eventually there was a fruit fly doing the backstroke in my wine (which they quickly replaced).
author: Richard E.

description: Wow! Delicious fresh rolls and pumpkin curry- got takeout and will definitely be in to try more!!
author: Elana R.

description:
decor, service and vegan options are great. The food feels a bit like your standard "king of thai" take out. And because it was located in the TL...I did not have the best experience while en route and finding parking.

Also, I wasn't a huge fan of the food, but am glad there are vegan options available. 
Had Spice Fried Rice with "Chicken" and the Tom Yum soup with Tofu.
author: Zu W.

description:
Whhhhhhhhhy is the food quality at this location soo different than the one that used to be in Foster City?

:( 

Seriously the food at this location was not fresh, seemed microwaved, and had a ton of oil. I mean a TON of oil..........tilt the plate and it just flows out. 

We were nearby checking out the theater where the original Zappos corporate office was in the Tender and having some "Tender Moments". Love all the wild things in the Tender. The owners parents even had their own Asian restaurant in the bottom wood carved area of the building. It became lunchtime and we were excited that one of our favs had a location near. 

Pad Thai, crispy rolls, potato curry...we ordered all of our normal favs. Like I said previous. Soggy with oil and seemed microwaved. Oh and they have the best Thai tea.

The only reason I am giving a two star is because they had great customer service like the other location. 

I will not return to this location. I wish I could just hop in the car from San Carlos and run to the Foster City location but...it's gone...oh well!
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Food was okay, I should've stuck with Panang curry but I tried the Pineapple Fried Rice and was a little disappointed. It was not spicy as I asked for it and the veggies did not blend well with the rice. The dessert was good but I think I've had better thai food in SoCal.
author: Yashaswita B.

description: Discovered this place on uber eats. Love the vegan option because I can really try foods that fit within my eating restrictions. My favorite is the Tom Yum soup!!
author: Mandi J.

description: We ordered takeout from this place. We had the yellow veggie duck curry, the pad Thai, and the Tom yum noodle soup. This was the worst pad Thai I've had in my life for many reasons. The flavor was all wrong and the noodles were the clumpiest. They used canned corn and canned mushrooms. The Tom yum had a decent broth but the veggie meats were gross and there were no tasty real vegetables. The yellow duck curry had too much veggie meat and no carrots and felt very one note. The whole experience was unpleasant.
author: Morris G.

description: Really yummy... the reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because I'm not a huge fan of tofu! Def worth trying
author: Bianca T.

description:
I enjoy a good vegetarian meal every now and then but my only qualm is that I often leave still feeling hungry. Well at Thai Idea, not only do I leave full and satisfied, I sometimes even have a to go box to boot. 

Really loving the veggie Tom Kha soup here.
