It's a wonderful balance of flavors with plenty of aromatics from the lemongrass and galangal, the tartness from the lime juice, and the richness from the coconut milk. It's hard to beat on a chilly SF evening. The golden cauliflower appetizer goes really well with the soup too. Deep fried cauliflower florets with the tamarind dipping sauce mirrors the flavors from the soup well. 

The entrees are pretty filling and satisfying. The pineapple fried rice balances sweet and savory well and the veggie "shrimp" comes one of the closest in terms of texture to real shrimp that I've had. Like the deep flavors in the "beef" Pad Ped and the chili green bean dishes... even more so when you consider they don't have access to fish sauce to create that same intense salt factor. And lastly... the crispy chicken fried rice. I like fried chicken and while this definitely doesn't look like fried chicken, it has its own charm. It kinda reminds me of a less salty version of crispy fried spam which to me is incredibly yum! All in all, so happy with the food I've had here. 

The service is amazing sweet and attentive and the restaurant is always clean and comfortable. Love the contemporary Thai décor that makes you forget for a second that you are deep in the Tenderloin. Still, with vegetarian food that doesn't make you miss meat, I'm willing to make the trek down to Thai Idea Vegetarian anytime.
author: Jon L.

description:
Being an event planner at an animal shelter gives me the impossible task of finding food that is
vegan and affordable with variety but still delicious. From someone who grew up believing the Big Mac was an essential part of the food pyramid, I had my doubts this was feasible. 

A vegan co-worker told me of Thai Idea but I was reluctant to accept the suggestion since this a someone who thinks Tofurkey tastes better than the real thing (it doesn't, it tastes like cardboard). 

Before placing a catering order I stopped by the restaurant to do a taste test. I got one of everything from the appetizer menu expecting to only find a few acceptable items. I ended up enjoying every single one of the 13 dishes. My least favorite dish (wing bomb) was still better than anything the takeout Chinese restaurant around the corner could make. My favorite dish (firecracker balls) was comparable to a quality Japanese restaurant. 

It was as glutenous as I was craving without the carnivore guilt. Though my vegan-ism is still on the fence, Thai Idea is one of those places that makes me believe you don't have to compromise taste for a better planet. 

The next week I placed an order for 200 people to be delivered during traffic hour within the city. They went above and beyond to make sure my catering order was perfect, everything arrived pipping hot and just as good as I remembered. For that I was happy to skip the weekly Big Mac, but only for that week :p
author: Jason O.

description: I had the pad thai fried rice and it was delicious. The tofu was so fresh and vegetables as well. The service is warm and helpful. They are playing tasteful, light music. Vegetarians... this is the spot. Make sure you try the hot sauces when you come!
author: Evan S.

description: Very good and ideal for vegetarians and vegans. However I would not order the meat substitute for the chicken known as "veggie chicken". it was really terrible but I got a side of steamed tofu which I put into my meal to substitute for the veggie chicken that I took out.
author: Zoe F.

description: Great place for an intimate diner.  I enjoy their appetizers more than the main dishes.  The place is small.  Hard to accommodate large groups.  I recommend getting the appetizers and skip the main course.  Did not enjoy our last visit since there was a large party that complained about it took so long for their table and they were very noisy.
author: Jon Y.

description: I'm a vegetarian but I always go vegan if the option is available. So for me this restaurant was heaven. A huge selection of vegan dishes that left even my homnivore friends amazed. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Although the neighborhood isn't that nice it's definitely worth ignoring that just to experience this great restaurant.
author: Kajsa A.

description: We came here during a family vacation- we are vegetarian- this place was AMAZING!! such great food options! There are many alternative meat options of which I have never seen before such at fake duck, etc.  We had such a variety and everyone was happy. The food was fresh. I would recommend this place to anyone who likes thai!
author: Namrata S.

description: I heart this restaurant!!!  All the items are super delicious and they have Vegan Thai Ice tea!!! I had the vegan dumplings and the vegan cream cheese/crab rolls--delicious!  Pad Thai with tofu and peanut sauce is super amazing! The serivce was really good. Didn't have to wait long and the food came out super quick. they even have vegan Thai desserts but I didn't get a chance to try--next time.
author: Glam K.

description: I'm in front of their location right now at 10:19 and their sign says they close at 10:30 and they won't allow me to order some vegan fried rice togo. I hate that.
author: Mike E. W.

description:
Lunch on a Saturday, 6 of us arrived @ noon (when they open) w/o any other diners in the joint. Ima card carrying Omnivore, but 2 of the dining posse were not. Sharing on our table:

o   crispy tofu appetizer - deep fried tofu skewered  (4 sticks) w/ a side of peanut sauce --- kinda ordinary
o   chicken appetizer - 4 sticks of vegan/tofu chicken drizzled w/ the same peanut sauce as    crispy tofu --- ok
o   spicy fried rice - not so spicy, and not dry enough (really shouldn't be called fried rice!)
o   Pumpkin Curry - w/ veggies (choice of the vegan meats is offered) my honey thought it was a bit too sweet; --- it was good
o   Roasted Veggie Duck Curry -, thought it could have more fire (chilies) it was the same mild sauce as the Pumpkin Curry, which was disappointing (maybe they think people should only order ONE curry dish --- it was ok, couldn't quite decern a "duck" flavor
o   Papaya salad - pretty good, could have used a container of sauce on the side. Had blanched string beans which is a twist to this very traditional dish --- good
o   Pad Thai - maybe the best dish on the table, perfectly cooked noodles and flavorful --- great
o   Jasmine rice - not much to say here --- it was cooked correctly

$105 for 6 people sans drinks. Servers were nice and attentive. Gotta be aware of surroundings (people) in this TL locale, DUH!. The woman at the neighboring table moved my Honey's school bag closer to her and her rough looking dining partners table while I was in the bathroom. Telling me after we left the joint he wondered, could she have wanted to steal it? YES! Wish I had known at the time, I woulda altered their reality. 

4 stars cos the "the whole is greater than the sum of its parts", and after all they advertise themselves as "the only vegetarian Thai restaurant in S.F."  Given a choice, AND in that vegan mode I would head back to Golden Era: http://goldeneravegan.com/
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Winner, winner, vegetarian chicken dinner

I think I can go so far as to say this is my favorite Thai restaurant outside of Thailand. It's everything from the interesting space to the friendly service to the well-presented and tasty food. 

Our most recent dinner here was 2 years since the previous visit. Thai Idea never strayed far from my mind when I thought about dinner in SF, so I had plenty of time to build up expectations. The dishes were as artfully presented as ever, looking like they really should have come from a far "nicer" restaurant. The service was attentive and friendly. Walking by the kitchen, I saw it mostly seemed like one family cooking and running the place. They were really cheery and I think the positivity shows in the food. With vegetarian places I often relax my standards, acknowledging it's hard to replicate the raw biological satisfaction of meat. Thai Idea needs no such leeway, as it can stand up to any competition. 

Would recommend the following:
Volcanic beef: incredibly flavorful type of spicy, great texture to the "beef' and nice presentation
Bangkok duck: sweet, savory, and crispy. nice sauce with it
Pumpkin curry: always loved pumpkin curry, and Thai idea had one of the best around
Firecracker balls: fun appetizer, as with everything here, it's not hard to forget the tuna isn't real meat
Pad thai: noodles were oddly sticky so it was hard to serve, but filled with smoky vegetables 

As has been repeated in numerous reviews, Thai Idea is byob with a liquor store next door carrying great beers and wine. This makes the place as good for a pre-gaming dinner as a romantic night or even solo dining. 


I would eat here everyday if I could. Being full time vegetarian would be laughably easy if I lived within range of Thai Idea.
author: Erik L.

description: Excellent Thai restaurant in the Tenderloin district of SF, with an entirely vegetarian menu! My friend and I came for dinner and were seated right away--the decor was very modern, and it looks like they might have recently renovated. We started off with the papaya salad (som tum) which was fresh and delicious; could perhaps have used a bit more spice in my opinion, but they also provided us a little caddy of sriracha/sambal/pickled jalapenos, so no complaints there! We also got the pad kee mow (stir-fried rice noodles) with tofu, which was decent, and the spicy vegetarian "catfish", which was absolutely amazing! The chunks of meat substitute weren't necessarily convincing, but the stir-fry was one of the most fragrant I've had, containing peppercorns, basil, and a variety of other chiles and herbs--so enticing and delightful! Thai food can typically be very meat-heavy, so this vegetarian Thai restaurant certainly presents a nice, lighter alternative!
author: David K.

description: I swing in here every visit to SF. Living in Seattle I'm a little cynical about Thai restaurants (there are a million). Many are good, but few are great. Thai Idea is a great one, vegetarians in San Francisco are well taken care of.
author: Benjamin L.

description:
I like this restaurant and come here on a regular basis, but lately I have left a bit disappointed. The food is usually very good, though at times the spices seem a bit off or the salt a bit too strong. The service is consistently attentive and fast. 

I have found that I like dishes with tofu better than ones with fake meat, and I think many others feel the same way. They used to provide a soup at the beginning of each lunch, which was a nice touch, but they suddenly stopped that practice. 

All in all this is a very solid choice.
author: Olivia D.

description:
Great food,  good service
Amazing place for vegetarian people
Love it, I'll go again for sure.
author: Mia M.

description:
I usually never give a restaurant 5 stars unless it's superb, but this place had it all.  

Let's start with the menu.  Every item is well labelled as to how spicy each item is.
The service is fantastic.  Quick and with a smile. 
The food is not only delicious but the presentation is beautiful.
The price is fair for the location and the food.

I stuffed myself as I really enjoyed my meal.  I am a vegetarian and no dish item smelled like it had a fish oil in it.  All the vegetables were fresh and cooked just right.. Thank you Thai Idea.
author: Sammy s.

description:
Holy sweet Jesus this place sucks.

A mountain of grainy tofu over some undercooked onions and carrots.  Just take a Thai basil recipe and substitute tofu!  Stop trying to fix what isn't broken!  This stuff was inedible.  

I think they're trying too hard to have a "gimmick".  But vegetarian Thai food isn't some revolutionary idea.  

Go to Lers Ros and order something without meat in it.  You're welcome.
author: Daniel K.

description: Great experience. Very casual place. Came here for lunch on a weekday. Service was quick and food was plentiful, tasty, and affordable. Highly recommended vegan spot.
author: Cherie E.

description: I was initially grumpy but came here again a few times and I'm quite pleased. Once you ask them to make it spicy, they will. Had the pumpkin curry and was delicious. I do wish they cooked the pumpkin more tender though
author: Crystal Y.

description: I've both dined in and ordered delivery from here. The ambiance inside the restaurant is nice though it doesn't look like much from the outside. I love that it's a vegetarian place because it gives me piece of mind that there's no fish sauce hidden in a supposedly "vegetarian" dish, as is common with other Thai restaurants. However, the portions are small and as a result, the dishes are pricey. The taste of the food is inconsistent. Sometimes they nail it and other times you end up wondering if they gave you the wrong item. I generally tend to enjoy the Papaya Salad, Spicy Fried Rice, Pad-See-Ew, and Pad Khee Mao. I've tried the yellow & green curries but they are just okay. Not my go-to spot but it does the job when I'm in the mood for Thai food.
author: Janjri V.

description:
This place is the bomb dot com. If you're veggie and are new to the world of Asian food courtesy of growing up in Riverside County, CA where good Asian restaurants that pander to Vegetarians are anomalies, welcome to heaven. 

I've tried my share of Thai places in my last 6 years in the Bay. The first time I had Thai was in the unpolitically correct "Asian Ghetto" area near the Berkeley campus. I come from a very strict vegetarian family so I was alarmed when I saw that all food, veggie or not, was cooked in the same wok. Add to this that my friend's order was a beef somethingortheother and my order came out 2 seconds after hers and I was sick to my stomach. For propriety's sake, I took a bite of my order, did not understand the flavors and was completely grossed out at what juices may have mixed in with my food. I threw that $6 dish out. Fast forward to two years later where my tolerance was increased courtesy of my increasing inability/laziness to cook at home. Here I had more Thai food. In India. And I grew to like it. A lot. 

Coming back to Berkeley, I discovered a multitude of great spots including Imm, Sabuy Sabuy II and yes, Tuk Tuk Thai (they are open obscenely late). With a promise from my servers to avoid cross contamination and a determined avoidance of looking at the kitchen and all meat dishes, I discovered nothing but more love for Thai. 

This sets the scene for my discovery of Thai Idea. My parents are still VERY strict about where they eat. They avoid Asian restaurants that serve meat like the plague which makes having them taste Thai food damn near impossible. This place changed the game. Not only are the servers angels from heaven who smile, greet you and explain dishes, they also do a fantastic job of alleviating desi parents' fear of meat. My mum must have said "no fish sauce" 5 times and the lady did not snap once. 

The food is beautifully presented, with seasonal orchids that my mum like to take off the food to put in her hair. The food is also very tasty. All the dishes, especially the curries are fresh and flavorful. There is also a delectable offering of mango sticky rice with the thinnest filets of mango I have ever laid my eyes on. Lychee tea is amazing. All things are good here. Except for the "samosas/sambusas". The potato is sweet. If you're gujarati/like sweet savory food you may enjoy. If you're me, avoid. Thai tea is great as well. 

They are SO good at doing birthdays. When I told them it was my bro's birthday, they literally brought out the cutest fritters with ice cream and a candle, TURNED OFF THE LIGHTS in the entire restaurant (freaking me out slightly TBH/reminding me of power outages in India) and came to our table singing Happy Birthday. I was so thrilled I wish it had been my birthday (yes, I like birthdays a lot). 

So that's that- show your patronage. Support the hell out of this place. They are that good.
author: Radhika P.

description: Awesome food... all vegetarian. Didn't care for the veggie "chicken" but the service was quick and friendly. Clean establishment with clean food. They were even open on Thanksgiving! Glad they were.
author: Veronica V.

description:
As a strong meat lover, when my boyfriend said we were eating here, I was very disappointed. I love vegetables, but I hate it when people try to make fake meat, instead of focusing on the deliciousness of tofu.

But this place is delicious. Eating things here, I never once thought "this would be better with meat." 

The spicy cat fish sounds intimidating because you're like "fake fish? Why would I torture myself like that?" But the "fish" is crispy, well seasoned, delicious, and you don't even think about how its imitation.

Come here initially for your vegan friends, but come back because it's delicious.
author: Rosy H.

description: This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants - very good selection of starters and main course! Extremely flavorful food (including Thai iced tea - which many other restaurants mess up) . Overall a vegan delight!
author: Santhosh K.

description:
My family and I ate here for a family reunion. We tried going to Gracias Madre, but it was super busy and had an hour long wait. Thai Idea held a table for our party of 7.  

Like another reviewer, I thought the pad see ew was delicious. I also got their sweet mango rice desert, which was decent. 

Golden Era Vegan had better sweet mango rice, but their food wasn't good. I would eat here next time I am in the mood for Thai food.
author: Naz A.

description: Location was conveniently close to my hotel, but not a place I would drive all around town for. My entree was good, but not outstanding. If you're a vegetarian, there are certainly plenty of options, so that's a draw. Service was pleasant.
author: Vikram S.

description: Not a bad place. I'm not a vegetarian but I do love Thai food so I thought I'd check out this restaurant. The service was excellent, prices were affordable and the portions were just right. I had their chicken red curry which was satisfying but the texture of the chicken kind of threw me off. I can't say I'll go back here but I did have a good dining experience.
author: Heidi J.

description:
I'm a pescaterian, so this place was still in my alley.  For you meat eaters, it'll be good but it won't be as filling.  The food here was pretty good but the wait for the food took a while.

Also, the spicy is not spicy at all.  At least for me.  Our table had to request the sides of the sauce and dry spices so we could bring some heat to our dish.  The restaurant is small, so it's recommended to make reservations.  

They also have a byob policy.  No worries, if you don't carry your alcohol in your purse, there's a liquor store next door for anyone who wants some spirits.

All in all, i like this place but I like my thai food spicy so I give this place 3 stars.
author: Sheena D.

description:
4 stars for only Thai veg place in area.
as other reviewer said, food can be bland which is very unusual for thai food.
it could be hit or mis.
servers are nice and helpful.
author: R P.

description:
Meh. Not sure why the rave reviews. I've been to places like these and was excited for the fake meat but dishes didn't taste authentic and were poorly executed, not a lot of care. 

Good service though.
author: Erica S.

description: Excellent spot for a quick and satisfying downtown lunch or a romantic downtown dinner before the show. I love the salad and the spring rolls for appetizers. Anything with tofu is sure to please for the entree selection. I really have enough room for dessert but when I do I get the mango sticky rice! Fast and friendly service and very affordable with beautiful ambience!
author: Julie S.

description: Great food, fair prices, and good service!  This place is a great Vegan restaurant that I highly recommend you visit if you have the opportunity.
author: Mike P.

description: I was looking for vegan restaurant and this one did not let me down. I got drunken noodles with immitation chicken which was great. Definitely exceeded my expectations. Will definitely visit this place again.
author: Mukund B.

description:
I wasn't vegetarian but my friends are. 
For sometimes now they they kept asking me to find and  take them to Thai vegetarian restaurant .  Took me a while but I finally found one. And that's this place.

   The restaurant claims that they do not use any fish sauce which is  a main ingredient for Thai food. They say they use salt  instead. For that I have to say ....their  food taste better than I thought it would be.  


For appetizer, we had golden cauliflower which's great but veggie chicken satay wasn't that good . Then we ordered  yellow veggie curry, tom kha veggie and and egg pant  they are all pretty good.

 And my vegetarian friends were very happy. However I have to say it can't compare with the real thai food with real meat and fish sauce in it. 

For the real vegetarian I think this is as good as could be.

  The  service and  the decoration is pretty good too .

So if your vegetarian ,check it out
author: Dom G.

description:
Tom Kar was huge! Veggie chicken did not detract from it at all, and that's a big deal since I am in love with Tom Kar Gai (with the real chicken). Most of the menu is spicy. They tell you just how spicy or mild right in the menu itself, so there are no surprises for spice wusses like me. We all shared the deep-fried fake chicken roll appetizer, the fake shrimp rolls, the aforementioned giant tureen of soup, Pad Thai, pepper beef, a spicy curry, and something very akin to Drunken Noodles (minus the basil). Everything was delicious and no animals were ingested (just a few animal products). 

Two appetizers, that big shared soup, three orders of rice, and four entrees (plus soft drinks) cost about $83. We all brought leftovers home, too. They were really nice to us, and we stayed for a long time after our check closed out with no trouble at all.
author: Austin J. A.

description:
Searched Yelp for a vegetarian place to eat. Boyfriend loves Thai, so this happens to be the perfect combination. 

It wasn't busy when we came in on a Friday afternoon. The vibe and decor is inviting as soon as you walk in. Attended to right away by the server with a smile. The food isn't anything memorable to me at least. The item that stood out the most to me was their "chicken" wings which I loved! It wasn't greasy and the presentation was cute. I think it was partly the sauce that made the wings delicious. 

There is a lot to choose from in the menu and I'd like to come back to try some more items.
author: Danielle V.

description: This place was really cute inside. I was excited to try vegan Thai food and veggie meats. My food came and there was a string of hair on the plate, thank God it wasn't on the food but still gross. Please check around the plate before bringing food to a table. The portion size was large, but I really wouldn't enjoy my food after seeing the hair on my plate.
author: Asenath N.

description: Got this to-go and it was super quick and convenient. The food was yummy and came in a BIG portion. The restaurant was pretty small so I felt a bit cumbersome waiting for my to go order but the waitresses were helpful and nice. My only complaint is that the food was not quite as flavorful as I hoped for, I didn't really get that Thai kick.
author: Rebecca M.

description: Great find! The pumpkin curry is amazing. I wish I had more time here to try the rest of the menu.
author: Christine M.

description: There was a scrap of food left on our plates! Delicious food with awesome service and atmosphere! Just go and try for yourself
author: Philip D.

description: Super unexpectedly fancy/top tier vegan Thai place!
author: Carolyn S.

description: Not sure why this was rated so highly.  Went for dinner, all our dishes were mediocre at best.  Fake meat was artificial and tough, presentation just as bad.  Had high hopes, and in a town so vegetarian-friendly, was shocked to be so disappointed.
author: Michael N.

description: The spicy sweetness of Thai Idea's Pad Basil paired with cucumber salad and rice is my go to for fast, fresh vegan deliciousness.
author: Melissa C.

description:
This is one of the best vegetarian restaurant! All the dishes are full of vegetables and bursting full of flavors.

I have been here many times with friends and at their other location (in Foster City) with friends, family and coworkers. I have had nothing to complain about food and service here. Decor and ambiance are very good. Service is good. Food is flavorful and in good quantity.

Don't miss the Tom Yum soup for lunch. It is full of vegetables and at a very low price. I am fan of their curries and pad ki mao.

I would recommend this place to all the vegetarians and people who like flavorful Thai food. Ask them to "make it (very) spicy" if you want to kick it up a notch. I hope they keep cooking and open up more restaurants. It will be a hit in South Bay if they decide to open one there.
author: Sid P.

description: Delicious vegetarian meal, beautiful presentation and excellent service! So glad we found it while looking for a place to eat in the city!
author: Joanne B.

description:
I'd been wanting to check out this spot for a while, and thankfully the person I was getting lunch with today suggested it. This is one of those "faux meats" vegetarian places where all of their "beef," "chicken," "lamb," etc. are some type of soy substitute. I LOVE THAT STUFF!

I had one of the chef's suggested rice plates: the Volcano Beef. It includes wok-fried veggie beef with basil, black pepper, and lava sauce garnished with onion. The veggie beef was delightful, but I wish they could have added more. Considering the "beef" is the substance of the meal, I felt it was overwhelmed by the greens. Nevertheless, it was tasty, though not spicy to my palate despite the menu saying it would be a little. On another positive note, the plate was very well presented with the greens arranged in a flowery decoration on my plate.

I also had a Thai ice tea, which came in a large glass. It was pretty standard, i.e. delicious.

All-in-all, I enjoyed my meal here because it was flavorful. I would definitely like to stop by again and try other things on their menu. It all looks awesome for a vegetarian like me!
author: Ashish B.

description:
Whilst not situated in the nicest of neighborhoods, this restaurant is cute and inviting and, most importantly, has a menu full of delicious veg*n Thai food. They completely won me over with their pumpkin curry (my absolute favorite Thai meal) and their plentiful options for faux meat. 

Service was great, especially considering my friend and I stayed here practically until the place closed chatting and catching up on each others lives. We left when they started mopping the floor, but they never got pushy or asked us to leave.
author: Alyssa J P.

description: Best vegetarian Thai food in the bay area. Every dish is stellar, but I particularly recommend the duck!
author: Alex M.

description:
Can't wait to return! Actually - can't wait to heat up the leftovers..

We parked right accross the street (easy easy parking on a Sunday night). We found a table inside this adorable restaurant. Service was friendly, but inattentive. 

The food, though, was the best part (as it should be): We shared delicious, hot, flavorful, beautifully presented Veggie Lamb Yellow Curry ($11.95) with brown rice ($2) that was yummy, and tasted amazing with the curry, but was not as sticky as I expected. We agreed, though, that the Pad See-Ew with veggie chicken ($9.95) was even better. It was a very very generous portion of some of the best wide noodles and (I think housemade) soy meat I've ever had.
author: Dana G.

description:
A great hidden gem in the Tenderloin.  
I have been to Thai Idea a number of times and always have a great experience. The decor is beautiful, very quiet, some nice music playing, and the little waterfall in the back corner. Also, I always seem to be one of the only tables in this restaurant, so this is a good spot for a nice intimate date or catching up with friends.  Everything on the menu I have tried is great, decent portions for the price, and the service is amazing.  The server is quick to take your order, brings everything in a timely manner and will only check up on you as needed (again, another reason this spot would be good for a date or catching up with an old friend, etc.) 
The menu has a lot of options with the "fake meat" so your non herbivore friends can pretend like they are still enjoying some chicken while us vegans/vegetarians can feast on tofu and imitation fish dishes. The portions are just right, with an appetizer to share and one of the noodle or rice dishes you will for sure leave with a full happy tummy :).
author: Kelsey B.

description: Wonderful service, fantastic food, great atmosphere! Everything from the presentation to the smiley faces on the pens to sign the checks was fabulous. Our group ordered the Pad Ped, panang curry, pineapple fried rice, and garlic beef with appetizers of the shrimp rolls and the Thai samosas. Everything was incredible. For me (a vegan) and my partner (who is not) to find a place that both of us love, this was as good as it gets. The food was absolutely delicious all around.
author: Amber G.

description:
Really yummy thai place. I also liked the restaurant's clean wooden decor.

I had veggies sautéed with cashews and even if it's a really simply dish, it was just good. Pretty big portion with lots of nuts for not even $10. The brown rice was also out of this world!

I'm looking forward to going back and trying those amazing appetizers.
author: Leslie S.

description:
After many months...possibly years, my honey finally took me here. Was the wait worth it?? No!! Because he should have taken me here sooner!! Darn it!! This place rocks!!

From the outside, it looks like a dump. The construction fixtures outside doesn't help the décor. Once you walk in, it's transformed to a beautiful place. The waitresses were not the friendliest bunch but very attentive. They quickly sat us at a 4 table seat, which was a plus since we love sitting next to each other. 

While looking at the menu...I wanted EVERYTHING!! Darn places that give you so much options. I think my tummy was controlling my eyes for sure!!

We ended up ordering the following...

DRINKS - THAI ICE TEA $2.50...it's your basic thai ice tea. Not too sweet, but great to have if you suddenly take a bite of something spicy.

APPETIZER - WING BOMB $7.95...which is "the bomb" a must order. Great sauce and flavor.

MAIN DISHES - EGGPLANT BEEF $9.50...I loved this dish. The eggplant was perfectly cooked, not mushy. Not too spicy and the best part...the next day my honey had it for lunch and he said it was even better because it marinated in the sauce over night.

GREEN CURRY BEEF $9.50...I love sweet and mildly spicy dishes. This was a perfect combination. My honey didn't care for it as much, since he's not a fan of sweet curry. It's ok, more for me!! Hehe

KEE MAO CHICKEN $9.95...if you have a weak stomach for spicy food then don't order this. It was super spicy. Even my honey's taste bud kinda went numb after eating this. He finished the entire dish since I couldn't eat it and was only able to sample the other two. 

I'm glad we were able to finally come here. I'm a total fan and can't wait to go back again. The prices are reasonable and the presentation of the food makes you feel like you're at an upscale restaurant.

Street parking is available, but not easy to find. You can walk from BART to get here (that's what we did). It's a bit of a walk...so be prepared ladies with heels. Overall it's an awesome place to meet up with friends or take someone for date night.

See my honey's review of this place, although I think he is in need of an update... http://www.yelp.com/biz/thai-idea-vegetarian-san-francisco-2?hrid=80-RvZhiKD8XMyeKcC6DSg
author: Rachel B.

description: Very tasty food for a non-vegetarian! I did not even realize I wasn't eating meat. My best friend is a vegetarian so we chose this spot. Service was fast, food was very flavorful. Will def be back.
author: Khristina H.

description:
Since Jamie W. and I embarked on a plant-based way of eating a couple of months ago, believe it or not, we've been trying out places around the city that we wouldn't have dared try before. Vegetarian fare was anathema to us when a slab of pork would please us to no end. Alas, while I haven't completely gotten over my love of the pig or frankly any edible creature that had a mother, Thai Idea definitely goes a significant way to fill the gap by serving vegetarian dishes you just wouldn't expect to be so tasty. Deep in the 'Loin as it is, it has a surprisingly calming ambiance that's jarred periodically by the cacophony of mouthy veg-head diners who obviously don't know how loud they are.

The menu is deceptively similar to any standard Thai restaurant with chef's special plates that feature "veggie meat". Now I usually run away from meat replacements like this, but I have to admit that the $11.95 Bangkok "Duck" was almost as good and savory as the real thing. Because it was crispy-fried and glazed liberally with tamarind, the flavor and texture of the faux-duck confit really delighted me, and the shallots and chili complemented it nicely (see photo). Jamie went for the $9.95 Pad Thai, which really didn't miss the flavor of meat given the pan-fried rice noodles, sprouts, ground peanuts, egg and tofu cubes that were served in an abundance (see photo).

I've always said you can tell how good a Southeast Asian restaurant is by the quality of its spring rolls, and the $7.95 Fresh Salad Rolls were a good litmus test. They were delicious creations with bean sprouts, lettuce, carrots, mint, glass noodles, and cilantro piled into a thick roll of rice paper flecked with sesame seeds and served with a luscious peanut sauce (see photo). I would definitely order those again in a heartbeat. It's good to know you really don't have to sacrifice flavor when going vegetarian in this town, and Thai Idea is a solid place to get a meat-free fix that doesn't taste like it was ground from bales of wheat.

FOOD - 4 stars...first-class vegetarian fare for meat lovers in need of a forks-over-knives alternative
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...sleek and modern with a high chance of loud vegans in the room
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...quietly effective
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely give it a try, you health nut!
author: Ed U.

description: First time trying thai food and it was great! My meal came quick and customer service was excellent. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for vegan food near downtown. The price of the food is definitely a fair price for the quality of it. Also, they have a cute cat spoon pen that comes with the check.
author: Michael Y.

description: This is among the best Thai restaurants I've ever eaten in. Seriously amazing. The fact that it's vegetarian is an added bonus. I spent the day reacquainting myself with the city and stumbled upon this place for lunch. The chicken satay appetizer was good, not great. The vegan shrimp and avocado panang curry was one of the best dishes I've ever eaten. I also ordered the volcano beef to go which I ordered extra spicy and it was also delicious. The service wasn't great but it didn't bother me. Do yourself a favor and go here. You won't be disappointed.
author: Jon O.

description:
Everything I've had here is amazing - and all meat free!

My favorite is the Panang avocado shrimp curry. Absolutely delicious.
author: Stacey R.

description:
In the interest of full disclosure... Before even stepping foot into Thai Idea I already knew it was a 5 star place for me even if they served up steaming turds on a plate I would probably give it 4 stars minimum. It combines my two of my three favorite loves, vegan & Thai food! After my first visit did Thai Idea live up to my expectations? Oh hell yeah!

Since it was Sunday, parking was relatively easy to find. Only took one trip around the block. Upon entering we were greeted by two pretty hostesses. They seated us and were helpful with our questions about the menu. My glass of water always stayed full throughout the meal. You could tell by watching the servers with the other tables, customer service is job one around here. The setting of this place reminds me of a fancy lounge that is a direct contrast from the gritty streets just outside the door. Even the bathroom is nice looking here.

With so much to choose from I think we went a lil buckwild on the menu. We ordered the Thai Samosas, Roti, Tom Kah Soup, & the Volcanic Beef. Of course every Yelp review mentioned the Wing Bomb so we had to order that too. Everthing was so beautifully presented, which is a rarity for veg places not named Millennium. I was salivating just browsing the photos here on Yelp. 

The samosas were excellent! Not a traditional Indian samosa but it was probably my favorite part of the meal. At first I was disappointed that there wasn't a dipping sauce other than what was on the plate. One bite and it turned out it wasn't necessary. This is coming from a self-proclaimed condiment whore. I even ate the edible flower! The wing bomb is in fact da bomb! The sauce perfectly matched the chickenish flavor of the wings. The crispy basil went perfectly with these wings that I damn near licked the serving tray clean!

I will admit the Tom Kha wasn't the best. Way too many onions and not enough spice to overpower the coconut milk. Should've went with the Tom Yum instead here. The Volcanic Beef more than made up for it. The spicy smoked chili sauce melded perfectly with the peppers and "beef". If you like spicy food be sure to specify in advance. Normal heat is good but I can always use a little more kick. 

My only small gripe about this place was they charge extra for soy in the Thai iced tea. With almost everything being vegan why not just make it all vegan since they're already getting rave reviews from vegans, omnivores, and Carniwhores alike?

Up until recently the best place to get fake meat dishes were run by the Supreme Master's disciples. Now not only can you get this at Thai Idea, you also get excellent service and presentation that most veg places lack. In fact with them allowing BYOB wine without charging a corkage fee, I will be celebrating all my special occasions here from now on. No need to shell out extra cash at Millennium when Thai Idea is so exquisite!

After a *short* wait, my babygirl is a fan: http://www.yelp.com/biz/thai-idea-vegetarian-san-francisco-2?hrid=ReSzY37EMvu3O3yXhyWK5g
author: John B.

description:
I won't be going back here.  Dirty bathrooms sticky tables old dirty decor.  
Chicken bomb is dry and tastes old.  We tried a couple of the curries.  Half of the bowl was a huge piece of decorative lettuce.  The imitation shrimp is not worth it, it's drop tasteless and ibis pored.  The curries are nothing special and unbalanced.  One was way too sweet and the other was totally overpowered by the basil.  Definitely can make better curries at home.

This place feels like it might have been really good 5 years ago.  No the kitchen looks pieced together and it tastes like they are serving leftovers they don't want to throw away.

I did not see any of the positive things in other reviews.
author: Jaime S.

description: Tasty food. Ordered a soup with noodles but there wasn't a lot of broth compared to noodles. Nonetheless there were tons of vegan goodies (fish, meat etc.). Not the largest restaurant, but the space is great for going on a date. For this reason, I personally would have liked the interior better if it was more incandescent/low light rather than white lights/silver walls paired
author: Emmeline M.

description:
I've been to SFO probably over a dozen times for work. That having been said, I've only been in the city once before this trip.

My wife came along with me and I'm still adhering to my vegetarian diet. On the BART, we decided to get off at the Civic Center station, or whatever it is, and I found this place on Yelp. I wanted something spicy. We're wandering around en route to the restaurant and the area is just a total dump. People were cat-calling my wife. Drug deals were taking place on the street. This is stuff you don't see in Chicago unless you really go out of your way to be in a bad area.

We get to the place and it's situated next to a massage store. Gross. However, inside, it's wonderfully decorated and people are quietly enjoying their dinners and talking. This place is meat free, so I ordered the pumpkin or squash curry. She asked me how spicy. I said that I wanted spicy. We also got some sodas. I was shocked how expensive one can of soda was. Yikes.

The curry was good, but not as spicy as she promised. There was some kind of chicken substitute in it. Not bad, but I could tell. Sometimes, I prefer unadulterated tofu. My wife's pad sew something was good, but not really my type.

All in all, the prices weren't too bad for a vegetarian restaurant and the food was pretty good. Just, be careful in the area.
author: Jared P.

description:
Thai Idea Vegetarian made this Carniwhore a CONVERT!

The trip to the TL is always an interesting one to say the least. Today's trip was no different. On my way to Thai Idea, I was solicited for money by a woman...on her cell phone, cat called by a toothless man, got mistaken for a tranny (geez, I didn't even have my full-on whore lashes on today) and nearly fed my Uggs into a pile of poop dung not once but five times! But, it was SO worth it...

Ever since opening its door in October 2011, I've been dying to try Thai Idea but being the loser at work I had no one to go with. "You shouldn't have lunch alone..." as Susy C. said, so she kindly accompanied me to Thai Idea along with her friend.

Thai Idea serves authentic vegetarian and vegan Thai dishes which is the first and only restaurant in SF to do so. The extensive menu is most similar to the Osha Thai and just as beautifully presented at the fraction of the cost. Everything on the menu (for lunch and dinner) is no more than $11.95. Coming from a self-professed carniwhore, you will NOT miss meat and your tummy and taste buds will leave satisfied. 

F O O D
*WING BOMB: Veggie Chicken w/ Homemade Sauce & Crispy Basil ($7.95)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/f8kY-c4xNHanSwQuI3nYGg?select=wbHhFicLwf8ruw499kTRqA
As a "I cluck for wings" chicken wings lover, the wing bomb was just as deliciously satisfying. The wooden skewer made to replicate a drumstick was wrapped around faux chicken meat which tasted just as moist and flavorful as chicken thigh meat. The exterior was slightly crispy so you still get a crunch factor to mimic fried chicken skin without the cholesterol. The homemade sauce gave it a nice sticky sweet tang with a fiery kick. 

*PUMPKIN CURRY: Kabocha Pumpkin, Veggie Beef in Red Curry Sauce Topped w/ Crispy Yam & Brown Rice ($8.95)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/f8kY-c4xNHanSwQuI3nYGg?select=h7RwyIzs6E7isWYCf-mbgw
The pumpkin curry was INSANELY good! Silky smooth, the curry was rich in complex spices with a prominent exotic coconut flavor (just the way I like it) and a lovely sweetness from the tender pumpkin. The cow's doppelganger, the veggie beef had the texture of a soft bean curd with a meaty flavor. Paired alongside brown rice made for one of the most guilt-free and delicious dishes I've ever had! 

S E R V I C E
Albeit quiet, the staff was very friendly, prompt and kept our water glasses filled which is a rarity in Asian restaurants. 

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
Earthy chic with its dark wooden panel walls and green and gold art décor on the walls, Thai Idea is nothing you would expect to be located in the TL. With a ~35 person seating, it's best for groups of 4 or less. 

P A R K I N G
Metered street parking.  

As I left Thai Idea, the only thing I can say is...."CARNI-WHO?"
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
You can and will hear every conversation, from the unsalvageable first (and last) date sitting next to you, to the family across the aisle, to the lunchtime business people, to the hipster group in the opposite corner of the room.

Seriously. I've learned numerous people's life goals, corporate agendas, wedding plans, what their cousins are up to these days... you name it. I wasn't trying to pay attention, either. Everything's just in your ears here.

You may also get OPP (Other People's Porcelain). On my side of the room but in the opposite corner, a mug was dropped. Like skipping rocks at the beach, a chip of it bounced across all six tables - and through other people's meals - to my table, only stopping because it hit my bowl.

BANGKOK DUCK (Chef's Suggestions #4 $10.95 Lunch / $11.95 Dinner): Candy Jenga. Yes, the game of stacked wooden blocks, but chewy and sweet. Get multiple orders so you can actually play. If you like sweet entrees. Personally, I'm not into dinnssert.

VOLCANIC BEEF (Chef's Suggestions #2 $10.95 Lunch / $11.95 Dinner): Dormant volcano. Not spicy at all, but that's not a surprise. The presentation was exquisite. If you want it actually hot, emphasize your desire.

A little under 3 stars. Maybe I keep choosing off items.
author: Dan B.

description: I'm an absolute carnivore so I was so surprised when my friend told me half way through the meal that this entire place was vegetarian. The flavors are are so good- we were a party of 9 )who just walked in on this place after watching a movie-what a find!) so we shared all our dishes and everything was superb.
author: Yvonne L.

description: Our food from here was disappointing. We ordered the Pad Thai, which was pretty bland. We liked the veggie soup and red curry, but the "meat" bits were less than convincing (is it tempeh? Jackfruit? We couldn't tell but it tasted fishy?) Considering the price we paid for our dinner, we will not be coming back.
author: Autymn G.

description:
My boyfriend - Mr. Picky with the most sensitive palette I've ever witnessed - summed this place up: "really cheap and really good."

Got pad kee mao with tofu and pad basil with (veggie) chicken for dinner. The pad kee mao was spicy and delicious and full of veggies. Just how I like it! Tried the pd basil chicken and it was a nice element of savory to the meal.

For dessert we had the fried banana with ice cream. We would come back just for that. Amazing.

Also, the employees were super nice.

It's in the loin, but whatever. 

Amazing vegan food when you least expect it!
author: Shauny U.

description:
Came here for a romantic dinner in the city, and loved it.

Yes, its in a sketchy neighborhood, but the food is worth the trek.  Asked for extra spicy, and boy DID WE GET SPICY - be warned when ordering.

Loved the curry dish that came with the roti - best dish by far!
author: Sanjay C.

description: We always have to hit up Thai Idea when we're in the area! Most of the menu is vegan or can be made vegan with minor adjustments. The menu is huge so this gives vegans TONS of options! Everything we've had here has been delicious. The chicken satay is a must, and the pad see ew is also great. Five stars.
author: Kayla E.

description:
I hardly ever go to vegetarian places, since I'm not vegetarian, but a vegetarian friend was in town and I wanted to take her somewhere with lots of options.

This place has such amazing options! I couldn't believe everything on their menu was vegetarian. I got the yellow curry that the waiter suggested, and it was so good-- portions were also extremely large. 

Their thai iced tea is also really on point
author: Jessica Y.

description: This place is awesome! The service was really quick and the food was so good. The best Thai iced tea I've ever had
author: Maci A.

description:
Good service. 
Good food. 
We ordered Tom yum rice, green curry (slightly too sweet for my taste), spring rolls, fried tofu and coconut water. 
Loved their plating too.
author: P K.

description:
I LOVE this place! Their cashew chicken & crab cakes are my favorite & also the pineapple fried rice!
Great service. Nice workers & DELICIOUS food (:
author: Paloma Z.

description: Vegan Thai iced tea? Sold. Tasty food, large portions, varied selection, nice atmosphere, and good service all won me over. Will definitely come back to check out the rest of the menu. Out-of-towners beware: apparently in SF you can get ticketed for not turning your wheels when parking on a hill and it'll cost you 62!
author: Olga G.

description:
Ok first of all, this a a vegetarian restaurant that does so may veggie remakes of meaty food. They had spinoffs of every normal Thai dish. This also made it really hard to decide on what to get. Since I was eating by my lonesome (sucks because you can't order as much), I opted for a few apps which other Yelpers were raving about. 

First I ordered the FIRECRACKER BALLS. AMAZING. It really tasted like Tuna! (I haven't always been vegetarian). They were the perfect size and had a really crunchy outside. The sauce that they accompanied was a perfect pairing. Winner winner tuna dinner. 

Second I ordered the VEGGIE CRAB CAKES. I have to say they are probably better things on the menu. I am a sauce person and they were a little too dry for my liking. I probably just needed more sauce, but still I feel I regret not going with the Wing Bombs. Maybe next time. 

The service was fabulous and the ambiance is pleasant. I also got the THAI ICED TEA which was pretty standard and tasty.
author: Krupa H.

description:
Can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet; I've probably been to Thai Idea over twenty times and I'm still not sick of it! I would probably go as far as to say that this is my favorite thai food in the city. I've explored far and wide, but nothing beats the quality of the tofu red curry here! Thai food is my favorite and I've tried a LOT of places, but this is the place to go! Even though it is all vegetarian, they have imitation meats of all sorts and I've heard they're pretty good from people who actually eat them. Some of my favorites here are the corn fritter, tom kha soup, pad kee mao, and red curry with tofu. They have some pretty unique dishes as well so if you're feeling adventurous, try the volcanic beef or the vindaloo curry, both delicious as well! 

Don't be scared by the location of this place because the food is worth the trek to this sketch part of town. The service isn't that great either, especially if you go with a large group of people but this is not the type of place you go for great service so it's not that big of deal. Basically, go here for thai food in the city!
author: Malika R.

description:
You can tell I'm a huge fan of this restaurant.
I have returned numerous times in a mere matter of weeks.
I really loved the pumpkin curry the last time I had lunch here but today I wanted some bamboo shoots.
I ordered the green curry which has bell peppers, bamboo shoots, basil, and baby corn. 
Chose veggie beef and even that was good.

My friend ordered the yum woon sen which is glass noodle salad (basically think vermicelli) and that was a good dish as well. Light, refreshing, and not too heavy. She ordered it with veggie shrimp and I love the veggie shrimp!
author: Susy C.

description:
It is very surprising to see a restaurant of this caliber in the tenderloin district. Once you manage to navigate past the depressing scenery of drug addicts and homeless, you get to this restaurant and it's all worth it. 

Last time I had a small cup of the Tom Kha soup with tofu and the satay chicken as appetizers. One word - Excellent!  For the entree I ordered the Lamb Yellow Curry with the brown rice for a side. This was amazing as well. 

This time I ordered the Tom Yum soup with veggie chicken for an appetizer. Golly what flavors!  The soup is the perfect appetizer for a cold San Francisco night. For an entree I ordered the Pad Ped spicy with veggie chicken and brown rice.  Excellent and flavorful as expected. 

The unique combination of friendly, prompt service along with excellent vegetarian food presented elegantly is the reason why I am giving it 5 stars.  I wish we had a restaurant like this in Dallas.
author: Gopal R.

description:
First off, in regards to the one star reviews of this place... Completely misleading and undeserved. The food here is great and at the very worst maybe "not bad." I would venture to guess that the terrible reviewers might even be friends or owners of the many competing Thai restaurants in the area. 

That said, the food here is great IMO. My vegan wife and I (I like a little meat but appreciate vegan meals often as they make me feel like I'm making healthy choices) have been here 3 times in the last 2 weeks since discovering it. 

It is hard to find healthy good vegi/vegan food in the lower Peninsula. We came all the way up here from Pacifica just for take out in this 3rd time.
author: Cameron T.

description:
Food/Service here is awesome!
Ordered a papaya salad, spicy fried rice and thai green curry. 
They also accommodated my dietary restriction of food without onion/garlic(Jain).
author: Monal V.

description:
It was not terrible. 

But I would rather have more vegetables in my plate than overdose of soya (and tofu) with whatever that made all type of food taste similarly sweet. Not an authority on Thai cuisine and cannot critique authenticity. But I have had better. 

And wonder why we have to resort to misleading non-vegetarian titles.
author: Abhishek D.

description:
VEGAN review: absolutely amazing. Restaurant is a little crammed but it's a quaint little joint. 

I got the Thai iced tea (never had it before in my life) and their crab cakes. I absolutely died. IT'S SO GOOD. Definitely coming back again to try out everything else!
author: Dorothy T.

description:
Four of us came into this charming little place after a long flight. I had their coconut juice (coconut water with pieces of coconut meat), get it! A friend had their lager which tasted great. For appetizer, we ordered the salad rolls (came with a delicious peanut sauce) and their golden cauliflower. For dinner we ordered the pumpkin curry, papaya salad, pad basil, and the sweat and sour. All great tasting dishes, but I will ask for more spice on the curry and more lemon/chilli sauce on the papaya salad. Ask them what they recommend and you will be set!
Our service was great and the restaurant was well decorated. Go there!
author: Yohana G.

description:
I ordered the veggie pad thai for takeout.  It was watery, strangely sweet, and didn't have the thick savory gooeyness that I was looking for.  From the taste alone it seems like they forgot to put the sauce on entirely.  I can tell from looking at it that's not the case, but the sauce has almost no flavor at all.  It was frankly some of the worst pad thai I've eaten.

I don't write Yelp reviews very often but this was a very disappointing surprise given how good the other reviews are.  Maybe this place is hit or miss, or I just made a bad choice ordering.  I definitely wouldn't recommend the pad thai though.

Two stars instead of one only for friendly staff and a nice decor (although I took my order to go).
author: Sam W.

description:
Reading the reviews I was sure I was going for the pumpkin curry, or maybe the green curry. But I got the crazy idea for the waitress's rec. Vindaloo curry??? 
      omg. One of the best curries I've had. Ever.
author: Scott D.

description:
Last night was my second visit to Thai Idea and it was even better this time! If I could give this place 6 stars, I would. As soon as we walked in the waitress set up two tables so my boyfriend and I could sit next to each other rather than across from each other, and we didn't even ask! 

I am a meat lover, but this place is even better than real meat. We ordered the Wing Bombs as an appetizer and the Pad See Ew and Spicy Lemongrass Beef dishes as entreés. All of the food was fantastic. We brought our own bottle of wine because there is no corkage... how can you beat that? Our entire bill came out to only $33.

Our new Friday night dinner spot is Thai Idea!
author: Jennifer P.

description: Excellent Thai food.  I didn't try any of the fake meat dishes.
author: Barry W.

description: I thought this place was overpriced for what they serve -- vegetables. Portions were also pretty small, and the flavors didn't blow me away. The server was also very awkward, so I felt the experience was somewhat stilted. I won't be back.
author: Alexis Y.

description:
Though reluctant, I have to take away one star from my favorite vegetarian restaurant based on my most recent visit. I've been here several times and it never disappointed, until this time. I've been telling my friend about this place for long, and finally we were in the neighborhood and she insisted on trying it out. 

I'm only complaining about the Pad See-ew that I ordered. I've had it before and it tasted great. However, this time, the egg was burnt and the entire dish tasted burnt and bitter. I couldn't stand it so I asked the waiter to bring it back to the kitchen. When the new dish came out, it tasted exactly the same like the first dish, the egg still burnt and the noodle bitter. I was so...disappointed that I had a few bites only. 

Despite this minor setback, the rest of the food here is still amazing. 

Crispy Cauliflower -- 4.5 STARS -- Deep fried Cauliflower, with sweet sauce and shredded sweet potato strips. I love the long dish they use to hold the cauliflower, so instead of cluster together, each cauliflower stood in the place, good to the eye as well as the mouth. 

Panang Avocado Shrimp -- 5 STARS -- I can't recall having avocado in a stir-fried dish before, though the avocado was not cooked but place in the creamy curry sauce after the shrimp and bell pepper (green and red) strips were cooked. The savory taste of the curry complemented well with the creamy texture of the avocado. I would suggest having brown rice with the dish, because the roughness and firmness of brown rice (compared to brown rice) balance out the creaminess of the curry and avocado. 

Lastly, the service there can use some improvement, more smiles would do.
author: Maggie L.

description: I have eaten here twice. The first time was great: lots of good vegetarian/vegan options, decent service, and tasty food. Second time: average service and a broken hairpin in my friend's dish. Didn't have much of an appetite after that, and although they removed his dish from the bill, there was no apology.
author: Thomas S.

description:
This is the second time I've checked out Thai Idea Vegetarian and I enjoyed my experience both times! I was ISO a vegan restaurant for Thanksgiving and was excited to try Thai Idea. The ambiance was cozy and welcoming. The waitress was attentive and really sweet.
She recommended some exceptional dishes. We tried the pad thai, pad see ew, the mushroom appetizer, and a curry dish - all were flavorful and we left super full and thankful.
I visited Thai Idea a second time last night and tried the pad see ew again -on point and the eggplant tofu dish - on point. 
I love their vegetarian take on traditional Thai dishes. 

100
author: Ash H.

description:
Still YUM & amazing! We do not come to the City very often, but somehow I have still come to this place several times, because every time we do I have to come here!

+ Firecracker Balls are still an appetizer favorite! Next time I want to try the Wingbomb. It looks like big ol' drumsticks!

+ The Thai fried rice with shrimp is delicious! Spiciness varies by day and chef though. Two times I asked for medium spicy. One time it came with no heat & other time it was hot!

+ Service here is great. Waitresses are all very attentive, prompt to take drink & food orders, clear dishes, & refill your water every 5 min. Seriously, the minute I lowered the water level a bit, they were right there to fill it back to the top!

+ The food presentation is important here! Dishes come out with neat & creative displays- every detail is covered here!

+ The decor of this place is Thai inspired modern, clean, & comfortable with decorative cushions along their booths.

Don't be scared of the location- this place is a must see/drink/EAT!
author: Kimberly A.

description: I have mixed feelings about this restaurant. The outside has a lot of construction goin' out, but the inside is very nice. The service was "meh". It felt like my lunch date and I were an inconvenience to our server. Overall, each dish was good.. However, I had to add something (ie: soy sauce, black pepper, hot sauce, etc.) to every dish to make it taste better. For a $30 (w/o tip) lunch, I wouldn't return. I enjoy the idea of an all vegetarian/vegan Thai restaurant though.
author: Jennae H.

description: i love this place. the food is amazing and the service is on point. the two girls who works there are so welcoming and professionals. my husband and i've been going back every saturday since we discovered this place. This is a perfect vegan restaurant in the city
author: emukka y.

description: Just went back to Thai Idea after a few years, not sure why I waited so long. I could live out the rest of my days swimming in their pumpkin curry. It's full of perfectly blanched vegetables, amazing aroma, and sweet taste... I'll be back soon.
author: Moline D.

description: A lovely Thai place in the TL. Pretty atmostphere, delicious food, friendly staff.
author: Mars R.

description:
This was an above average meal with way way above average company. :) Came here with Amitt and Padmini on a Wednesday night.

* It's BYOB!! So go next door, and grab a mini bottle of wine or some beers!

FOOD:
+Firecracker Balls- they came pretty close to the Ahi Tuna with this appetizer- get it!
+Wing Bombs- could have passed on this; it was just bland, fried fake meat
+Lychee Iced Tea- YUM, for the lychee lovers, ORDER THIS!
+Cashew Nut "Chicken"- everything but the fake dark chicken thing was good, the sauce, the cashews, fresh vegetables
+Vindaloo Curry with "Chicken"- everyone at the table loved this; it comes with Roti Parata but the curry was too sweet for my taste
+Spicy Fried Rice with Tofu- another hit at the table, but we ordered it "Above average" spice level and our friends were huffing and puffing

AMBIENCE:
-it's in the heart of the tenderloin, so you have to walk past the homeless to get inside, but once inside, the decor is very appealing

SERVICE:
Made reservations and they promptly seated us. The staff don't speak English very well, so they couldn't understand half our requests and looked us very confused when we were ordering.

My Vegetarian husband enjoyed it, but I'm on the fence about coming back

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: Great service.  Great prices. Great selection of vegan meats like lamb, shrimp, duck, chicken, and beef.  The veggie catfish was incredible.
author: Kory-Oren E.

description:
"Meet us at Thai Idea"
"uhh okay, thai food right?"
"ya, its vegan"

ummmm excuse me? Vegan?

Vegetarian? Yes. Vegan? Never tried it, nonetheless, a freaking Thai place.

I was skeptical of trying this place. I've never been to a vegan restaurant, and naturally my friends dragged me here. I was shocked how great and tasty and the choices!

Yes, the meat is tender, but its soooo good! I do have the option of eating beef and pork here as well, but I opted out. 

Everything we ordered was amazing. And for the price, the portions were pretty big. 

This is a must for me If I'm ever in the area!
author: Nika K.

description:
My go to vegetarian restaurant in San Francisco. This is actually my favorite Thai restaurant too. Great flavors, chill atmosphere and terrific service every time.
Favorites are chicken satay and pineapple fried rice.
author: J R.

description:
This is the best Thai food I have had in the city. Seems very modest when you walk. But the ingredients and food is mind blowing. 

Definitely try the soups! We had the Tom yum veggie! 

Also the papaya salad is amazing. 

Pad Thai and green curry with rice where the bomb.

The reason it was so great - you can taste the fresh vegetables and right amount of spice and ginger.
author: Raj S.

description:
I've eaten here a few times and every time I still find myself asking, "How is this not meat?" Thai Idea does an excellent job utilizing meat-like ingredients and infusing authentic Thai flavors into their dishes. If you never told me I was eating Veggie meats I would have never guessed! 

As an added plus, the intimate, richly decorated interior creates a nice dining environment and welcome respite from the T-Loin.
author: Monelle A.

description: One of my new favorite places in San Franciso.  Great vegetarian food, great prices, the mango rice dessert, the service and the late hours of service for the opera just works for me.
author: Fulano C.

description:
Good, but it's in the tenderloin, and not good enough for me to need to go back.

The Food: 
- Wing Bombs: we ordered these twice because they were so good.
- Firecracker Balls: good, but small. 
- Pad See Ew: not my favorite. In fact, I probably wouldn't order it again. The noodles were overcooked
- Red Curry chicken: Not memorable, and I ate it last night. 
- Volcanic Beef: Looks nothing like beef, but was one of the better dishes. 
- Bangkok Veggie Duck: 4 of us liked it, 1 didn't. It's bound to happen, but it's a very different texture from the standard soy.
author: Dimple B.

description:
I've come here a few times with my vegetarian GF. It's become somewhat of a favorite of hers when in SF.

Located amidst the construction, it's easy to pass by this small, cozy place. Usually it's not necessary to make reservations for a couple, but for larger parties I would say definitely do that. Once seated you'll find the staff is pretty friendly and understanding of any changes or requests to the dishes.

The Wing Bomb is my appetizer of choice, followed by the Firecracker Balls! The sauce and seasoning on the Wing Bomb 'drumsticks' is so delicious. More sweet than I typically like, but not enough to turn me off.

For an entree I typically get the Spicy 'Beef' Fried Rice. Let's just say I definitely leave this place happy, lol. The dish is more tame in terms of spiciness in comparison to other Thai places. However, I'm sure if you want very spicy, they will surely accommodate. The 'Beef' has that chewiness that fake beef usually has, but it's probably one of the best I've tried (in terms of how close it actually is to real beef).

The area of town is not the best, I don't really ever come after dark.
author: Stephen R.

description:
Really great taste and nice presentations to their plates. I did think that their entree plates were big in proportions. 

Will definitely recommend this place to friends :)
author: Vianni G.

description:
Yes yes yes. Yes. Neighborhood is culturally appropriate (lots of Vietnamese, Cambodian, etc. stores) but a bit sketchy at times. 

Entering makes you forget about the hot street. Staff was very friendly and pleasant. No qualms about refilling my water every three minutes - and the place was quite full. 

I ordered the veggie lamb (soy-based) yellow curry. Exactly what I wanted. A simple but wonderfully prepared curry. Just the mock lamb, potatoes, onions and a delectable curry sauce. So happy I made the long walk to give this place a chance.
author: Guillaume O.

description:
When my husband said he wanted to take me to a vegetarian restaurant, I prepared myself for disappointment.  I am a vegetarian, but usually find that vegetarian restaurants (such as Golden Era) are a disappointment.  

Luckily, this is not the case with Thai Idea!

We started off with the roti and crispy spring rolls (delish!).

Even though I was apprehensive about what to expect, I was excited to be able to order anything off the menu instead of being relegated to Pad Thai or unimpressive blocks of tofu in what is probably a lovely sauce on real meat.

I ordered the Cashet Nut "Chicken" and it was very tasty.  The "chicken" is tofu that has been texturized to give a closer (albeit not exact) match to the real deal.  It was flavorful and I had to really control myself to not chow down the entire thing.  (It was quite a large portion.)

My husband got the Bangkok Duck.  I was a little scared to try it, since I wouldn't eat duck if I weren't veggie, but he promised it was good.  He was right!  Crispy, fried outside and layers of thin texturized tofu inside.  Yum, yum, yum!  I couldn't decide which item I liked best.

My husband (the carnivore) said he didn't even miss the meat.  

We'll definitely be going back.

The neighborhood was a little sketchy, but the inside of the restaurant was very cute and not at all busy on a Thursday night.  The staff were all extremely friendly and attentive.
author: T. M.

description: Had lunch here, quiet and didn't have to wait. Everything we ordered was delicious. Tasted like Thailand! yum
author: Amber L.

description:
This is, by FAR, the best Thai restaurant for vegetarians. I've been there a number of times and it's consistently good, so when vegetarian friends and family come from out of town, I try to take them to this place. There are plenty of vegan Asian places in the Bay Area, and I've been to many of them, but this is on a different level. The food is uniformly tasty Thai cuisine, and the presentation is great.
It's a relief to go to a Thai restaurant and not have to worry about hidden fish sauce, and contrary to what some may believe, you can make delicious Thai cuisine without it! It's in a somewhat questionable area, but the restaurant itself is cute and cozy. Service is friendly and efficient.
author: Nishka B.

description:
I've never had even mediocre Thai in a veggie Thai restaurant, and this is no different. 

I'm in love with Pumpkin Curry these days and theirs had even more veggies than usual, more to love! It's worth noting that they will spice it up if you ask. Our Tom Yum was hoooot, and had a ton of veggies as well. 

Great prices too!
author: Mari H.

description:
Great food, great service.

First of all, let me just say that I am delighted than their entire menu is vegan or can be made vegan. There is no meat, no fish sauce, none of that. It's a 100% vegetarian facility. 

My family brought me here for an early birthday celebration. We decided to go family style and just order several things, to get a little taste of everything. 

Appetizers: 
*Firecracker Balls: These are described as "Veggie Ahi tuna roll, panko deep-fried, mayomustard & spicy sauce". These were hot tasty. The breadcrumbs on the outside had a great crunch factor. Definitely tasted a lot like a real tuna roll. 

*Corn Fritter: A bit disappointing. Not my favorite. 

Mains:
*Pineapple fried rice: Pretty straightforward. Lots of chunks of pineapple, vegetables, and veggie shrimp. It can also be ordered vegan, so they can skip the egg. 

*Green Curry: This was my favorite out of the bunch. I definitely recommend it. Great flavors. I would probably order it spicy next time, since it was more on the sweet side.

*Bangkok Duck: On the menu, it's described as "Tamarind glazed crispy fried Veggie duck confit with crispy shallots and chili." It seemed to be wrapped in some type of puff pastry. My dining companions really enjoyed it. I've only had duck once, but it was a pretty close match. 

*Pad Ped: I was eyeing either the Eggplant or the Vegetable Combination, but my brother seemed to think those were "boring", so I opted for this instead. It has a spicy red sauce (a bit on the salty side) with bell peppers, onions, cauliflower, broccoli, eggplant. 

Dessert: 
*Fried Banana: YUM. This was a great ending to our meal. The outside coating was golden brown and had a perfect texture. The coconut ice cream on the side was cool and refreshing. They even gave us six small plates and spoons so we could share. 

Service was warm and friendly. Our water glasses were never empty. We felt very welcome here. 

The presentation of the food was FABULOUS. Everyone described it as being "very clean". Shaved beets or shaved carrots adored the side of most plates, as well as an orchid. The interior of the restaurant is exceptionally clean and relaxing, a stark contrast from the rest of the Tenderloin. 

I am definitely looking forward to returning.
author: Brandi W.

description:
If I want to eat meat, I will eat real meat. I hate overly processed fake meat (chicken, shrimp, beef, or whatever) that make you full but nutritionally is not good for you.

My friend found this place and we had dinner here tonight.

I am glad that on most of the dishes we do have a choice of fake meat, or real vegetables or tofu. No fish sauce is used in the dishes or the dipping sauces (we asked!) We had:

-Crispy Spring Rolls
-Som Tum (green papaya salad) with tofu
-Fried (brown) Rice Pad Thai with vegetables
-Pumpkin Curry with tofu

The Spring Rolls were crispy, light, though a bit on the oily side. Tasted just okay.

Som Tum was excellent. Just the right amount of sweet, sour and saltiness. The Papaya was shredded a bit thicker than what I usually expect. It tasted crunchy and fresh.

The fried brown rice was not soggy, and the rice was not hard or mushy. It had the awesome burning fragrance from the wok.

The Pumpkin curry is actually not pumpkin, and I am glad that it is not. It's kabocha squash! Which has more of a chewy texture than the mushy pumpkin. The curry broth is fantastic. The vegetables tasted fresh, tender but not overly cooked.

The presentation of all the dishes were beautiful. They were garnished with bright and fresh veggies.

Service was quick, friendly. Oh, and they keep refill our water glasses throughout the entire dinner. That's service!

We will be back to try other dishes. Highly recommended.
author: Mango M.

description:
Like a diamond in the rough, Thai Idea shines in the rough and tumble Tenderloin.

I came here for lunch with a friend and we were warmly greeted with glasses of water and a cup (well, a mug) of complimentary carrot soup, which was think, hot, and hit the spot on a cold autumn San Francisco day.

I ordered the tom kha gai soup--large proportion piled high with an assortment of mushrooms, veggies, and "chicken."  What a great value at under $3.

I also ordered the pad kee mow with "chicken," and OMG it was so spicy!  I must have downed at least 5 glasses of water.  Again, I was offered a generous proportion, and I ended up only eating half and taking the rest to go.  Very flavorful and full of spices!  But like I said, this dish is SPICY!!!  sizzle!

The interior is cozy and very nicely done.  You might want to bring a jacket with you as the front door lets in a lot of drafts.

I can't wait to come back and try some of the other dishes that Thai Idea has to offer!
author: Matt S.

description: Had the Tom Yum soup no,noodles., broth was tasty but the broccoli was wilted and yellowish. Lots of carrots too. Overall the dish was OK. Unfortunately, an hour later for the about 24 hours I got GI problems and got sick.
author: C E.

description:
This veggie restaurant had been so good until last Wednesday I had brought my friends there to try. Totally disappointed it :.( 
not sure what happened?  We asked the waitress is chef had changed. She said no .every dish was not tasted the same.
author: Amy C.

description: Amazing food!! My favorites were the samosa appetizers and the pumpkin curry.
author: Bonnie C.

description:
Vegetarian restaurants always have inflated reviews, because let's be honest, they don't have that many options (phew! so glad I'm not vegetarian). I try to keep an open mind, went to Source for their veggie pizza, and yuck. 

I love Thai food and felt there was no way Thai Idea could compete in a city filled Thai options. There are some things that were weird but tasted OK, like the Wing Bombs (tasted sweet, more like tofu though) and Volcanic Beef (which had an OK  flavor and had an interesting bouncy, rubbery texture). The Pad Thai Chicken was very ketchupy, definitely had better at Osha or Thai House. The Tom Kha was extremely watery / diluted and strange.. yuck.

But the Pad See Ew is seriously one of the best I've had in the city, I actually plan to order delivery since they have a location near me in Bernal Heights!
author: Jess C.

description: Food was decent, they charge $3 for a side of brown rice.. Curry and rice came out to $16+tip which is ok for San Fran but it was lacking flavor and was watered down. Don't recommend this place.
author: Marina K.

description:
Atmosphere: great atmosphere. Really quiet and set up well. Very well put together. 

Service: good. Waitress visited the table several time, kept drinks full. 

Food: spring roll appetizer was great! I didn't think the entrees were exceptional but still not the worst Thai I've had. I did appreciate that the entire menu is vegan friendly, that's a huge boost. 

Price: pretty pricy. Not a place to go if you're on a budget. I think that appetizer I mentioned was like $8. Soo beware of that. You've been warned. At the same time, I'm okay with paying for good food, I just the price was high for the quality I got here. 

4 = good atmosphere, service, and food was okay. Price was a downfall. I had an okay time, probably would eat there again.
author: Alvin A.

description: Good service,  fabulous presentation and tasty food.  Found the place on yelp and the ratings given to this place are well deserved.   Enjoyable evening and appears to be open late.   A definite thumbs up to this place.   If eating vegetarian,  why eat imitation meat.  We tried every dish with Tofu.   Excellent taste.   Good portions.    Fried Banana with ice cream has a unique presentation.
author: Sanjay Y.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in the Tenderloin, possibly all of SF. It's also the best Thai cuisine I've been to, vegetarian or not. Omnivores, don't be afraid of the fake meats! They are delicious! 

The service is excellent as well. The waitresses are very attentive, yet never interrupt your conversations. My glass of water never goes more than a few minutes without being filled to the brim. 

The curries here are insane! I love the Lamb Yellow Curry, the Panang Curry, the Green Curry and the Pumpkin Curry. My favorite appetizer is the Fresh Salad Rolls, with the Firecracker Balls in a close second.
author: Walter R.

description:
This is a decent little--and I do mean little--place in the Tenderloin that does a pretty good job with their food. It's open late too, so that's nice.

The first time I ate at Thai Idea I'd been in the Nob Hill area having drinks with a friend. I needed to get back on BART and eat. Lo and behold there was a vegan Thai place in between me and Powel Street Station. Perfect! As I walked, it occurred to me that the neighborhood was getting worse by the foot. I'm not from SF, don't live in SF, so it took me a while to realize I was in the Heart of the Tenderloin late on a Saturday night. Thankfully I'm not a likely mugging candidate so I powered on.

Both times I've been their the staff has been friendly. Both times I got noodles: Pad Kee Mao the first time, Pad Thai the second. The first time I had a few more drinks in me and honestly can't remember much more than that it was good. The "chicken" (not really meat) in my Pad Thai the second time was kind of bread-like, which wasn't great. However the "Wing Bomb" I had as an appetizer was good.
author: Damon T.
