description: Meh.Its a cute place with nice employees but I wouldn't rush back. The "vegetarian " meat is odd. I love thai food and wouldn't put this in my places to go for great Thai food.
author: Tiffanye H.

description:
Talk about a hidden gem... just a hop (over some pee puddles), skip (around an open manhole) and jump (over some weave in the street) from Market street. 

This place is a real treat, vegetarian or not. Since becoming a vegetarian 10 years ago, I've been able to find great meat alternatives at many restaurants and grocery stores but nothing quite like this. Our table tried a little bit of everything, because, come on. I loved the duck, chicken, and the shrimp. Not to mention the noodles and rice were some of the best I've ever had at any Thai restaurant. 

Will definitely be back, next time wearing stretch pants.
author: Meg I.

description:
Out visiting SF, we ate here our first night. Slightly rough neighborhood but no regrets on going.

Wing bombs were, bomb.
I've had other veggie wings/drumsticks made of what seems to be the same type of mock meat but what makes these wings unique is the sauce. Sweet with a little kick of spice. Yummy and beautiful as all of the food that I saw was.

Bangkok duck had a kind or weird texture, but the mock meat and sauce did not lack in flavor. The sauce was so tasty. I would order this again.

Also ordered the lychee tea. I'm not sure if they add in an artificial flavor or what. It's a strong lychee flavor and pretty sweet which I'm not used to with tea. I usually don't put sugar in tea at all. Very good also though.

I think everything we ordered was a success. 

I loved the seating, they have bench style seating on one side with chairs on the other and cute little pillows on the benches. I thought that was a nice touch. I haven't really seen that at restaurants.  

The staff was extra friendly, helpful and attentive even on the crowded night we went. Will be back here on any future trip to SF.
author: Stacey A.

description:
San Francisco has such a rich Asian-American history that one must surely expect to find tasty Asian food. A quick search on Yelp led our party to this place. 

As we had a large party we were able to order the following vegetarian dishes: Wing bomb, Firecracker, Thai fried rice , Pad Thai, Lemongrass beef, Combination vegetables, and Bangkok duck. 

We were all not disappointed. The flavors mixed well. The level of spicy was just right when combined with some hot sauce on the side. 

This is a place to remember for those on the hunt for some Asian vegetarian cuisine.
author: Jeff W.

description:
Food is ok. Service is ok.

Things I didn't like:

My glass of water had debris floating in it. 

The staff refused to split a bill more than 2 ways. 

Things I like: 
Eh.
author: Joe M.

description:
Where do I start with this? Total awesomeness in my mouth!
Rolled in from a long drive, starving but not stopping for anything mediocre. I found other fellow veg heads raving about this joint, so I had to try it! 
And man am I glad I did! Started off with some wing bombs, da bomb!
Usually I'm not big on meatlike things but these bad boys had me sprung! Totally forgot I was supposed to be "sharing" with my gf (my bad). 
Next came the pad kraw which stated on the menu that it would be "slightly spicy" and I was like "oh no big, I eat jalapeños in my sleep" Psssh WRONG I don't know if slightly means something different in NorCal than SoCal but I suppose so because one bite had me chugging my Chang beer a la Homer Simpson during the chili cook off episode but aside from the hotness surprise it was so delicious and flavorful it made glad I came! Will be back soon! Wing bombs forever
author: Adriana A.

description: Wasn't that impressed.. a little over priced for the quality of ingredients but probably not their fault aa they're trying to profit in an expensive real estate market. I don't think I'd order again though..
author: V A.

description: Very rare you find vegetarian Thai food. Not only they have a lot of varieties but also food is amazing. This is part of our must visit places every 2 months.
author: Amit G.

description: Thai Idea is quite simply my favorite Thai restaurant and one of my favorite vegan spots. A close friend and I drive across the city to eat here all the time because it has predictably wonderful food and an extremely friendly and accomodating staff. We have never had to wait for a table and while you'd think the parking would be hard, we have never had trouble parking in the neighborhood either. The presentation of the food is beautiful and there are no filler vegetables... you know what I mean... the inexpensive vegetables that no one wants to eat. Thai Idea doesn't do that. :-) I have brought some meat eating friends here and they have all been impressed and the most meat and dairy knoshing of my friends said that he'd eat here all the time if he lived in SF.  I just wish they had a restaurant in Oakland.
author: Karen S.

description:
I eat meat and this was by far some of the best vegetarian Thai food I've had. The pumpkin curry is amazing! It's a very relaxing place to take friends or loved ones. Good Thai beer and amazing customer service. The nicest people work there! Lots of warm positive vibes! Order the brown rice too! It's wonderful! 

This is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco
author: Jacques D.

description: This is honestly the best vegan food I've ever had. Their imitation meat is phenomenal! The service was quick and the food was amazing. I would have given them more stars if I could. I'm pretty much speechless
author: Stella M.

description: Place used to be better about a year ago, they have since tremendously downsized proportions and increased prices. We spent over $120 for 6 people and left hungry. Food tastes great but they definitely took a huge profit when compared to portions. Really upset about that change otherwise this place was a gem.
author: Vee P.

description: Edible. Mega creepy neighborhood, homeless people stare at you when you eat. Prostitutes pass by.
author: Dennis Z.

description:
Healthy, non-greasy, super tasty vegan dream with the perfect amount of service.  I wish they delivered, so we wouldn't have to rely on Los Ros, which is also not a bad place, but a tad bit less vegan friendly, this place with slightly better food overall.   They have creamy peanut dripping satay sticks and meat substitutes like the carnivorous-consistency Wing Bomb.  Sometimes you miss the carnal-ness of flesh eating even with your enlightened Vegan dietary choice.  If you are going down that route, down the route of concentrated and processed meat substitutes, it's always good to start the pallet out with the healthy papaya stuff - called the Som Tum Salad to balance everything out in an aggregate sense.  Their Pad Thai is amazing too, biting into its thick noodle, a consistency that also ranks up there for those who like that kinda stuff.    It's all mouth watering.  Umm, except for their Green Curry, but that's probably just my own taste buds or maybe it's the fact that the only time I got it, I felt that the eggplant wasn't cooked to it's proper "meltedness", a proper tenderness so fragile that the eggplant's skin and pulp slices upon forktouch, then taking some of that seasoned eggplant skin and pulp, mixing it into the forkful of rice before dropping off that whole multidimensional admixture into the mouth, the spices, pulp, skin, oils penetrating the rice, activating your tastebudes in a far eastern fugue.  This is good karma.  Their Red Curry rocks, and they can make it all mild, like we need to do it, us with young kids and all.  Their pumpkin curry doesn't disappoint either, now finding ourselves ordering it a bunch now in October and all.

We mostly order takeout and sometimes come-on in.  They are always gracious and accommodate our stroller needs in that small hallways in-between sets of table high table-surface area salon.  They are all smiles with our kids and nice and can't keep their eyes off of them in a cute way when the place is empty.  We come here a lot too.  Clean bathroom means clean kitchen too, and it's always clean.  Just saying.

There are other things we have yet to venture-into: Veggie Lamb Yellow Curry.  Volcanic Beef, et al.  All can be made Vegan.

What's not to like about this little gem on Polk Street?  It's places like this that stops my family of 5 from moving from a two bedroom in the city to a four in the East Bay, our picky little vegan family.
author: Khash C.

description:
1. Amazing service

2. Great prices.

3. Wonderful flavor + beautiful presentation.

4. Vegetarian!

Do not let the location fool you - you get 5 star treatment at this lil joint :)

I haven't eaten meat in soooo long and was SO excited to come here. I could order without thinking :P

Got the duck, pineapple fried rice w/ chicken + shrimp (omg. I know), chicken wings and pumpkin curry. Everything was AMAZING. Fried rice had the best flavor and I loved how the veggies were not wilted and completely cooked down in the curry. Curry was not heavy at all. yum yum.

I cannot wait to come back!!
author: Selina W.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE :D! It wasn't too crowded (Thursday around 8 PM) and the waitresses were really nice except we kept losing plates that they thought we weren't using and sneakily taking them away ahaha.

I came here for my birthday and split ~6 things family style :}. Almost everything was amazing!! The only thing I didn't really like was the Firecracker balls that were a bit too hard. The fake meat in the Volcanic Beef tasted a little weird, too, but it was still good! The rest of the things we had: Papaya Salad, Praram, Roasted Duck Curry, and Pineapple Fried Rice were amazing!! Yumm it was soo good! I think that was all we ordered, but I don't remember which one had fake shrimp in it. I remember the fake shrimp cause it tasted eerily real!! Haha.

I highlyy suggest any of those four items. I freaking love Thai food and I freaking love this place!
author: Betty W.

description: Delicious, all vegetarian thai food heaven! I don't remember what we got the last time I went, except the pad kee mao, which was fantastic. I've also tried the red curry, which was a little too rich for me. We also got some imitation-meat dishes, which we loved. This is a great stop if you're looking for some vegetarian, but still delicious, thai food. It's decently priced and a good place to sit inside too (most thai restaurants I feel aren't as nice on the inside).
author: Anu P.

description:
My coworkers and I were debating what to have for lunch, and I suggested we order from Thai Idea because I've really come to like their pad Thai and quick service.  This time, I ordered the pineapple fried rice, and my coworkers ordered the pad Thai rice.

Our dishes were so disappointing!  My rice was super greasy, and the fake shrimp kept jumping off my fork (I thought that was very strange..).  My coworkers said their rice had no flavor, just grease.

I think I'll just stick to ordering pad Thai noodles.
author: Vira P.

description: The food quality was downhill this time around, maybe it had to due with the management being changed. The high reviews are from another time if you were wondering. The dishes didn't come with mock meat as advertised. Everything we order tasted like tasteless frozen vegetables stabbed onto a plate. The service was rude, they rushed us out. The gratuity was already built into the bill about 19% or something like that. SF has a lot of great vegan joints I suggest going elsewhere.
author: Akta P.

description:
Awesome flavoful kick to every dish

Wing bomb
- great imitation chicken with honey sauce with some spicy flavor - a great appetizer

Bangkok duck
-tasted like actual marinated duck meat - amazing!  deep fried with sweet sauce on top which is always a good thing.  it's just that it's a little pricy at $12 for a small stack

Volcanic beef
- great imitation but very salty.  i appreciated the fresh basil and tasted just like the volcanic beef at osha

Pineapple fried rice 
- so super flavorful that i felt like I needed plain rice to go with it. Don't know if that's a good or a bad thing ...

18% gratuity automatically tacked on for parties 4 or more. Pretty slick of the waitress to immediately take the itemized revisit away which shows the gratuity charge and bring back a credit card charge reciept that showed a gratuity chart, I could see how people can easily be tricked into paying 30%+ tip

a little pricy but overall very flavor packed food.  this place would definitely be a good place from turning meat eaters into vegetarians because of all the great meat substitutes.  i would come here again if i wanted to convert a carnivore
author: Tina A.

description: First time here and it was not really good experience. The food was not as good as I expected. The price was kinda high in this area, but it's ok I would pay that high price if the food is good... But... I think I wouldn't come back.
author: Sloan L.

description:
The first vegan/vegetarian place I liked, and they are also one of the best thai places i've been to!!
really cute decor, nice crowd, really close to where i live!
good service too :)
author: Namrata J.

description: Great veggie Thai. Highly recommend even if you r not veggie. All are tasty. Can be spicier for me but just add more. Great service and good for delivery.
author: Hamila K.

description:
Thai Idea is very good, far better than any of the numerous Thai restaurants I've tried in the Bay Area.

They earn a solid 4 stars based on quality and they absolutely deserve the 5th star for plethora of vegetarian options.

Also, they're really really fast. The first time I ordered takeout they said "it'll be ready in 10 minutes" and it was. I had to really hustle to get over there on time. If they had delivery I'd order multiple times a week.
author: Carl H.

description: I wanted to like the food here and support a vegetarian restaurant, but taste was disappointing.  Everything I ordered was bland.  The faux meat quality left a lot to be desired.
author: Robert W.

description: so lucky that we don't make reservation and get the last free table! First of all, the service is so good！and the food （if u love thai way）is out of my expectation. It's worth trying！
author: Dawn T.

description:
Oh, d-d-d-dearrrrr, Thai Idea Vegetarian! You gone done make me a fan, have me write you a fantastic review, spread the word about how good your food is and that everyone should try it, and THEN, in a month RAISE YOUR PRICES?!?

You've lost one previously-happy-regular. I'm now a I'll-go-eat -there-if-I-don't have-any-other-option kinda guy.

Tsk tsk.
author: Mike N.

description:
Came here with a friend on Tuesday around 6:00pm.  The restaurant was not packed at all.  

I like the decor of the restaurant...very cozy and trendy; totally different feeling from outside of the restaurant (You know Tenderloin area).  

The service was pretty good here.  Very welcome, friendly and attentive.  

We ordered: 

Crab Cakes (3 stars) - three decent size crab cakes.  It tasted ok.  The sauce was pretty good thou. 

Fresh Spring Rolls (4 stars) - pretty tasty.  All ingredients were fresh.  The sauce was flavorful but I wish it could be more sauce...

Tom Yum (4 stars) - it was very good.  A lot of vegetables and the soup was flavorful.  We asked for spicy but it was not too spicy at all.  

Lamb Curry (4 stars) - The curry was very good.  Creamy and flavorful.  My friend doesn't like this dish because he said the curry was little bit too sweet.  But I think it was ok.  I heated it up the next day, and the taste was still very good.  

Thai Crepe (3 Stars) - The presentation was very nice but the crepe was kinda cold and little hard on the edges.  

I can't wait to go back!
author: Liza T.

description:
Delicious! The food is so so tasty- vegetarians luckout at this great place. The food is fresh, delicious and inexpensive. And the service is equally wonderful. You can't go wrong with any dish- really! 

Carnivores can also really enjoy this- we love mock duck basil curry. It is tofu, it doesn't taste exactly like duck, but has a great taste, consistency, full flavor- they just do everything right.
author: S R.

description:
What a shock this place is when you first walk in. For anyone who knows this neighborhood, one wouldn't expect much from a small little space. But the owners have done a great job making the place look really classy. The dishware and presentation is all right on. Even the bathroom is cool, with a clear sink!

But onto the food. I had heard a lot about Thai idea before going. I had big expectations and they were not let down at all. For a vegetarian/vegan, the menu will be a bit overwhelming with so many options you wouldn't normally have at a Thai restaurant. After much deliberation, I settled on the pumpkin curry with tofu. So good! Perfect size, tender vegetables, and again, great presentation. Also shared the samosas with my girlfriend, and they too were delicious.

The price point is a little higher than I would have expected before going into the place. But with the quality and overall experience, it's worth it.
author: Jon T.

description:
First completely vegan Thai restaurant I have ever been to...and love it! A couple of us just stumbled upon it in search of a bite to eat. I've been there twice in under one week! Once for lunch and once for dinner! 

All the dishes here are pure vegetables or made with vegan meat. All the traditional meals you would find at a Thai restaurant are made here sans real meat! Yay. They even have the fake shrimp (made from yam flour) and even go as far as imitating a duck dish (which is delicious by the way!)

One thing that we were told by a fellow diner, was we absolutely must try the Golden Cauliflower Appetizer. We did and it  was amazing! It tastes like honey glazed chicken wings, but even better!

This is a small restaurant tucked away along the other buildings along Polk Street in little Saigon. The restaurant is very clean and the decor is comtemporary and chic. I would definitely bring a date here and he or she would be impressed whether they were vegan or not. ;-)
author: Cassandra E.

description:
I generally stay away from vegetarian places, but the high rating drew me in.

I got the Pad Thai with vegetarian chicken (~$9.50). The plate was huge, delicious, and beautifully placed. It even had a flower on top! I would definitely come and eat it again. But, we got an appetizer called Firecracker Balls(?) which are some sort of vegetarian tuna rolls with a spicy sauce on top and I wouldn't get that again. (I don't recommend that you get it either)

The staff was friendly, refilled my water frequently, and took away our plates promptly.  You couldn't have asked for better service.

The atmosphere was also nice if you were looking for a place to go on a lunch date.
author: Richard P.

description: Avacado shrimp curry and crab cakes are to die for! The shrimp texture was very authentic. The restaurant has nice ambience and friendly staff.
author: S V.

description:
Thai food is usually pretty tasty to begin with, so I was thinking vegan wouldn't taste any different.  It sure did not disappoint!  

Ordered the Wing Bomb  (vegan chicken wings) as appetizers, eggplant with veggie chicken and the duck confit to share.   The wings had a bit of mushroom taste to me, but it was good...probably not as good as I expected it to be, but it's good.  The other two entrees were a bigger portion than I thought.  I really liked the eggplant with chicken, but it was a tad on the salty side.  It would go great with hot sauce!

The duck was fried on the outside, giving it a crispy texture, with layers of tofu skin and mushrooms inside.  I liked it!  I didn't like the honey sauce it came with on the side since I thought it tasted great without it already.  We paired everything with their brown rice, which appears to be more red, but it was really good!  

The portions were so big that I could barely finish anything.  I was sooooo full!  I guess good food does that.  I cannot wait to come back and try their Volcanic "beef"!
author: Nancy S.

description: Delicious food and good service, ordered the coconut soup, yumm! The ambience is a bit dark though.
author: Belen M.

description:
Loved this restaurant! Still thinking about it 2 weeks later after returning home to England. I yelped this place prior to going as I was looking some good veggie grub not far from where we were staying in Union Square. 

I was with my veggie BF and 2 of our non veggie friends and we all really enjoyed our meals. We had had an excellent sushi meal in Castro the night before and Thai Idea wasn't overshadowed by that what so ever.

I had heard great things about the wing bomb so we got that for starters, the sauce was so tasty, I would return just for this! The crispy tofu was good and the satay sauce wad just how I like it. I had the panang curry for mains and it was one of the best panang curries I have ever had. 

The place is great value and the service was speedy. I would certainly return here.
author: Frances B.

description:
Wow this place is amazing! The service is greate, the food is AMAZING, ( All Vegen) , and the prices are totally resonable!
Go check this place out!
author: Debbie G.

description:
Ok, this vegetarian does NOT go nuts over this place. I mean, Im serious scratching my head here as to why it's so good - just because it has fake meat?

Tried the crispy tofu, and it is anything but. Sure, the outside is hard, but as soon as you bite into it, the tofu is not only bland and flavorless, but gushes out gross tofu-flavored water (and likely, over your clothes too). Did they forget that you always dry out your tofu first!? I ended up throwing it out. And the peanut sauce barely tasted like peanuts, more like, dare I say, mayo? yuck!

As for the main dish, I got pad basil (with beef instead of chicken). The dish was ridiculously dry. Maybe I should have squirted some of the tofu water over it, I dunno. But the dish was very very dry. Good spice to it, I'll give it that, and I liked the taste of the fake meat, but that was about all it had going for it. I ate it, cause I was hungry, and thats about it. 

The steamed rice was the best tasting, and even that only lasted till the third bite, when I realized a chunk of the rice wasn't actually thoroughly cooked. 

I'll pass.
author: Rebeka T.

description:
My husband and I love Thai food and saw this had excellent reviews only to be very disappointed. The brown rice was extremely over cooked and mushy. The sweet and sour dish tasted like tomato soup. We have had much better fake meat at other places and if you're reading this you should check out The Loving Hut. 
Thai idea is not a 4.5 star restaurant.
author: Corinne K.

description: I got the panang curry with tofu and a side of brown rice and it was the best thing ever. So delicious.
author: Monique A.

description:
I've  enjoyed dining here at least a half dozen times and can truly say, it's a treat to eat there. While the area is sketchy,walk in and you're in another world. It is clean with a nicely finished walls and lighting. The real star of this place is the outstanding food. I'm hooked on the the Bangkok duck. It is my favorite dish of all the many choices listed. 
The service is attentive, they actually check in to make sure that everything is up to par. I'm very pleased to have found this gem, close to downtown and City Hall.
author: Art R.

description:
Mmmm, you know I don't really make a lot of trips to the Tenderloin anymore. Golden Era still hasn't reopened so I thought, "Eh. I can do without. Anything with a kinda sketchy experience I want I can get in Oakland." But now I have a really good reason for venturing out here.

This place fills the gluten-shaped hole Golden Era left in my heart. We got the firecracker balls, bangkok duck, and pumpkin curry. Everything was so well-seasoned, the firecracker balls made me actually enjoy wasabi in something, the curry was the right amount of spicy...and man, the duck. No mock meat I've ever had has had that insane texture complexity with a great crispy exterior. 

The service was also really great. The server I had let me loiter inside at a table for like half an hour while waiting for my boyfriend. I think she thought I was getting stood up. I don't even care.
author: Raven P.

description: I don't normally like Thai and being a vegetarian I'm always scared to try it because of contamination of meat. Well when I heard about this place I knew I had to try it. The food wasn't bad at all. In fact it was pretty good! I would say the area is a little sketchy and parking at night was a little bit of a pain. Other than that I would def come back for the food!
author: Foodie K.

description: First time here place loved it!!! Restaurant  is clean food was all fresh, delicious and beautifully presented. Server was polite and attentive.definitely highly recommended. Will be back!!
author: Maria R.

description: We had the Tom Kha soup with tofu and and veggie lamb curry - it was the best vegetarian lamb I've ever tried. Food exceeded expectations, service was attentive and quick, and thai tea was perfect. Will be sure to come here again when in SF!
author: Nariné R.

description: I love going into a restaurant and being able to order anything on the menu, especially dishes I usually don't eat. I ordered the tom yum soup with just vegetables and tofu. It was super flavorful, full of good light vegetables and ginger and other spices that made it filling -- I barely got through a third of the bowl. My boyfriend ordered the Bangkok duck, which was presented nicely and came with brown rice but was a bit too fried and too plain to approximate what real duck tastes like. Still, service was quick and friendly and the rest of the menu options looked good - the duck just may have been too ambitious of an order. Good Thai iced tea, too.
author: Sarah F. H.

description:
WOW!

This place is amazing.  The food is DEE-LISH! 

Not only does the vegetarian meat look REAL, it actually tastes real. There is a large variety of dishes for vegetarians..it is simply wonderful! The food is nicely displayed and fancy, with beautiful edible garnishes to top it off. The prices are affordable and the portions are enough for two meals!  It is definitely a great place for a date, for groups, or for a quick lunch. 

The owner/server/waitresses are extremely friendly and welcoming.  The food came out in less than 5 minutes.  The interior layout is authentic and comfortable; they even have a large flat screen tv!  But the best part is: the food is healthy and 100% vegetarian!!!!!!!!!!!!  :D :D :D

I will definitely be coming back here.  Let's give these guys some great business--it's about time we got a restaurant like this in the city!!!!!!
author: Cindy H.

description:
Beautifully themed restaurant with very polite staff.  This place resides a couple blocks from my work and my co-workers wanted to try some place new so we decided to try it out.  Needless to say, it was a great idea.  The food was delectable.  

I decided to try the Pad Thai.  I figured it was the way to go being that it was a Thai restaurant, you can't mess up this signature dish, and they did not disappoint.  The presentation of the dish was somewhat like something you'd see coming out of a Roy's Restaurant's kitchen, striking.  The dish itself was scrumptious, I can't wait to go back and try other selections on their menu.

If you check in or like them on Facebook, you get 15% off your entire check!  Definitely try out this hidden gem in the heart of the Tenderloin!
author: Jenny F.

description:
Food = delicious.  Hard to tell that it's vegetarian.  Unless, you're a ninny and didn't read about the VEGETARIAN 'meat'.  I had the shrimp and avocado curry--perfect blend of spices and delicious crunchy veggies.  Choice of brown rice or white rice.  (Winner!)  I had their brown rice.

Service = friendly.

Prices = moderate. 

Overall = I'll be back for a repeat meal.
author: Fannie S.

description: This is my go to Thai restaurant in the TL. I like supporting vegan/vegetarian establishments and my meat eating friends dig this spot too!
author: Josie C.

description:
Vegetarian/vegan food can be seriously gross at restaurants - too much oil, trying to hard to imitate meat, or not enough flavor.  Thai Idea stands out in this niche in that I truly LOVED every dish!

Starting with the appetizer (golden cauliflower), I was amazed at the richness and depth of flavor contained in such a simple dish.  The vegetable was cooked just right, and the sauce was delicious.  I had to take a picture to upload as well, because the presentation was very artful.  Food that looks as good as it tastes!

The two main dishes followed suite.  We ordered pumpkin curry with tofu and pad khee mao with "chicken."  Both were superbly flavored and my date and I finished off everything.  I have to add that the restaurant was completely full, and the ONE waitress was managing it flawlessly.  She was seating, refilling drinks, taking orders, answering the phone, and serving; I could never have done all of that so effortlessly.

All in all this is a must-visit restaurant, whether you eat a strictly vegetarian diet or not.
author: Alex F.

description:
Hands Down !!!!!!!!!! Best Vegan Thai Food in the city.
Always excellent service and consistent quality in the FOOD,
author: Mike K.

description:
Overall, a vegan/vegetarian restaurant with very good food, fantastic service, nice atmosphere and very good value (less than $100 for 4, with a couple of appetizers and beer). Highly recommended!

Found Thai Idea on Yelp. Nice, quiet atmosphere with maybe 20 tables.  Very nicely done. Could be romantic if you get a corner table.  Several families were there with kids but it was still pretty quiet.

The service is absolutely exceptional.  About half the tables were occupied when we arrived but a surge of patrons filled them all over the next 30 minutes.  We noticed that only 1 waitress was on duty (our receipt said Nan) but she was so friendly and nice and worked so hard that none of the tables lacked for anything.  

The food is some of the best I've had.  This appears to be a completely vegan menu with the exception of a couple of items that include egg but you can exclude it so that these are vegan as well.  The menu may be confusing because many items can include chicken, beef, lamb, shrimp, etc, in addition to tofu or vegetables.  These are all some fake form of the meats and not the actual meat.  All 4 vegan entrees we had were super tasty with tons of fresh vegetables.  The pumpkin curry with tofu is crazy good--diced pumpkin in a semi-spicy, creamy broth with mushrooms, onion, peppers, tofu, green beans and other veggies. Wow!  Everything else (Chicken Noodle Soup, Kee Mao, Chicken Vindaloo Curry) was equally good and did not appear to be oily or greasy.  

With the high quality atmosphere, service and food, Thai Idea is a bargain. A no-brainer for vegans or vegetarians and a fantastic choice if you just like good food.
author: T T.

description:
I always get Pad See Ew when I go thai.

This was the best pad see ew I have ever ate in my life! The food isn't very greasy and everything tastes fresh! Had a great time eating dinner here, it was quiet and kind of romantic setting.

A bit pricey, but def worth it.
author: Sophia G.

description: Excellent Thai food. Excellent veggie. Top notch service. Very nice atmosphere and good prices. Owner/chef is friendly.
author: Christy T.

description:
Yum! What a great place for vegetarians. It's such a luxury to be able to walk into a restaurant and order anything off of the menu. I highly recommend their pumpkin curry, fresh salad rolls, tom ka soup and their pad see ew. 

Note: If you're not a "fake meat" fan, they will substitute tofu for any of the imitation meats on the menu!
author: Kalie M.

description:
A Very Wise Decision

Don't let the scaffolding throw you, this Thai restaurant is wide open with delicious food, excellent service, and fantastic decor. 

Fire Balls -- a tasty hors d' evours to begin your veggie Thai excursion

Green Curry -- succulent and spicy, with eggplant that melts in your mouth!

Go there and get your gourmet veggie grub on!
author: Anthony L.

description: Extremely friendly and attentative service, delicious food, and beautiful interior. Highly recommend this restaurant. Be wary, the dishes can be VERY spicy depending on the degree of spice you order!
author: Darian T.

description:
Wakako U dragged me here literally kicking and screaming. I'd be lying if I didn't admit that I was blown away. Some of the faux-meat dishes tasted as good, if not better, than their real meat counterparts. 

The Wing Bomb, seemingly everyone's favorite on here, was indeed 'the bomb,' but both Wakako and I concur it wasn't the best thing we tried. Here's what else we ate: 

-crab cakes: delicate and flavorful; you couldn't even tell there was no real crab meat in them. 

-golden cauliflower: Wako's fave. Best cauliflower I've ever had, and I don't like cauliflower. That's because it was fried :)

-pad basil: Just like the Chinese chicken dish at Modern Thai, but with fresher, more colorful ingredients. I still prefer the one with the real chicken at Modern Thai, though. 

Will definitely be working this place into our Thai regimen... what a find!
author: Brett W.

description: It's always nice to go to a place where you know it doesn't serve animal dishes, you can relax a bit and not worry. Our family went for a celebration, we're all vegan so this was a great place to come and I had heard good things about the food. We all enjoyed this a lot, everything was good, from the wing appetizers to the "fish" dish and the curry dishes too, it was all good. This is a great place to take your Omni friend and/or family members, a good place where everyone will really enjoy the meal. I'd say go for family style and sample some new dishes, the world is your vegan oyster! : )
author: Garden R.

description:
WOW!

OK here's the deal., not sure if the owners are seeing this review. But, if they want to open a new location (perhaps bigger in a better area) and if anything do multiple franchise style., I'll be a HAPPY investor. 

PROS:

1) GREAT FOOD., love it absolutely 
2) GREAT atmosphere., must see
3) GREAT Staff., helpful and nice
$) GREAT Pricing., not over the top expensive


CONS:

1) BAD location., I feel like Im gonna get robbed every time I go to this place., 
2) SMALL., wish it was bigger., then again its SF and expensive rent probably. (INVESTOR opportunity here - Owners read ;)
3) Don't accept American Express cards., I love using that card for points and keep track of my expenses., well., they don't give a crap (just joking)! but yeah they won't accept it!

More PROS than CONS., = WIN

Love this place., keep it up... contact me., lets put this in Palo Alto, CA
author: Sina J.

description: One of the best green Thai curry that I have had. Friendly people and excellent food.
author: Nitin P.

description:
Hidden Gem :)
No really, its in a really sketchy area. but once you step inside...
Its really clean, decor is modern pretty, has an intimate feeling.
Severs are attentive and friendly. Food always comes out hot and delicious.
Nice for a date if you don't mind the area.
author: Lupita R.

description:
Besides a restaurant, this place should also be labeled as a WORK OF ART. 
The interior is so cozy and warm and really nice on the eyes! The bathroom was super cool (wood paneling and a braille-type texture)!

Whoops sorry, I digress. The food!! Delicious! I shared a pineapple fried rice. I have to admit, the "shrimp" was kinda weird (I think the texture of all this fake meat always throws me off), but other than that, the rest of the dish was excellent! It looked beautiful too...the way they pile up the shreds of beet(??), then stick raw pasta noodles and some herb on top...so cute! I watched some other dishes come out too and they all looked like works of art!
The portion was a good size. This place is a tad more expensive than other Thai restaurants, but I think it's worth it! 

Really friendly service too. The waitress kept coming back to fill my water, which is always appreciated.

We definitely come back! It's nice they do takeout, but I think I would want to sit down again so I can soak in the atmosphere!
author: Kei H.

description:
I love this place!!

Despite the scaffolding, everything inside is awesome. The decor is very trendy and welcoming. The food is also very pretty and arranged nicely. 

I eat here often and my favorite things to order are:

-Thai Ice Tea (of course, haha)

-Pumpkin curry (my favorite)

-Tom Kha

The imitation meat is really good and flavorful and I like to bring my meat-loving friends here. Some of them don't even notice it is imitation. The food is served family style, so it's great to share with friends and try lots of different things without spending too much money. I can't wait until they open up again.
author: Trinity H.

description:
Nice place. Good atmosphere. 
Loved thai iced tea and pad kee mow

Red curry was okay. Too liquidy. hence 4 stars. :)
author: Anand B.

description: This place was awesome! Interesting and delicious dishes. Healthy and fresh. Easy to share. Presented beautifully.
author: Hayley K.

description:
I haven't written a Yelp review for Thai Idea yet? What am I DOING with my life?

This is basically the best place ever. The food is delicious, affordable, and with beautiful presentation. The staff members are so lovely, friendly, and helpful.

Tonight I actually went in to place a to-go order and they gave me a complimentary thai iced tea -- my fave!

I love you Thai Idea! Thank you for being amazing. :D
author: Stacey J.

description:
I haven't eaten here yet (as far as I can remember), but I will. Have to post, however, because my wallet apparently slid out of my pocket tonight on MUNI (damn you stupid slippery Patagonia fabric!!), someone found it (after it had been depleted of the small amount of cash in it, but oh well), brought it home to their girlfriend, and she IMMEDIATELY went to the trouble of digging up my # and calling me. Then she let me walk to her apartment building rather late at night and retrieve it. Her name is pronounced Oooeee (don't know the spelling) and she works at Thai Idea. So I am hugely thankful and recommend everybody eat at Thai idea (hey, it's Thai, which is an inherent plus) because at least one very Good Samaritan works there.

P.S. I did go there. My wallet-returning angel wasn't working that day, as it turns out (she alternates between that and another area restaurant, they told me), but it was interesting, unusual, mid-priced progressive Thai cuisine with good service and a nice atmosphere.
author: Doubledang D.

description: This place is one of my favorite restaurants, very yummy, I recommend to anyone who doesn't eat meat or eats meat to come to this place, you will love it. My son is vegan and he loves to come here every time we are in San Francisco. Everything on the menu is very good and the women working there are very nice. A little on the expensive side but very worth it! One of my favorites is their fried banana ice cream with their homemade coconut ice cream. It is always a must have every time we come. Highly recommend!!!
author: Angela N.

description: Excellent flavorful healthy vegetarian fare :) this fills a much needed niche because it is often hard at most Thai places to know if non-veg ingredients are in the sauce. Here one can rest assured that they are not, and also there is use of many fun veggie proteins, not just tofu. I liked the crispy cauliflower appetizer and the pra ram.
author: Geri W.

description:
I'm in love with this place! Amazing food, speedy service and great ambiance!
I highly recommend the firecracker balls, veggie crab cakes and wing bomb.
author: PM P.

description: Good food, nice place to find as a vegan. Not all meals are vegan, but most. I wish they offered delivery. Its a little pricey, not outrageous.
author: Fresh B.

description:
A bunch of us dined here on a Saturday night. It's a small place - about 8-9 tables with a very inviting atmosphere. We all shared our meals so could order a good variety of food - chicken satay,fried tofu,papaya salad,tom yum soup,massuman curry,pad thai and fried rice. 

The appetizers were strictly ok but I absolutely loved all the other food. All the dishes were chock full of veggies that were fresh. The plates were also beautifully arranged so my eye was well pleased. The pad thai could have done with a little bit more noodles and less veggies but it looked so artful that it didn't really matter. The food was a little bit on the sweeter side so make sure you ask for hot sauce on the side. And definitely try the tom yum soup-very tangy and yummy. 

Prices were pretty reasonable - $150 for a meal for 6 including a bottle of wine.
author: Bindi S.

description:
This place is truly one of my favorite veggie restaurants in San Francisco. Cozy friendly ambiance, fantastic flavorful food, 
great service.
author: Neda K.

description:
Glad we chose to walk into Tenderloin to find this place. Worth it!  As an almost vegan, it was a relief and joy to look at a menu and be able to have more than one vegan option on the menu!  What a treat!!!

Staff was so friendly and helpful with questions about the menu. Ended up having the Thai Samosa and Crispy Tofu as an appetizer.  Both were good, but Thai Samosa was best of the two.  I had the Pumpkin Curry - delicious!  Had it with the brown rice which was perfectly cooked and very flavorful. My husband had the Pad Ped with brown rice.  He liked this dish but helped himself to my dish a few times, too.  Pumpkin Curry was the winner for both of us!

We will return!
author: Lisa M.

description: Amazing restaurant with amazing delicious vegan/vegetarian food. Very good service. I'm definitely coming back there.
author: Nimrod R.

description:
Heaven has landed and opened its doors in the Tenderloin (who would've thunk?)  The (vege) Bangkok duck is to die for, it's a must-get. So are the wing bombs. Everything else is very good, we've had just about all on their menu and nothing has been disappointing.

But so often, an outstanding menu is letdown by poor service in such places. Not true here -- friendly, sweet, kind servers who honestly care about what they are serving and whom.  I feel blessed every time I leave here. 

Do yourself a favor and skip the hoidy-toidy over-priced joints closer to Union Square and their stuckup maître'ds and head a little further into the Tenderloin where such gems are hidden. Your tummy, wallet and psyche will thank you.
author: C R.

description:
Wow that's what I'm talking about!  Friendly faces, fast service, flavorful food!  

Wing bombs (vegetarian chicken topped with beet swirls and crispy basil leaves with a sweet and sour sauce) were good.  I think I expected more given the reviews, but the crispy basil was a nice touch and texture.  Green curry with "chicken" was so flavorful!  Comes with rice too.   Also had the pad see ew (wide pan-fried egg noodles) with "beef".  Not a huge fan of the beef, maybe we'll try tofu next time.  Thai iced tea was good.  Everything came out plated so nicely.  Even my thai iced tea had an orchid in it.  And it was so affordable.  

I'd say the only con is that it's not in a great neighborhood.  But not enough to dock any stars or stop me from coming here.  Came for lunch on a Monday and there was plenty of metered street parking nearby.   

I could be a vegetarian for sure if all vegetarian food tasted this good!  Can't wait to come back!
author: Chantal T.

description: Clearly states that it closes at 10:30pm and the have the closed sign out, locked door while still serving customers. Staff ignored us while we knocked on the door.
author: Michael J.

description:
ABSOLUTELY TERRIFIC. Wish I could give more stars. 

Ordered the pumpkin curry with tofu, side of roti, an extra steamed veggies for the leftover sauce, and I was amazed. Not only is the atmosphere here great, but the food is hands down the best in SF. The pumpkin curry was so rich in Thai coconut flavorings. The kabocha squash was perfectly cooked. The tofu was crunchy and a little sour. Amazing. The roti with he pumpkin curry sauce was heavenly. 

The fact that it's vegetarian is no obstacle. Anyone will enjoy a meal here.
author: Alex W.

description:
Whenever I go to San Francisco, I delight in the number of vegan places. I was excited to try a bunch of places that I'd never been to before, and Thai Idea was at the top of that list due to the high ratings on Yelp. The other Yelp reviewers did not let me down.

It is BYOB with no corkage fee, and my group of three people wound up bringing two bottles of wine, so we had a great time. We were slow to order, but the waitress was very patient with us, and very nice. The service was great, and the food was delicious AND beautiful on the plate. We tried the ever popular wing bombs, which were pretty run of the mill vegan wings. If you've had one, you've had them all, but the presentation was great, and I do love vegan wings. We also had the Golden Cauliflower, which we absolutely loved. We shared the Pad Ped & got the mango & sticky rice for dessert.

We got there on the early side, so we were one of only a few tables of people, but by the time we left, the place was packed. And it was a Wednesday night.

The whole meal was great. It earned a place in my top three favorite vegan joints in San Francisco. I'm looking forward to a return visit.
author: Valerie N.

description: I'm a person who checks out the bad reviews as well as the good ones.   The reviews from others, well, seriously it didn't sound like they were even describing the same place I go to on a weekly basis.  Perhaps they are confusing Thai Idea with some other place they went??  I have never had a bad meal here.   I'm suspecting they are confusing Thai Idea with one of the other Thai places around the corner as the complaints (dirty tables, dirty bathroom(s) ) are things I have never seen there.  Yeah, I bet they are confusing it with one of the Thai places a few blocks away.
author: Mike F.

description:
Last night my friend and I was looking for dinner
We walked  all the way on Polk ST., suddently I saw veggie restaurant
Wow veggie thai food!!!! We had thai fruits salad, ck Tom yum, bangkok duck and garlic prawn it's was so yummy I love thai fruit salad but my friend she lovevvvvvvv Bangkok duck. We can't believed the veggie duck  awesome. The price was reasonable, the service was friendly and we will be back.
author: Grace B.

description:
We went here as a group of 5 and was impressed with the decor, service, and food presentation.

I only saw one waitress working AND it was around lunch time--not as easy thing to do.

There was only one dish (forgot the name) that was too intense (flavor was too strong, salty, and sour) for us. But this place is so good that I will go back whenever I have the chance. Love the green curry and the pineapple fried rice. We all took pictures of the food because none of us speak thai and it would make it easier to order next time--just show the picture, haha.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
Hidden in the inside of an -under  construction- building, Thai Idea Vegetarian is a little treasure gem, for those who "dare" to walk through San Francisco's "worst neighborhood"... 

In reality, the Tenderloin is not as bad as you may read it is, and you won't get to see much of "it" if you're aiming to visit this all vegetarian Asian cuisine restaurant. Truth is, the first time I came, I was not expecting its elegance and calmness. The place is not super spacious, but the proximity within each table makes it look like everybody is there eating together. Menu has a lot of variety; it took me quite sometime to decide what to eat. 

Me and my boyfriend decided to get one plate each, which at the time seemed right. I would have rather shared though, so don't order with your eyes. The food is fresh, very flavorful and balanced. I also loved that meat substitutes didn't try to taste like meat.   
Oh, and servers were extremely nice and helpful.

The second time though, we ordered to go. Although the vindaloo curry sauce was delicious, it was practically the only thing that came in the plastic container, since the veggie meat were like 5 pieces. For $10.95, I was expecting more quantity. On a brighter side, we used the dipping sauce for something else afterwards because there was plenty of it.

Overall, elegant place, great flavorful food. Keep an eye if you are ordering to go. And do not miss this place because of the area. Go around 6-8pm and you will feel safe and be fine.
author: Joanlly R.

description:
We were so happy to find this place and be able to add it to our list of favorite vegetarian restaurants. It's not in a fancy neighborhood (call it Upper Tenderloin) but, inside, the decor and presentation of the food are tops.

We started off with Thai iced coffee (too sweet for my taste but still good). They don't serve alcohol but as other reviewers have noted you can bring your own, and there's apparently a liquor store next door.

I couldn't resist stretching the definition of vegetarian when I saw an appetizer called Firecracker Balls on the menu: "veggie ahi tuna roll, panko deep-fried, mayomustard and spicy sauce." They were great!

The veggie tom kha (coconut soup with tofu "chicken," lemongrass, and galanga) was to die for.

The pad see-ew (pan-fried, wide, Thai rice noodles with cabbage, broccoli, carrot and egg) was excellent. And still good as a left-over the next day.

My partner ordered pumpkin curry (Kabocha pumpkin in red curry sauce, available with veggie beef or chicken or tofu) but he ordered it the way he likes it -- very, very hot -- which made it inedible for me. It looked and smelled good!
author: David S.

description:
I'm giving this place four stars for consistency and quality alone. They do an amazing job. The restaurant is a wonderful, pleasant haven and they are always accommodating. 

Since becoming a vegetarian about a year ago, I just love to find places where i can order anything on the menu without thinking about what's in it. Thai idea is one of the few places - even in San Francisco - where you are almost guaranteed to enjoy and derive decent nutrition from whatever you order, even though it may be a bit decadent at times. 

Their curries are sublime. I love duck pineapple curry, and their brown rice is really delicious and satisfying. My number one recommendation here would be a curry.

Their green papaya salad is one of the best I've had - and I've had it the world over, in Saigon, San Francisco, San Jose, you name it :) It is VERY spicy. I'm always impressed with places that don't cater to the lowest common denominator. 

People have made mention of the neighborhood. I don't really know what to say. If it wasn't for marginal neighborhoods there wouldn't be cheap restaurants. And marginal neighborhoods seem to allow for some diversity in a city that is gradually closing in on itself economically and socially.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
This place is amazing!! I have been waiting for a veggie Thai restaurant in SF for so long. I first found out about this because I often dine at Sweet Basil in Foster city, owned by the same people and both are amazing. 

They also have a location on 29th and Mission which was all vegetarian, but switched to offering both.

Highly recommend!
author: Megan L.

description: Good Thai spot on Polk. Locals. Didn't see any tourists here. Excellent service. Clean. Good wine selection. Asian beers. Our server was very friendly and pleasant and prompt. Polk street can get sketchy later at night especially on weekends. Go early.
author: Ed H.

description: Has to be the number one most underrated restaurant in San Francisco. I am never here enough. Great atmosphere, great food, and a full menu of veggie/vegan food.
author: Jonah P.

description:
As a vegetarian, I love this place. The portion is quite big, the price is reasonable and the food is fresh. Their papaya salad is really fresh minus the usual heavy fish sauce from other thai restaurants. Their other entrees are clean and delicious too. I brought my meat eater friends and they love the food too. 

The restaurant is clean and decor is comfortable. Love to go back again.
author: Thomas C.

description: Ordered the wing bomb and me and my best friend Arielle shared the lamb curry and pad Thai. Also ordered the tom yum soup with Thai iced tea. I'm a major meat lover and and my friend introduced me to place. I must say I like these selections just as much as I love actual meat. The wing bomb was AMAZING! That delicious tangy sauce paired with the soy chicken which I'm honestly questioning how it isn't chicken was so tasty I think I preferred it over most chicken wings made with real chicken. The Thai ice tea paired well with it and was just sweet enough. The tom yum was packed full of veggies and tasted average but appreciated the vast amount of veggies but I wished there was more broth. The best part was the lamb curry. Once again I question how this could not be meat because of its pure deliciousness and meaty flavor! The curry was just right and tasted better than most curries I've had. Sometimes the consistency can be very thin but not this one, it was just thick enough to coat the brown rice. However, I took off a star for the pad Thai.... That stuff was just bad. I normally love pad Thai and I had an insane craving for it but this disappointed. It was very bland and super sour. The only saving grace was that the noodles were cooked properly. Overall I would reccomend this place but avoid the pad Thai.
author: Mabel F.

description:
Eh this place is ehh. 

I've been a vegetarian for 22 years (so that qualifies me as an expert ;)) I have had my fair share of vegetarian dining experiences. I liked Thai Idea in concept but I did notice their menu doesn't offer a lot of variety in comparison to the numerous other vegetarian dining establishments (nearby too - Golden Era.) Also, it seems the same thing (beef, duck or those rubbery shrimps) are in EVERY dish.  I would like to see more creativity, a wider selection of options and better cooking (like battering or  frying stuff like chicken - everyone loves chicken.)  I did like the plate setting.

It should be noted (because the waitress - who was EXTREMELY [annoyingly???!] attentive did not mentioned it) tables of 4 or more get the tip added on automatically.
author: Maple S.

description:
Awesome service and the Panang Curry is bomb with some rice!
Always love the Pad Thai and Pad See Ew (sp?)
All in all it's cool when this place opened up the owner came around and introduced himself,explaining how he himself designed the wall behind us along with how excited he was to see us. Always cool to keep coming back, only let down was one time I walked all the way there to find that they closed shop thirty minutes before their time posted and had to go to their competition around the corner.
author: Chauntae M.

description: Incredible food.  I highly recommend.  Not in the best of areas, but very nice ambiance and service.  Food had tons of flavor.  I would most definitely return.  Perhaps some of the best Thai food I've had!
author: Veeral S.

description: Huge portions. I ordered tom kha soup and pad Thai. The soup would have been more than enough, but it was my first time here and I wanted to taste the pad Thai too. My leftovers will last me for days. I have never seen a soup with so many veggies in it, you could eat it with a fork, could be served over rice like a curry. Not too spicy or too sweet, just how I like my tom kha. Wasn't super impressed with the veggie chicken, could have done with out any fake meat in the soup. The pad Thai I also ordered with veggie chicken, but it also comes with tofu, so I wouldn't have missed any meat. The eggs are always my favorite part of pad Thai anyway... Well and the peanuts, and the sauce, and the noodles. Love that I can order anything on the menu with out having to worry about fish sauce. When I come back I'll bring more friends to help me eat everything, and I'll be able to try more things.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Excellent Thai food, reasonable prices, great/quick service, unique decor, easy to park (for SF...)

I had the pumpkin curry (Chef's choice). The red curry was one of the best I've had anywhere. Tons of appetizers I will try next time like the Firecracker balls.
author: michael jackson Q.

description:
Total gem in the Tenderloin. 

Fast and friendly service and the prices are really affordable for the quality of the food. I work nearby and get take out so I can't speak for the service but they are more than friendly when I do order take out so I can't imagine their service to be anything less than amazing. 

I would give them 5 stars but the location is kind of hard to find with all the scaffolding around the restaurant but that should be taken care of soon. (hopefully)
author: Elbert U.

description: Very friendly staff and some really good food! We stopped in to grab some food to go but we didn't call it in first. We got their and ordered and I was a little indecisive but the waitress was very friendly and patient. I finally decided on the pad see ew and let the waitress know, i sat and waited for no more than 10 mins after she took my order and my food was out and ready. It was hot, fresh, and it tasted amazing! I will be coming back here again when I am visiting San Francisco!
author: Bri R.

description: Great vegetarian place.  Great food and service.  I have a nut allergy and they were great making sure everything was nut free. Try the Bangkock duck and samosas.
author: Devlin D.

description:
I was skeptical of this place at first because of the location but I was really impressed with the food and the service. The food was delicious and gave generous servings enough for leftovers. 
We got a Thai iced tea,  wing bomb, Bangkok duck and Thai basil and it was under 40$! I would definitely come back
author: Stephanie W.

description: Has a good setup. Best looking walls with fun designs. The vegan meat was very good, surprised at how good the pumpkin curry was with faux-chicken and the yellow curry with faux lamb.
author: Matthew F.

description: This place rocks. My lady is vegan, and this is definitely one of our favorite spots. I'm an omnivore, but I have to say that the yellow curry lamb is one of my favorite dishes in San Francisco right now.
author: Trent M.

description:
Great value. Delicious non greasy food. Loved it!
The vegetarian shrimp was fun and tasty.
author: Jessica F.

description:
The food here is so good we have been back 3 times in 5 days.
We have perfected the perfect date menu and it is as follows:
1) appetizer of firecracker balls
2) Volcano Beef + white rice
3) Thai Tea
Total +tip will come out to be right at about $33

TIPS:
Wing Bombs or firecracker balls?
if you want a huge amount of food for your appetizer with good flavor go for the wing bombs.  They are delicious but honestly there is so much "meat" there that the taste gets repetitive.
If you have a little extra $ to spend and would prefer a more complex flavor go for the firecracker balls.  It is basically like an 8 piece of sushi, not enough to fill anyone up but they are packed full of great flavor.

Side note:
Personally I would pass on the lamb yellow curry. The curry was absolutely fantastic but I wasn't the world's biggest fan of the fake lamb meat.
author: Austin H.

description:
It's really tough to recreate most Thai dishes without fish sauce or shrimp paste, so it's probably not fair to compare this restaurant to your standard Thai joint...but I'm going to do that anyway. 

Ordered takeout today and strolled down to the Tenderloin to pick it up - location-wise Thai Idea is not in the super-duper heart of the 'loin, so if you're worried about the location, don't be.  I had my trusty German Corgi with me and they were nice enough to bring my order to the door so I wouldn't have to come in - star for being nice!

I tried the much raved about Wing Bombs and Pumpkin Curry - both were pretty average.  The Wing Bombs ended up being standard fare "chicken" drumsticks served with sweet chili sauce.  I remember thinking drumsticks like this were they second coming of...well, chicken...when I first tried them at Golden Era, but since then I've realized you can get them frozen at May Wah.  Not sure if these were frozen or what, but not so impressed - I was hoping these were marinated/doused in sauce, a la hot wings.  The Pumpkin Curry was also OK - the veggies were all fresh and crisp, but curry itself was not so great.  Most of the flavor of the curry didn't seem to come through, there was absolutely no hint of spiciness, and it largely tasted like semi-sweet coconut milk.  A star for fairly standard Thai food.  

Finally prices were pretty standard so nothing to complain about there - the portion on the Wing Bombs is modest (4 wings for $8) but the portion on the Pumpkin Curry was large (probably 2.5 meals for me), so that's a push.  

Again, maybe not the most thing to compare this restaurant to non-vegetarian Thai, but with so many great Thai options in the 'loin I think it's only appropriate to hold this restaurant to an equally high standard.  All in all, that's a star for good service and a second for pretty standard-fare food.
author: Rosers M.

description:
OMG this vegetarian Thai cuisine is stellar. 

Carnivores can go there and not miss meat for an instant. 

THE MOST CREATIVE FRIED RICE I have ever enjoyed. See the photo.  It comes Surrounded with fresh veggies. 

The fake Lamb and beef are spectacular. 

The fake chicken is not as chicken-y as you can get from trader joes, but regardless it was good, especially in the 'wing bombs' that come with a delicious skin. 

Plan several trips, and set your way through the entire menu!
author: David S.

description: One of our group is a vegetarian and she loved this place. We had to go back a couple of times so that she could get her fix. I can see why this place is so highly rated. Great food and excellent service. If you are a vegetarian or vegan you will really appreciate this place.
author: John S.

description: Was looking for veggie thai and this place hit the spot. The service and the food were both great!  Will definitely be back!
author: Matt D.

description:
Oh my goodness! This place is uh-mazinng! My family and I dined here for my birthday dinner and we ordered:
 
Wing bombs, Fire cracker, and Thai Samosa (appetizer)

Tom Yum soup, Panang "shrimp" avocado, Vindaloo curry and Volcanic "beef" (entrees) 

I would recommend all, except Fire cracker and Thai samosa - they were just mediocre in opinion. 

Service was fantastic considering that we had three young children (boisterous and all under the ages of 5) come along for a family dinner. The waiters still were kind and accommodating.

I am the only vegetarian and my carnivorous family  were extremely pleased with the meals. In fact, they were convinced that the "meat" in the meals were real and could not believe they were only substitutes. 

Although it is located in the Tenderloin, the atmosphere of the restaurant itself is tiny but cute. Parking can be a pain depending on the time you come. We came around 7 so it wasn't a problem.
author: Clementine D.

description: This is a great spot for vegetarians! The veggie meat is delicious, particularly the Peking duck. I also enjoyed the wing bombs, crab cakes, and cashew nuts with tofu and vegetables. One thing to look out for is that an 18% gratuity is included for large parties so be careful not to pay twice as it doesn't show up on the final bill.
author: Madhu A.

description: I ordered the vegan Chicken Panang with brown rice! Superb. Delicate seasoning, generous portion, beautifully presented. My new favorite place when visiting San Francisco. Don't miss out on this wonderful vegan Thai!
author: V S.

description: Though the place was quite busy, we were seated fast, and the service was super friendly. The best part about the meal was the dessert, we ordered the Thai pancake with coconut ice cream which was really yummy. For the mains we had a dish with cashews, which was delicious and had many cashews. The crispy chicken was great, and when wine is $5 a glass, we're sure to come again!
author: Rachel W.

description:
I loved this restaurant! The spring rolls and the curry I had were delicious! 
The atmosphere was really nice. Just beware they serve you a lot of food so be ready to take some home, or share with someone!
author: Erin H.

description:
Can't say enough good things about this wonderful neighborhood Thai restaurant!

We started with "Golden Cauliflower" -- Crispy cauliflower served with homemade tamarind sauce topped with crispy shallots and cilantro.  This was followed by "Som Tum"  -- Shredded green papaya seasoned with limejuice, chili, tomatoes, string bean and peanuts.  The papaya was almost like spaghetti and the lime juice dressing was tangy and fresh.

But the dish I absolutely fell in love with was " Pumpkin Curry" -- Kabocha pumpkin in red curry sauce with fried tofu -- incredibly tender and delicious.  We had it served with a side of brown rice and a side of noodles that were delicious as well.

I'm not often singing the praises of strictly vegetarian restaurants, but we really loved this place -- the menu is fresh, healthy  and worth a 2nd and 3rd visit!  Will be back for sure...
author: Andrew G.

description: I had the Thai Rolls. They were so delicious. Peanut sauce was very tasty, filled me up for an appetizer. Love the staff there they always are so attentive. It is like family. Portions are great and the price is right.
author: Mr B.

description:
Mock chicken satay had a gross flavor and texture, but sauces made up for it. 
Pad Thai was bland but they put a lot of scrambled egg which was tasty.
Mango sticky rice was dry, needed way more coconut milk sauce!
author: Adriana E.

description: I've been many Thai restaurants, but this location had speechless tasty, yummy real thai foods. I would give extra star sixth star to their friendly and polite servers.
author: Sunny M.

description: I had a pineapple fried rice and it lacked authentic Thai flavors, to be honest they are creative with substitute seafood :)
author: Pavithra S.

description:
I have truly enjoyed the food every time I have eaten here (especially pumpkin curry with brown rice...yum!); however, the lousy service brings the whole dining experience down.

As my office is just around the corner from their Polk location, many people frequent this location for lunch.  The other day, while eating with a friend, I was treated rudely by one of the servers (one that I had never had before).  The general snubbing that can happen at a busy restaurant is one thing, but this was more hostile and rude.

When repeating my story to others in my office, several people began to recount their own experiences with the SAME SERVER!  Of all the stories, at least two ended with this guy yelling at my colleagues in front of the entire restaurant and suggesting to them that they never come back!!!

It's too bad since it was a favorite lunch option in our office, now most people will not go near the place if that guy is working.
author: julia h.

description:
Two words. Uh-Mazing. 

As a vegan (jeers, welcome), you grow accustomed to nit-picking menus. Not here! Just make sure you order minus eggs.

All of the dishes I've had have been great- A+ definitely. What really sets Thai Idea apart are the appetizers. If I could, I would order all of them at the same and die a happy death. Oh wait. I did. 

x-------x
      x
 \____/

That's me after the appetizer meal from Thai Idea. My favorites: Wing Bomb, Satay, Crab Cakes. Ah, just use a dart board to choose. Go there! Now!! 

Tip: Save the Pad Thai for dining in- it's not as saucy to-go.
author: Felix C.

description: Everything I've had here is very tasty, and there are a ton of options for vegans and those who are gluten-free as well. Cute atmosphere in a less-than-cute part of town. Strongly recommended.
author: Tahd F.

description: Surprised at the high reviews posted here. Sure it's vegan, but that doesn't magically change the food from 'meh' to good. Visited the place a few days ago, had Tom Yum, Pumpkin Curry and something else I can't remember, and was it a disappointment. I thought the food was bland to the max with none of those distinctly fragrant and fresh flavors that delicious Thai food is known for. Service was good I guess and the Thai Ice tea wasn't bad, but all in all a true 'meh' experience for me.
author: Olli L.

description:
Hands down the best vegetarian Thai food in town! Amazingly creative menu and super friendly service. 

It's my first time here and I will surely come back. I had wing bombs, pumpkin curry with tofu and Pad Thai. All dishes are delicious and come in a generous portion at very reasonable prices. Pumpkin curry is a bit sweet to my taste. If you don't like it sweet, you ask them to customize it by adding some curry paste. 

With its decor, Thai Idea can make you imagine you're dining in Marina or some nice neighborhoods although it's located in the tenderloin.
author: Saran R.

description:
I was half way through the larb before I realized that there was no meat in it. Delicious blend of spices in their dishes and yummy, soft and most coconut rice! 

I would definitely come back.
author: Jamie T.

description:
It wasn't until I arrived at the restaurant that I read the review by Bethany S. and how her phone was stolen while she was sitting inside. Now I know why! It felt like a bad idea walking down the small streets from our hotel in the financial district to get here. I could not walk fast enough. The area felt ghetto,  especially since we walked across the high end designer shops first. 
Once you're inside, all is forgotten once you see how nice the restaurant is. You open the menu and everything is fairly inexpensive. 

Wing Bombs-All in the name, BOMB. The texture is a bit rough, you have to tear at it with your teeth. I didn't mind though. :)

Firecracker Balls-I expected this to have more varying flavor. I got mainly the deep fried rice flavor. Perhaps, the sweet and sour sauce of the wing bomb overpowered the flavor of this one. I still enjoyed eating this, but if you were to choose one appetizer, I'd go with the wing bomb. 

Bangkok Duck-This isn't imitation meat! Yes! I believe they make it themselves. It consists of layers of bean curd. Fried, of course! Opted for the brown rice which was well cooked. 

Man, what I would do for good food. I'm still alive! ...and all these other people who yelped about this place are! :)
author: Tina B.

description: Excellent, delicious food. The texture of the "meat" was well done. The sauce was tasty. Portions are filling. And the price is great! Service was quick, and very friendly. Got complimentary carrot soup - again damn good. I have nothing negative to say. Really. Loved the food and the place
author: Anandh V.

description:
Ok, as a former vegetarian... this place has bomb-ass sauces. The food is without meat but makes up in flavor. This location is smaller but call ahead if you are looking to book a group event. I was amazed on how busy this place can get especially on weekends! 

They do not serve alcoholic beverages but their ice coffee and tea are pretty awesome here.

A few dishes to try:
- papaya salad
- thai fried rice
- most curries
author: Eva Y.

description: Delicious and vegan friendly, two things that take talent to merge. We loved everything we tried, and the waitress was friendly and attentive.
author: Paula H.

description:
I've been here a few times. First shortly after they opened - thought it was pretty good, but $$$ (especially for Thai food in the hood). Same with the 2nd time which i got something to go.

This time - I ordered Pad See Ew to go. I asked for tofu. When she said & vegetables, i said no extra vegetables - just brocolli. She asked if broccoli, carrots & cabbage was okay since they had them alreday mixed. I said those were fine & explicitly said I didn't like how some places put other vegetables in it when I request tofu (no meat). (I think normally - pad see ew is just noodles, meat, chinese broccoli - maybe egg.)

Anywooo... i QUICKLY (nice) get my food & take it to work. It's FULL of weird veggies - canned mushrooms & mini corn, ASPARGUS (ate one - ruined the flavor), and green beans. Half of my $8.50 meal was full of stuff I didn't eat/want. Super disappointed.
author: lynn t.

description:
We loved Thai Idea!  The food was delicious and attractively served.

We enjoyed the golden cauliflower appetizer and Tom Yum soup.  Our delicious entree was the green curry.

Everything is vegetarian and many dishes can be made to be vegan.  They have many dishes with "veggie meats" like "veggie chicken" etc.

Service was really friendly as well.

Great place and we hope to return soon!

(We walked from SOMA neighborhood, which took us through the Tenderloin district.  Not a good idea  if you can avoid it!)
author: Dan M.

description:
Cramped seating! I think I almost took the waitress out with my arms a couple of times! I really enjoyed the fake appetizer wings!
Yellow Curry with tofu and veggie - the potatoes were undercooked and the tofu was fried. 
Pad Thai with fake Shrimp - I dunno what I think about the shrimp... 

I would come back for the wings - definitely over priced.
Get reservations so that you might get placed on the side tables instead of down the middle where the waitresses are passing by constantly. 
If you like the fake meats thing (i do) ... just try it out... they had duck too...
author: Andru P.

description: Went here for lunch was dead nobody in the place good service fast they really go out of there way to decorate the plates. Stick to the menu try  not to alter there dishes in my opinion
author: Scott J.

description: The food was tasty overall, but overpriced for what it was. I had Chef's choice catfish dish, and my wife had the pumpkin curry.
author: Jeremy K.

description: I would give 3 just because they are a vegetarian restaurant, and because they manage to rise above the usual Civil Center fare. But . . . I thought the fake chicken wing appetizer was inedible today. And my entree, a yellow curry fake chicken was soupy, spongy, and included undercooked potatoes.  I left thinking it was a waste of money, and that I could have better enjoyed a $5 sandwich instead of a $20 lunch.
author: Morris R.

description:
6 stars!  7 stars!  No wait, how many stars can I do!!!?!?!

We had a party of 10 for my good friend's birthday.  The decor of the place is excellent; cute interior, excellent dishware, etc.  AND (wait for it...) YOU CAN BRING IN YOUR OWN BEER/WINE!  We seriously went through 2 bottles of champagne and two six packs.  There is a liquor store right next door (woohoo!).  And there is NO CORKING FEE.  They will open your bottle of wine for you, no charge.  Where does this even happen?!

Now let's talk food!  Food was simply awesome, all dishes were delicious.  Pretty standard thai fair (lots of curry, basil and bell peppers, yum!).  Nicely spiced but not too spicy by any means.  You can get extra hot sauce to spice it up if you so desire.  

Prices!  For the quality of the food, atmosphere, and service, the prices are downright ridiculous.  Most entrees are about 10 bucks.  

I can't wait to come back here.  Maybe another dinner party just for the hell of it.

Also, almost the entire menu is vegan, and nearly every dish can be prepared vegan upon request.  He shoots he scores!
author: Brian G.

description: The food was excellent. We got wing bomb, papaya salad and pineapple rice. They were all very tasty. The stuff were nice. By the time we got the desert  menu we were very full so we didn't order. I will leave it for the next time because I'll definitely be back!
author: Lin M.

description:
This is my favorite thai place in the city (well, ever really).  Yes, I'm vegan, but I would still love this place if I wasn't.  I take non-vegans here all the time and we all sit around and rave about the incredible flavor of the food, the genuine and helpful staff, and the quaint ambiance. 

Great for Lunch or Dinner, affordable price, and it's good for you.  I highly recommend the Pumpkin Curry, "Crab Cakes" (you would NEVER know they are made from soy), the Thai Samosas, and the Tom Yum soup...the list goes on becuase everything is so delicioius I am inspired to try something new every time.  

Don't walk or drive past this place without trying it once.  I promise you'll be back!
author: Kari S.

description: Ordered take-out and was unimpressed with the quality of the food. Perhaps I had overly high expectations because of the 4.5 start ranking, but the place definitely didn't live up to my expectations. I tried the wing bombs, which were good, but the Pad Thai was utterly unimpressive. Side note- the staff were very kind!
author: Ammar R.

description:
If I could shout one thing from a mountain top, it would be "Eat at Thai Idea!"

Great veggie spring rolls, fantastic green curry.  I eat a LOT of Thai food, and this may be the best I've ever had.  I was hungry and in the mood for Thai, but that doesn't account for all that I experienced.  Presentation of the food was well above average.

The atmosphere is cozy, clean, quiet.  No worries.  Staff is really nice, but they leave you alone with your dining partner.  They were helpful when we told them we had a time limit for dining.  They even advised which dishes took longer to make sure we made our deadline.

Great experience. I'll be back.
author: Jay E.

description: This restaurant is fantastic. The service is outstanding and their food is fresh and delicious. They have a fantastic cream of pumpkin soup. Love how even when I order take out they offer me hot tea while I wait... very customer service oriented. Restaurant ambiance is very nice and clean. Good vegetarian choices but also have chicken and beef plates as well.
author: Yelpingmom Y.

description:
I wanted to check this place out, so a friend (she's been here before) and I came here for lunch yesterday. We're both not vegans, however. 

We ordered:
Crab Cakes
Fresh Salad Rolls
Papaya Salad
Pad Eggplant
Brown Rice

It was a tasty, delicious meal. We both enjoyed the food. The portions were generous. Those salad rolls were sure yummy! Service was great. The restaurant inside is nicely decorated. 

I wouldn't mind going back to try their other items on the menu...
author: Annette L.

description:
So, I'm a vegetarian/vegan-on-good-days foodie...but definitely *not* one of those "hipster locavores" who dominate the yelp scene by their vocalism. Just someone who knows good food, and appreciates a dish for taste rather than for where it's from or what it stands for.

I've lived in SF for the good part of five years. Thai Idea is a hidden gem. Finding a good Thai restaurant is no hard task in SF. Nor is finding an Asian wanna-be-sophisticated restaurant.
