All three items were delicious--the firecracker balls had great heat and the fake meat (while I wouldn't know what real deep fried ahi would taste like) tasted great!  The yellow curry was a great combination of sweet and spicy--the coconut milk took the edge off without overpowering the dish and the fake lamb oddly had just the right texture.  The lemongrass beef was great as well but I found that the lemongrass flavor sort of hijacked the whole thing.

The service was fast and friendly.  We walked from our hotel on Union Square and passed a few odd sights (including some hippie-fest happening at a venue just around the corner) but nothing that made me feel too uncomfortable.  

Great food, great service.  Oh, and if you want to get booze, the waitress told us you can carry in beverages from the adjacent liquor store.  Which we did.
author: Betsy F.

description: Great food. This place is one of those little gems in San Francisco. I love going to a place, as a vegetarian, that I can order anything on the menu! Good flavors, and the food was very pretty as well.
author: La H.

description:
BEWARE OF INCLUDED GRATUITY

The food and service is great, but I think getting ripped off almost a second time makes me a bit miffed about this place. Do be mindful that gratuity is already included in the final receipt. DO NOT ADD ADDITIONAL TIP TO THEIR ALREADY INCLUDED 18% tip.
author: Ray J.

description:
First time I went to this restaurant for lunch today. The service was friendly, quick and helpful. They have a great selection of various Thai menues -  all vegetarian or vegan. I had the "Spicy Lemongrass Beef" which was delicious with just the right spiciness and a deep flavor, the fake beef had the right texture. And all was marvelous presented.  I will definitely go there again to try their version of "Larb Salad".

Thanks "Thai Idea" for enlighten my day.
author: Tobias B.

description: Best vegetarian/vegan Thai food in the country! I travel a lot and this place is the best. The location isn't great and I don't recommend walking there on your own, due to it being right smack in the Tenderloin. But the food is AMAZING. Huge portions, friendly and helpful staff. GREAT PRICES! My husband and I come here every time we're in San Fran. The Tom Yum soup is fantastic. So is the Cashew "chicken". Definitely a must if you like Thai food.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Thai food is my best food. We sought this spot out being new to the bay, after trying about 5 different thai restaurants, none which offered us the yummy mock meats we vegans want to indulge in.

Hoping for some combination of Amarin Thai in San Diego and Komol in Las Vegas, this place got it soo right.

After a questionable trek through the TL, we arrived feeling we deserved to stuff our faces, and that we did.

We got some dishes neither of us had ever experienced: a delicious samosa type item which was fried and delicious, but not greasy. I think we also had a summer roll which was good but not remarkable. The mock duck roulladethingy was unlike anything i've had as a vegan. Really well executed and flavorful. My favorite at any thai restaurant is the pad kee mao which did not disappoint. Dessert was some pastry chocolate amazingness with coconut ice cream. Tasted too good to be vegan but after talking with the owner, we were assured he had a passion for the food and it was his *idea* to open this place.

I wish it were easier to get to but it is well worth it. Go to this place. You do what i say.
author: Alison S.

description: Vegetarians of the world, REJOICE!  This place has an incredible all vegetarian Thai inspired menu, and I've never eaten anything there that I didn't like.  Very impressive presentation of the entree's, and this is the type of place I like to order a lot of food, eat a bunch of it, and then bring a bunch home for leftovers.  Staff is top rate!!  The only note is the restaurant itself is located in a somewhat shady area, so I prefer to go here during daylight, and one word of advice: PEOPLE: This Is Not The Neighborhood to be walking around talking loudly in a "Marina Voice" while staring at your Iphone. Keep your eyes open and your wits about you when in the cut. And stop making all those annoying pauses when you talk, because it only gives me more time to think about how stupid you are, Fa Real!
author: Kevin G.

description: Very impressed with the food and presentation.  I tried the firecracker balls, volcano beef and the pad thai with chicken.  The firecracker balls were nice.  Volcano beef was very spicy!  The pad thai was pretty good.  The thai iced tea was excellent as well as the thai iced coffee.  I cant wait to come back.  :)
author: Lucas C.

description:
Fantastic! The Tenderloin location is definitely on the sketchy side, but once you get off the sidewalk, you are in a cozy little dining room with nice furnishings. The food is delightfully presented and tasty. Service is prompt and friendly.

Appetizers may seem on the pricy side--nearly the price of the entrees--but the portions are generous. I actually wouldn't mind if they had smaller appetizers at more appetizery prices.

Personal favorites: Fresh salad rolls, tom yum or tom kha soup, panang curry, pad kee mao (spicy noodles). But really nearly everything here is yummy...except for the pad thai. I don't know what it's lacking, but it's lacking something.

They are often closed by 9:40 even though they say they are open 'til 10:00. I'd give them five stars otherwise.
author: Nik G.

description: I didn't think the food was good probably because I haven't had a lot of vegetarian/ alternative meat foods in my life. Has the wing bomb and thought the texture of it was weird and not very enjoyable. It is not cheap either.
author: Carrie T.

description: Ick pulease! This place is awful. Nothing's authentic. Maybe if you're a diabetic craving sugar then sure come here. There are way too many Thai places in SF that would be more than happy to accomodate you vegans- all you need to do is ask and you shall receive. Sorry Thai Idea is a BAD idea.
author: J C.

description: I'm really glad I finally got the chance to check this place out. Everything about this place is great. Great decor, service, food and prices. I got a large glass of thai iced coffee that's twice the size of where I get it at other places, at a better price. The samosas that I ordered were very tasty, and the pad Thai was good too. I can't wait to go back and try their other dishes.
author: a f.

description: Vegan duck confit? Are you kidding me? I sampled this and many other I-Can't-Believe-It's-Not-Meat options and left in sated, vegan bliss. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.
author: Amber G.

description: This place is pretty clean, even though it's in the heart if Tenderloin .. Nice ambiance & the food variety is a delight for vegetarians !!
author: Amar C.

description: Lovely little Thai vegetarian place... ordered the pumpkin curry and it was really well done. And nicely presented, too. I can tell it's going to become a favourite.
author: Arvind V.

description:
Tonight my friend and I dined at Thai Idea. The ambiance is pleasant as was the server. Now I am not a vegetarian but am always up to try great food - friend I took is a vegetarian. We started with the firecracker roll - not bad. Then we had the "beef" salad. Amazing flavor and the texture of whatever that "meat" was - was pretty "meaty". We then went on to the "lamb" yellow curry with brown rice and it was delicious. We were about to dive into the Chicken when it happened.....   

I was sitting right by the front door and I had just taken a pic of the beautiful beef salad when some punka$$ dirtbag dashed in, grabbed my iPhone and ran. I yelped (no pun intended) and jumped up. He ran off and I stood there stunned and then the sweet server ran out - as panicked as I was and ran up and down the street with me. What either one of us gals was going to do - I don't know.  I went back inside where my friend sat - also stunned. The other server was already on the phone with the cops. The cops came and he let me use his iPhone to immediately wipe my phone clean. Thai idea has video surveillance and was already accessing the tape to make it available to the cops. Talk about on it.  After the shock had died, I obviously had lost my appetite. The server apologized and I felt like she meant it.  I thanked her and asked her for the bill.  She said no.  (!!!)   I asked again and she waved me off - with sympathy in her eyes. THEN she asked if I wanted a to-go box to take the food home!  These people are a class act. And they have delicious vegetarian food..... the lychee iced tea is pretty dope too. I will go back, but I will NOT sit by the front table by the door - with my shiny iphone sitting out to tempt city trash (mostly because I no longer have one).
author: Bethany G.

description: Really excellent food at great prices by SF standards.  We ordered three dishes to share and all three were well-spiced, tasty, and generous portions.  I am a non-vegetarian and I didn't miss having meat options at all.  The service was friendly and fast, and the decor was attractive without being overdone.  Very much worth tracking it down on an under-visited part of Polk.
author: Scott R.

description: We've traveled to Thailand several times, but never thought of eating vegetarian food there.  That's why we were pleasantly surprised with Thai Idea.  To sum up our experience: delicious (spicy, tangy, flavorful), cant believe there is no meat in these dishes,  small place, but quaint decor.  We made reservations in advance and had no issue with seating. For four people, we can recommend what we ordered: Satay Chicken, Crab Cakes (app), Papaya Salad, spicy lemon grass beef, Bangkok duck, Pineapple fried frice, pad Thai, pumpkin curry.  Their take on mock meats is impressive.  If you are vegetarian, you're lucky to have this choice in your restaurant mix.  For non veggies, don't be put off, you will be positively surprised.
author: Mark And Judy W.

description: Since leaving Seattle, I was sad that the Thai world I knew and loved would be no more. However, I was not prepared to come to San Francisco and find as good if not better Thai. This place was flipping perfect. Sweet-faced girls showed me to my table. The fried tofu appetizer was sublime and the curry pumpkin was fresh and out of this world. I've only tried two Thai places in S.F. so far but I don't expect to find much better than this.
author: Tim R.

description: We discovered this little spot a couple of months ago via a recommendation from my barber. It's located in a fairly sketchy neighborhood, so maybe our expectations weren't as high as they might have been, but we came away completely charmed. After several follow-up visits, we have yet to try anything we didn't enjoy, but the real standout has been the Pumpkin Curry, which is kabocha pumpkin (basically a winter squash) and veggies in a red curry sauce that has fantastic flavor with just a hint of spiciness. Every dish is a visual masterpiece, looking like they were created with an artist's brush. The menu features a lot of faux-meats (not really our thing), but there are loads of veggie and whole-food options, too. The decor is clean, casual and comfortable, service is quietly efficient and the prices are extremely reasonable. We really can't recommend Thai Idea highly enough.
author: Rommie J.

description: This place has everything a vegetarian could desire in a restaurant - options, affordability, and most importantly, delicious food! I walked here from the Crowne Plaza hotel in foster city (about an hour walk), so I was hungry when I arrived. I ordered some of the fried spring rolls, expecting them to be a small appetizer considering how the price stacked up against other Bay Area restaurants I'd been to. However, they could practically be a meal on their own for 7$! I also ordered the pad Thai, which was great, and took abut half I it back for leftovers. The only thing I regret is that I didn't have a chance to go back and try other dishes, because they had so many good looking dishes. If I ever visit the Bay Area again I will definitely visit this restaurant again, despite it's being slightly out of the way.
author: Chance R.

description: Thai and vegan? A perfect combination. Atmosphere is modern yet cozy. Tom yum soup with vegan chicken was the perfect blend of hot and sour. And the pumpkin curry with tofu and veggies - brilliant. I don't get to come to SF often but this was a great spot for this foodie tourist.
author: Eric S.

description: Delicious mock duck curry. Liked it so much I hope to replicate the recipe when I move! The wing bombs were not what I expected - more of a mixed meatloaf texture. The flavors and sauce were very good, so if you don't mind that in your vegan cooking it's all right. Will come here again if time allows.
author: Kit A.

description: I've got to tell you...I don't get these yelp reviews.  I've started to work a few blocks from here, have tried it twice on the basis of the many yelp raves, and...well, let's just say I'd rather eat at Acre.  Or the greasy spoon Chinese a block away.  Certainly Brenda's (when I can absorb the carbs and calories).  This is vegetarian food that tastes like..."Vegetarian Food".  Fake meat that tastes like fake meat.  "Inventive" vegetarian  food because it "almost" tastes /has the texture of the same or a similar dish made with meat. I'd rather eat vegetarian food (and have had it) that is truly inventive and spectacular because it is made of vegetables that taste like the best of what vegetables can be, not 'wing bombs' that taste like well...frankenfood.  Three stars because the atmosphere is nice, the service quick and attentive, and the food edible.
author: Kevin P.

description: I'm a carnivore and this place rocks. Vegetables are very high quality and fresh! We had the satay chicken app, pad woonsen, and jungle curry. All were excellent. Prices are very reasonable. And as a bonus, its BYOB!
author: Brad F.

description: Delicious! I am not a vegetarian and I came in without expectations. I was blown away by the taste, presentation and service. Excellent! I tried wing bomb, firecracker balls, samosa, tom yum, prawn curry with avocado (I forgot name), duck curry, volcanic beef and he lamb dish. All very very tasty!
author: Kay D.

description: The food is good and the presentation is very nice.  Decor is cool and the place is clean.  Not a huge fan of vegan food but will go back to this place.  Downside is its in the ghetto so you'll have to dodge crackheads and hop scotch over homeless people on the way there.
author: Neil C.

description:
This is our second time at Thai Idea, the first time was over three years ago when we were new to the city. We are vegetarians, love thai food (to the point we've taken thai cooking classes to try and learn the secrets of the spices-- we haven't), and had some friends visiting so we met them here for lunch on a weekday. The place is in the tenderloin but is average size, clean and has seating for larger parties -- the street in front is pretty shady so be prepared for that. The server was friendly and the food came out hot/fresh and fast. We ordered the "crab" cakes to start, which were breaded, texturized protein with a wasabi mayo sauce and were on the dry side but OK. We shared the pad kee mao with tofu (noodles were not soft and fresh, they were cut thinner (ie pappardelle style) than we typically like), panang curry with "beef" (spicy, good flavor), pad eggplant with 'shrimp' (eggplant steamed not pan-fried the way we have to come enjoy eggplant at thai places, 'shrimp' just rubbery without any discernible flavor) and the pad basil which comes with "ground chicken" (didn't have much flavor other than basil). The portions were fine, presentation was nice and the flavors were one dimensional.
I am really not sure why this place is so highly rated -- Thai spice on Polk in Russian Hill and Marnee Thai in the sunset are much better, just to name a few. As vegetarians, you can basically get tofu substituted for meat at every Thai restaurant in SF. Overall, not impressed and not going back. I'd rather hit Brenda's down the street, or if in the mood for something Asian get a banh mi from Lee's a few streets over. Don't believe the hype!
author: T K.

description: I love this place!!! The wing bombs are delicious along with everything else Ive tried! They also have a great presentation for all their dishes! Neighborhoods a little shady but other than that, this place is a gem!
author: Jaclyn B.

description: I'm not completely sure how to feel about Thai Idea. The place is a cute and cozy gem in an otherwise gritty area. That's a plus. The menu offers a lot to choose from and the few dishes we tried were okay - not great, but decent. The service is a big downfall, however. We had to flag someone down to take our order after being passed (and noticed) multiple times. They seemed to be doing busy work (e.g. preparing table settings) instead of attending to waiting customers. It was weird.
author: Brett B.

description: I don't like fake meat substitutes all that much, but these dishes were delicious! Just the right amount of spices and veggies! The decor is very simple but beautiful, and the presentation of the dishes was very pretty. I would recommend this place to anyone!
author: Veronica O.

description: I ate here for lunch by myself and enjoyed it.  It was during the week so a lot of the other patrons were wearing suits or work attire, though the place itself seems casual.  The server quickly brought me a drink and soup.  I enjoyed the pad thai, which had a ton of fresh veggies. I would definitely stop  here again.
author: Sara H.

description: I'm a meatatarian and I thought this place was good.  Its in the loin but its really nice inside.  Super delicious vegetarian place with cute, helpful servers that all look the same.  Fake shrimp curry was the right mix of sweet and savory.  Jungle curry was too spicy for my tastes.
author: Matthew P.

description: Thoroughly enjoyed our dinner.  I had Pad Pen - copious vegies with soft tofu.  Very tasty, vegies cooked perfectly, and salad in rice paper rolls - gluten-free, not fake meat, not fried - yay!  Other family members thoroughly enjoyed the fake duck, beef, and shrimp dishes.  Service was prompt, knowledgeable, and sweet.  The food was  pretty sweet, too - makes everything yummy.  Interior atmosphere very comfortable.  Hope I have a chance to go back!
author: Dodi F.

description:
Came here recently with a friend and his review is short and sweet: "Thai Idea == bad idea". It didn't seem authentic, but it's not that the food was horrible... It was actually fairly tasty for what it was, except for the Pad Thai which was lacking some flavor, not to mention the noodles were all clumped together. The Pumpkin Curry was a little thin for our liking, but pretty good overall, and the Golden Cauliflower appetizer was hot and fresh, although I'm generally not a fan of sweet and sour type sauces which it was served with. 

...so why does Thai Idea == bad idea? The service.

- We must have been sitting there for atleast 10 minutes before anyone even brought us water. 
- We order our food and the waitress asks if we would like white rice or brown rice...
- "Brown rice, please."
- The waitress then tells us that the food might take a while because they were overwhelmed with 2 large groups that were there, and asks if we would like an appetizer.
- "Will an appetizer come out sooner if we order one?" my friend asks.
- "No, it won't come out any faster." she says. So we don't order an appetizer. 
- A few minutes pass, then the waitress comes back. 
- "Actually, if you order an appetizer, it will come out faster." she says. 
- We ask to look at a menu again. I didn't want anything fried, so we ordered the fresh salad rolls. 
- A few minutes pass, and the waitress comes back again.
- "Actually, the fresh salad rolls won't come out faster, but if you order something fried, it will come out faster."
- What??? Ok fine. Then we'll take the golden cauliflower. (which actually does end up coming out fairly timely).
- When the main dishes arrive, the waitress puts a plate of white rice on the table. "We're out of brown rice." she says. No apology, no nothing. 
- What??? I didn't think it was possible for an asian restaurant to run out of rice! Guess I was wrong. 

And one other thing...they put ALL our leftovers together into a single takeout box...Pad Thai on the bottom, then Pumpkin Curry, then the leftover white rice on top. Who does that???!?
author: Kristen C.

description: good vege food. Great service. Reasonable prices for big portion. Stick with any rice dish & ask for brown rice!
author: Bessie T.

description:
Especially for being somewhere like the TL, I came in with pretty low expectations but was blown away by their awesome cuisine and the modern atmosphere.

I would have given a 5-star rating, but their service was just a bit slow and I had to call the waitress over each time I wanted a refill of my water even though there was only one other party besides my friend and I in the establishment. That being my only complaint though, I have to say that overall this place is a diamond in the rough and I will definitely be back!

Also have to give props to their fake meat. It's very easy to do fake meat wrong and as a veg*n, I have seen just how terrible it can get. Thai Idea, however, has gotten it right, and even my friend who loves meat and hates vegetables had to come in for seconds after offering her a bite. I almost had to slap her fork away since she was eating so much of my food!
author: Jake W.

description:
This place is really as good as it gets. They have consistently excellent, friendly service, large portions, gorgeous presentation, and everything is simply delicious. 
The staff really goes out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. I've had almost everything on the menu and it's all great but, my favorites by far are the crab cakes, panang curry, and pad eggplant.


I recommend coming for lunch because everything is slightly cheaper and you usually get complimentary soup or salad! I would eat here every day if I could.
author: Alicia H.

description: It's not often one finds a restaurant that serves beautiful food that tastes even better! It's a safe place for vegetarians as it's a veg only thai place. Pad kee mow perfectly done with a nice blend of vegs and pannang curry was sooo good.
author: Ashish K.

description: Looking for somewhere close to the Great American Music Hall. Found this on Yelp, what a diamond in the rough neighborhood, patronize this place and let's keep them busy. The food is excellent with a wide choice of faux meats. Downside, No beer or wine.
author: Nigel P.

description: While visiting my favorite city, we were searching for a good place to eat. Craving and finally deciding to get thai, we saw there was a vegetarian Thai restaurant in walking distance from our hotel. Perfect! Aside from being in a seedy part of town, the inside is beautiful! It's also very romantic. The food is gorgeously presented. I had the "chicken" pad woon sen and my friend had the "chicken" pad kee mow. Mine was good and his was also good but spicy. We decided it would have tasted better with tofu. The best part of the meal was the dessert! Try the fried banana with vegan coconut ice cream. Delish!!!
author: Catalina V.

description:
I dined in Thai Idea Vegetarian. It was great!! It's hard to find Thai vegetarian restaurant! I was so surprised that I was hustling to try it when I heard about the restaurant/

It's not only taste itself is good, but it's also how they decorate their food. Every plate is so beautiful!!! The taste is awesome!!! 

I ordered Firecracker Balls. It was yummy and crispy!! I also ordered Papaya salad, Chicken Vindaloo Curry with deep fried roti!!! It was delicious. My main course was noodle with curry. It was great too!! I loved it!! The service is great. They are all friendly!! 

It's the great place to try! You guys should check it out and you'll see!!

The restaurant is right in downtown San Francisco! Check it out!!
author: Lilizhu Bo L.

description: Excellent service! Our server knew what we could and couldn't have with our Gluten allergy.  Food came out quickly. The flavor was A M A Z I N G! I feel like I need to go again just to have more items on the menu.
author: Noah A.

description: Amazing food!! Not only is this the best Vegetarian Thai restaurant it is the best Thai restaurant I have ever been to!
author: Gagan S.

description: Great presentation.  Staff serves with alacrity, always refilling water.  Prices match online ordering menu (higher than another version of the menu also posted online).  Decent food.  Super elegant bathroom with glass wash basin and aromatic soap.  Very sketchy neighborhood, though.
author: SF O.

description:
I was really impressed when I walked into this place! They have awesome decor and ever their bathroom was super fancy! I guess the decor made my expectations go up to high because unfortunately I wasn't as impressed with their food.
My friends and I all shared their wing bomb, fresh rolls, pad thai, and pineapple fried rice. 
I didn't really try the wing bomb because I don't care for faux meat but my faux meat loving friends really didn't like it. They told me they only ate it because they were starving and didn't want to seem rude!
 I was disappointed with my fresh rolls and I didn't even think that was even possible because those are usually my favorite! They roll them in a rice noodle instead of rice paper which just didn't cut it for me :/ Although, my friends loved the peanut sauce it came with  (later found out they use jiffy peanut butter, blech!)
The pad thai was also super disappointing... maybe it just wasn't the chefs day that day?
The only thing that we all enjoyed was the pineapple fried rice but even I have a criticism for that which is rare! Their fried rice was surprisingly really greasy, not that I should really expect something better when someone orders FRIED rice but still! I've been to so many Asian restaurants and this has to have been the oiliest rice.
Maybe we just didn't order the right things that day but I don't really want to take my chances when there are so many great vegan places in SF. The only reason why I gave it 3 stars rather then 2 is because their decor is so nice and the presentation of the food was great! Maybe if you make something look pretty enough people will think it tastes good too :/
author: Lauren H.

description: Fabulous. I actually felt chi energy flowing into my body during and after my meal here.
author: Troy H.

description: One of the best vegetarian joint in town. Full of surprises and twists. Highly recommended...
author: Sudeep A.

description: its very good restaurant for vegetarians as well as non Vegetarians. We loved food and service. each and eve dish is good I would love to go next next time..
author: Rajasekhar G.

description: CLOSED by the Health Dept. Yelp needs to keep abreast of such actions and inform its readers.
author: Mike F.

description: Dear Abby, I am surprised I need to explain this. The reason why I asked what is wrong with the Yelpers is because there is not a single restaurant that is rated so high by so many others but really is terrible, not even a single other establishment. Really it seems this place is mainly praised for their creation of non meat, meat like items, but I could care less about that. As a Vegetarian I care much more about tasty fresh ingredients, I don't want my food to taste like meat. In terms of preparation and ingredients this place doesn't compare to King of Thai Noodle, or many other places. I get it you like fancy tables and stuff that tastes like meat. I like fresh food without a ton of oil.
author: Neil W.

description: This freaking place! I had the pumpkin curry with brown rice and the thai somosas for an appetizer and I got it all in literally under 6 minutes. The service was excellent, the decor is beautiful and the food presentation is really gorgeous! I was super happy with my meal and I highly recommend this place to omnivores and vegans alike.
author: T H.

description: I ordered the lamb curry and it was so good! I can't do spicy and told the waitress this and there was none.
author: Amanda M.

description: I came here last night and it only reaffirms that the Thai food is crazy good here. The flavors are very authentic. The tom yum soup was delish, especially since they don't use fish sauce (which is ok in small amounts to me, but defn not in big quantities). We also had the Masaman curry which was a little sweet, but not overly. The gapow was also super yummy. Loved the fake chicken and the bamboo shoots!
author: Natalie S.

description:
Really cannot understand why this place has such high ratings. Five stars?  Come on now.

Nice decor and very pretty presentation of the food, but the food was just not that great and everything was way too sweet and lacking in flavor.

- Shrimp rolls were totally tasteless, dipping sauce was just sweet.
- Crab cakes were OK.  Having never had real crab cakes and always wondering what I'm missing, I was excited to try these.  Not much flavor, like a fried breadcrumb patty with some sort of bland seasoning.
- Bangkok duck.  Didn't see anything here remotely resembling the "confit" described on the menu.  It was more like the cold crispy mock duck served in many Chinese restaurants, except served hot and ruined by the ever-present sweet sauce.
- Beef noodle dish was the best thing we had.  But the veg beef was tough and tasteless, so it added nothing.  You don't need to make a trek here for good Thai noodles.

Sorry to say, but I've had much better Thai vegetarian food.
author: Ritch G.

description: Sooooo delicious!!!  The service was great and the soup was THE BEST!!!  We live in so cal, but think driving all the to SF for this restaurant alone would be totally worth it - especially knowing its vegetarian!
author: C K.

description: Best Tom kha soup I've ever had!  Byob vibe and good lookin staff.
author: Devon J.

description: I work near Brendas Soul Food for god sakes so I'm quite pleased that this restaurant is on the same block to help me resist as I press on during this 'vegan challenge' I'm taking. The larb dish was lame but the vegan faux chicken vindaloo was exquisite. The appetizers so far have all been satisfying and the service is prompt, but the main dishes are hit or miss as I've experienced and read from everyone else's posts. Avoid the soups - I just paid $9 for the Tom Kha Veggie Soup that had no tofu, mushrooms, or tomato in it  - it was mostly lemon water with some zest, lemongrass and kafir leaves. Wack.
author: Bettie N.

description: Good quality food at reasonable prices. I had a veggie pad kee mow because I wasn't in the mood to try one of their "meat" options. I want to come back and try it though. The dish was pretty good. Nice amount of spice although near the end of the meal I found myself sniffling. They do warn you on the menu, though. They had a wide variety of veggies in the dish and the overall portion was not shy. Not enough to split into two meals but too much for one meal. Would come back again to try other dishes, as they had a very interesting and varied menu.
author: Sannie L.

description: Delicious, affordable food with excellent service.  It's healthy, vegetarian fare, with convincing faux meat that is savory and satisfying.  If you're in the neighborhood, I'd recommend giving it a go!
author: Tom F.

description: A great stop for sating the inner vegan beast in all of us.  Make sure to tell em if you want heat and if so, how many swats.   Else you might get an overly-polite dish.  the presentation was clever and the interior upscale for this area of down-market Polk.
author: Jim W.

description: I don't have a lot to add after what other reviewers have said but I'm writing this as I really like this restaurant. As a vegetarian this place is awesome.. the keywords for this place are: real vegetarian thai, fake meat, nice ambiance and affordable.
author: saurabh S.

description: Good service and good prices. As a recovering vegetarian, I didn't find the food, amazing, but old vegetarian me would have been pleased. A very solid option in the TL.
author: Rachel M.

description:
I am not a vegetarian, but trying to lose some beer pudge has forced me to eat healthier lately, so I gave this place a shot.

I live right around the corner from this place and can see it from my living room window, so I witnessed first-hand its booming early success as a new restaurant in the area.

I eat lots of Thai food. I'm surrounded by it. In general, it's healthy, affordable, and tasty. Those are the three adjectives than win me over when I think of Thai food. Scratch 1.5 of those, for this place is healthy, not affordable and only a little tasty. I know I seem like a naysayer here; when a restaurant comes into an area that is 50-100% more expensive than its competing neighbors and has only vegetarian/vegan dishes, the local SF snobs are going to create a lot of buzz to show off: 1) they can afford it, and 2) they're trendy enough to not eat meat. But are the high prices and aesthetic aura really worth the $10 entrees that don't even include rice (+$2.00)? 

The red curry was excessively oily, the vegetarian chicken tasted like plastic and my girlfriend's food made her turn red and splotchy, which makes me accuse this place of using MSG. Sure, they use fancy silverware and geometric plates and bowls, and the entrees APPEAR as though they should be on Food Network, but that doesn't compensate for the fact that this is a THAI restaurant in the TENDERLOIN. There are plenty of other places within two blocks that offer many of the same vegetarian dishes for 1/2-2/3 the price that taste much more homemade and won't make your MSG allergies emerge. This place is, quite frankly, overrated. Sorry to be a bummer, but I'm not one to cling to pretentious SF trends. I wouldn't be surprised if I saw a bunch of Segways and Nissan Leafs parked outside this place being driven by people with anti-cigarette stickers on their cars and smudges of their own crap hanging off their noses. I really wish I could hear what sorts of comments people will make when they read this. I apologize for being a realist. Go flare your nostrils now.
author: Eliot R.

description:
Went there when they opened and loved it.  Went back tonight, not so much.

$40 for a disgusting meal!  We are leftovers people. It's my favorite part of the meal (taking the leftovers home so I can eat them the next day) and we did NOT take anything home. Didn't eat half of either dish and we were just too grossed out.

Corn tower - fried corn. Didn't come with any sauce and had barely any cucumber salad with it, which it was supposed to have. Not great.
Pad Ginger - it was so-so.
Pad Woonsen - disgusting. The fake beef was chewy and had no flavor, or bad flavor. So gross (and it's usually so yummy at other vege places). No sauce, dry and gross.

So so disappointing and to top it off, it was so expensive for such a crappy meal.

Service was pretty slow (even though we ordered before it got busy) and the thai teas were too sweet.

:-(
author: alex g.

description: Amazing veggie Thai place in the TL? Umm... yeah, it's for real. After seeing a movie at the nearby theatre on Van Ness, my boyfriend suggested that we pop into Thai Idea Vegetarian for dinner. I had been dying to check it out, so I was 100% game. I'm not sure what I was expecting, but I was amazed that a Thai place in the Tenderloin would be so nice inside! The ambiance is great -- perfect for a date -- and the food is really incredible; I would wager that my meat-eating boyfriend even found it appetizing. We ordered the green curry and pad see ew (one with tofu and one with vegetarian 'chicken') and I was impressed with the presentation, the flavors, the portion size and the overall package. I honestly have nothing BAD to say about this spot, except for the fact that the area is a bit rough. Overall value -- this place is definitely a 4 -5 star joint worth checking out.
author: Shannon E.

description: I think this is now my favorite Thai restaurant. At the very least, my favorite vegetarian place. The meal was delicious, presentation off the hook, and the folks that work here a very friendly. A friend recommended the place...I'm glad I took his advice.
author: Kevin M.

description: So many options for vegetarians. Taste and presentation are so good. Superior quality food with very reasonable prices!
author: Melanie H.

description: Ambience was really good. Place was pretty clean. The best part was FOOD :) .. never had such good imitation meat else where. Service was pretty good too just that because I asked for rice without egg  instead of asking me they presumed that I'm vegan and gave me Soy iced tea instead of the normal one.Certainly looking forward to going there again. I liked their complimentary beet juice too.
author: Katty D.

description: The food here was delicious, the wing-bomb was awesome, and the service was quick and on point.  Everything we ate was great and the BYOB makes it that much better!
author: Isaac R.

description:
I'm not really vegetarian but my BF is. Every time we are going to this place and  order mock chicken or beef I can't taste the different from real meet.  They serve the most flavored and tasteful food I've ever tried.
Number one Thai for even NOT vegetarian.

Vegetarian and vegan ideas for you! Try prones, I still can't believe it's fake!!!
author: Tat R.

description: Wonderful place. Heading back tonight for my third visit and I'm not a vegetarian. Great quality food.
author: Heather W.

description: Delicious!  Went with two carnivore friends and they were also very impressed.  Definitely get the wing bomb and pad thai.
author: Nidhi J.

description: I was in town on business and needed a quick lunch.  Got the green curry with tofu and veggies.  Delicious.  Quick.  Even came with a complimentary little cup of some sort of pumpkin soup?
author: Preston A.

description:
Yay! My favorite lunch place is back on my list! I had boycotted the place for the last couple of months because of the rude and obnoxious waiter, but recently I found out that he no longer works there. I heard other people had similar experiences and had avoided the place for the exact same reason. 

Now that that waiter is gone, the service has improved 100%! The food has always been excellent, of course. 

I highly recommend this place!
author: Vu T.

description: I tripped over this place on my way to one of my usual lunchtime haunts and decided to stop in and check it out. It's clean, the waitstaff was friendly, and the "ten minute" wait for my take-out took only five minutes. Best of all, when I asked that they make the food "very spicy" it WAS ACTUALLY SPICY. The portions were very generous and the brown rice was perfectly cooked.
author: Laurel T.

description:
Really wanted to like this place b/c I'm a vegetarian and love Thai.  But I'm as happy going to my regular Thai places since there are so many dishes you can get vegetarian anyway that taste better than those at this place.

Very pleasant interior for this restaurant in a place you wouldn't expect it.

Service was friendly but slow.

Food was very mediocre and I won't be returning.  The "veggie" beef and chicken on the larb adn noodle dishes we ordered were very good, and I normally avoid "fake meat."  However, the dishes were a little spicier than they needed to be which ditracted from the taste, and I eat a lot of Thai food and have no problem w/ spice.  Also, the flavor also just wasn't great.  We also got the tom kha gai coconut soup and it was sweeter more than it needed to be w/ too much sugar added.  I also ordered the fake meat choice rather than the "vegetable" choice since I was told there would be vegetables in the dishes anyway, but there were very few.

Prices seemed on par w/ comparable thai restaurants.
author: Rainforest C.

description: Best Thai food I've had. Not the best location but definitely worth it. The presentation of each dish is beautiful and unique and the atmosphere in the restaurant is calming yet fun. And the food is delicious!
author: Anna P.

description: Wonderful! Delicious food, beautiful presentation, nice atmosphere/seating, lots of vegan options, attentive service.
author: Pax G.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant in SF and prices were reasonable, staff was friendly and food was delicious and plentiful (I had to get a doggy bag!)
author: Mike D.

description:
We came here for lunch and the atmosphere was lovely. Peaceful and sophisticated.

We had:
Chicken satay. The peanut sauce was delicious! 

Pumpkin curry with chicken: Again, the sauce stole the show. It was fairly similar to a red curry but with more pumpkin flavor. I had a few nitpicks though: there was very little actual pumpkin in the dish -- just a few little pieces (compared to, say, Marnee Thai where it's served in a pumpkin), and the soy chicken was more similar to soy beef. 

Pad see ew: Also delicious. The noodles were well cooked and seasoned and full of veggies. 

I wasn't as impressed with their soy "meats" here as other veggie places. I prefer Enjoy Vegetarian or Golden Era in that regard. The dishes outside of that were very, very good. I'd probably get them with tofu next time.
author: C M.

description:
A diamond in the rough!  On one of the standardly grimy blocks of The Tenderloin is a new promise of lunch time hope. On the few occasions that I don't pack my own lunch to work, and grab a bite to eat in the TL, I sometimes have a hard time separating myself from the yuckiness of the streets, to the food-safe environment inside the restaurant.  At Thai Idea, I was able to enjoy that separation, and as a result, thoroughly enjoy my delicious lunch!

I'm not new to vegetarian Asian cuisine, but this was my first time trying out a place which is Thai-specific.  As with my past experiences with meat substitutes, the soy and gluten meat doesn't taste like the real thing, but they do a good job of making it taste pretty darn flavorful.  Combined with a texture that is consistent with a particular type of meat, who cares if it's the real thing or not, it's tasty!  I had the pad kee mow, with "chicken", and despite having just recovered from an abdominal surgery, I left not a single molecule of a noodle on the plate.  The heat of the chili was perfect.  It offered a bit of pizzazz, but without overpowering the other flavors in the dish.   The vegetables were tender, but not over cooked, and the noodles slid across my tongue like silk, yet, had a satisfying bite to them.  Before leaving, I had some of their coconut ice cream.  Because there is no milk fat in the ice cream, it is light, and the coconut flavor is very natural.

From the exterior, it's rather nondescript, but a peak in the window is rather inviting.  The decor is fresh and modern, and most important, everything looks clean.  The lunch crowd there wasn't overly populated, so we were seated in an instant, and the two servers who we interacted with were rather pleasant and welcoming. Such a welcome addition to that neighborhood.
author: Damon Z.

description:
A dream come true for a vegetarian!
Everything is perfect at thai idea veg...Pretty decor, awesome yummy food and presentation is wow....
Can not give anything less than a five star!!
Perfect thai idea...
author: Niti S.

description: So, this is within a couple blocks of my house. I am so excited that I finally tried it. This may be the BEST Thai food I've ever had. I went with three other people. We got three appetizers and four entrees, and every single thing was amazing. The presentation is beautiful. The atmosphere is nice and cozy. I got the pumpkin curry, which was the best I've had. Friends got panang curry, pad thai, and tom kha soup, all of which were absolutely amazing. We had really attentive service, and she was very accomodating. I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone. The area it is in is fine. If the neighborhood concerns you, then don't come. It would definitely be your loss though.
author: Terry G.

description: Very, very yummy! The fake meat options are excellent, although I found the fake chicken to be more akin to beef (it's also possible we were brought the wrong dish). Either way it didn't matter because the dishes were delicious. I highly recommend the satay appetizer but would say that the veggie based dishes (as in vegetables with no fake meat) are good, but not the shining star. I'll definitely be returning and wouldn't hesitate to recommend to veggies and meat eaters alike. Also... coconut juice with coconut meat? SO GOOD.
author: Kathryn M.

description: Wow... Thai done right!  This is the first Thai place I've been to that brings the spice! Bomb food, cute atmosphere, great service, byob with no corkage fee... Sold!
author: Ashley J.

description: I am totally blown away by this place.  How they can make vegetables and tofu come out tasting like beef and chicken is beyond me.  Very spicy, Very Flavorful.  The cook is very very talented and I highly recommend this place.  I will be back myself.  I had Jasmine Tea and Ice cold water, along with a delicious Papaya Salad, followed by Brown Rice and the Volcano Beef dish, the most spicy and flavorful.  I didn't eat all of my rice, although it was tempting, as I was beginning to get full, and I still wanted Dessert.  I had the Fried Bananas with homemade Ice Cream (I believe to be an Almond milk/Coconut type of creation), which was also superb with stuffed raspberries and a sliced strawberry.  I was dying to try the Wing Bombs, but could not hold anymore so got an order of those to go so I could put them in the frigerator and warm them up tomorrow.  But, I had to try a couple bites, and found they are addictive and ate a whole wing bomb, and forced myself to put the others in the frig.  The prices were all reasonable with most dishes being from $6.95 - $11.95.  The sides and drinks were also reasonable.   You won't be disappointed here.  The service was superb too.
author: David M.

description: One of the best Thai food I have ever tasted. Service was excellent. The food was beautifully presented. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone who visits or lives in SF!
author: 1234 A.

description:
for starters: i'm not vegan or vegetarian.

that being said, it was pretty darn good for what it was.  FOR WHAT IT WAS, which was meatless food and listen, i like chicken.  the pumpkin curry was really quite tasty and my dining partner and i also got pad kee mao and i didn't want to tell her this while we were at dinner so Katy A., if you're reading this tell me if you agree but... the pad kee mao smelled like a bathroom that was cleaned the day before.  it had an odd smell to it, which i know she picked up on but we couldn't identify WHAT the smell was or why it was familiar.

the place got SUPER crowded... like every table was full and people were waiting at the door.  the decor was really nice especially considering the location.  i don't live near this restaurant and since i'm not vegan i won't go back.  but if you're vegan you'll probably love it here.

also, just a gripe: too many damn pillows on the bench seat.  too many!
author: Lauren P.

description:
Delicious food and charming staff in this small and worthy find. I had hot and sour soup with tofu and a pumpkin curry dish, with vegetables, also with tofu, and brown rice. All was cooked perfectly.
The restroom was immaculate and fit the decor of the restaurant. Honestly I think it was clean enough in there that you could eat off the vanity.
One caution: Ellis from east is too seedy. Get off Muni at Civic Center, go west on Market, north on Polk and you'll be fine.
One critique: Large screen TV was a distraction in an other-wise quietly elegant and relaxing atmosphere. If this place bags the TV it will be flawless.
author: Nicole S.

description: This place is so yummy!!!  My favorite Thai restaurant in the Bay Area (and we've been to a lot)!  As picky vegetarians, my husband and I are always on the lookout for fantastic veggi food.  Thai restaurants often include fish sauce in with "vegetarian" dishes - which not only goes against my principles, but tastes bad!  Thai Idea goes the extra mile with all their dishes making them not only delicious but beautiful too!  Last time we ate there they decorated each meal with an orchid.  My favorite is to go here with several people so we can share all different dishes (rare for vegetarians!).  Friendly, attentive service.  Clean, extra tasty, super yummy food.  If quality of meals and service continues, we will be regulars for a very long time!  I only hope the good reviews don't go to their heads and they raise the prices!  I am all about prices affecting the taste of the meal.
author: Phoebe M.

description:
These people are fantastic! 

I just went in to get some curry to take home and found out that I had left my wallet at home. They let me bike home WITH my order anyway! Incredibly sweet, especially since it was the first time I was there. They even were fine with me bringing the money tomorrow, and noted it was raining. Fabulous!

Super, super nice - and the curry was great! Very tasty, with perfect brown rice. 

I'm in awe.
author: Henriette C.

description: Great vegan Thai place settled in the Tenderloin / Little Saigon neighbourhood.  It follows the pattern of an Asian mock meat restaurant, but with a little more emphasis on making delicious curry sauces.  It's on my list of places to take people from out of town.  Great iced coffee/tea and the firecracker balls are amazing.  I'd stick to the coconut curries for dinner, as the other curries are a little more hit and miss.
author: Douglas P.

description: Very nice dining area, friendly staff, and excellent service.  The food was great just the right amount of spice and enjoyed the soy Thai ice tea.
author: Matthew E.

description: We ordered wing bomb.. It was awesome ...in this place vegetarians have a whole menu to look at :)....it happens very rarely :)... It was a very pleasant experience .. We order pumpkin curry... It was delicious too..... Pad basil was ok ...service is very fast and they are very attentive...
author: Panthesh S.

description: Wow! I've never eatten vegetarian food before and now that I have I'll do it again!!!
author: Ryan M.

description: Everything we have ordered on the menu is amazing!  The staff is really friendly, the place is really clean, and the prices are reasonable.  The variety of fake meats used is great, and the hardcore meat eaters we've brought along have been pleasantly surprised. The curry is fantastic!
author: Jesse W.

description: The restaurant is not terrible.  But the food is too oily.  I eat at vegetarian restaurants specifically to feel healthy.  If I'm going to put unhealthy food in my mouth, I rather put in some bbq ribs or kobe steak.
author: Byron L.

description:
Food: The wing bombs are amazing. Taste exactly like chicken and have an amazing flavor and crunch. The spicy beef fried rice is very good as well but could be spicier and have more beef.

Price: $18 for an appetizer and entree is pretty standard for quality vegan food. If this place was 20% cheaper, I'd be here at least twice a week.

Service: Very friendly staff and very quick service.
author: Mack D.

description: So delicious! My new favorite place for inexpensive, completely wonderful food! Basil Cha Cha, sister restaurant in the South Bay is also amazing! Highly, highly recommend!
author: Jessica S.

description: A nice little oasis in the wacky TL. Walked in on a Sat. afternoon and there was plenty of seating. Friendly service, pleasant, serene environment (love the fountain) and great vegetarian food. I thought their presentation of the food was impressive too - There were flowers decorating the pineapple fried rice and the Wing Bomb appetizer had a very artful drizzle of sauce with crunchy basil leaves arranged around the wings. Also had the pumpkin curry w/tofu and a "beef" dish with bell peppers. Portions were large and everything was so delicious I had to stop myself from eating everything even with a full stomach. Managed to stop myself and saved enough to have a hearty lunch the next day with the leftovers. Good stuff, I'll be back.
author: Barbara K.

description:
A vegetarian thai place with all the classics except the meats (standard entrees of beef, pork, chicken, shrimp) were all artificial and vegetarian. I was a little disappointed to hear the standard meats were all soy based. I had the "beef" Pad woonsen. The noodles were delicious, the "beef" was not so great. The presentation was gorgeous (see pictures) - topped with stringed beet noodles over the dish. The dish was a pretty good portion and the mushrooms, egg, onion and tomatoes were all fantastic as well. The beef had a rubbery tofu texture and a bitter tofu taste. The drink menu was very small, and the Jasmine tea was a bagged Trader Joe's.
It is a cozy, tame and pleasant atmosphere, an easy place for conversation. I really enjoyed Nina's yellow curry (a thick, heavily flavored slightly spicy broth), though the lamb meat was also pretty bitter - though better tasting than the beef. I found the prices a little higher than expected(~12-15$ / entree), though they do an excellent job on presentation and preparation, aside from the meats. Overall a decent place if you are of the vegetarian persuasion ... I might advise just ordering a dish and tell them to omit the "meats" altogether - as in my opinion it only detracts from what otherwise were great dishes.
author: Madalina B.

description: As far as Thai food goes, for me this is as good as it gets. The Menu is straightforward with not a huge selection, however in the few times I have eaten there each dish has been immense. Staff are very friendly and accommodating also.
author: John B.

description: This is the perfect place for a veg to bring a meat eater.  Its nice but not stuffy and the food is awesome.  This is the first time in a long time that I have gotten food at a new veg joint and actually ordered more food to take home after the meal.
author: shannon d.

description: This place is excellent!  My vegetarian partner has eaten here five times in the past six days.  I'm a huge carnivore and this place has many great "meat" options that have my tastebuds salivating.  Great concept.
author: Joey F.

description:
Amazing food (although do not order tofu larb, it does not have much taste).  Such great vegetarian and easily vegan food.  Very affordable.  Service very quick and polite.
Do not forget to order sticky rice and mango.
Warning!  servings are gigantic - one appetizer and one main is more than enough for two people.
author: Lala R.

description: I love this place!! The pumpkin curry and the vegan crepe-chocolate-homemade coconut ice cream dessert thing are my favorites!!!
author: Ashleigh T.

description: I had the green curry with tofu and vegetables. Also had the fried spring rolls and both were good. Very fresh tasting. Didn't taste entirely authentic though.
author: Samantha C.

description: Fresh, plentiful and tasty.  Between the two of us, we ordered the wing bombs, papaya salad, and a garlic veggie dish, that we added ginger to.  Add rice, and a bottle of byob wine, and you are more than good to go.  The dining room can get rather warm, but other than that, this place is solid.
author: Lauren M.

description: Delicious food, great presentation. And everything is vegetarian!  I'm a big fan of Thai food and this place definitely ranks high on my list. In addition,  great customer service. The server was so sweet! The only drawback is the location. Would love if they could deliver.
author: Monica S.

description: Lovely little restaurant with great service. We had the fried rice pad Thai, massamun  curry and Tom kha soup. All quite good and nicely presented.
author: Debbie S.

description: terrific atmosphere, super nice customer service and absolutely delicious food along with beautiful presentation add up to a great dining experience!!! Stop what you are doing right now and go here and get some food. You won't be sorry.
author: Critic M.

description: Our waiter was very pleasant and attentive. The presentation of the food is modern. There is a nice atmosphere. Even if you are not a vegetarian, the food is delicious. We will definitely be going back to this little diamond in the ruff.
author: Kianna C.

description: I ordered the shrimp pad thi and was amazed! I dont have a lot of comparison for shrimp as I do not eat seafood but the fake shrimp was incredible! Almost for sure the best meal I had on my weeklong vacation to California.
author: Michael S.

description: It's getting busier and I've been back several times. Absolutely fantastic food.  And if they suggest something, take the suggestion!
author: Nathan P.

description:
I must first admit that this review is somewhat of a self-serving review; I want everyone to know about Thai Idea so that it stays around forever and so I can forever get my fix on fantastic vegan/vegetarian Thai food. 

The green mango salad was so adorably decorated (orange flowers floating around!!) that I actually squealed when it came out, and my dining companion exclaimed that it was the best he's had in a couple of years. The Tom Kha soup was authentic and perfectly savory. The tamarind duck...oh geez....the "skin" was crispy and savory-sweet.  The Thai iced tea was also done very well; not overly sweet like most restaurants. Everything about this meal was so scrumptious, and the portion sizes were very reasonable as well. The menu is also extensive enough that you can come back multiple times and order something new every time. (quick public service warning: you should only order medium spicy if you like it hot, and only order hot if you're into BDSM...)

The service was amazing too. The food came out super quickly and in the end, the owner even came out himself and asked us how the food went! The decor was trendy, and the bathroom smelled like Christmas...I can't say enough good things about this place!

 ps. Before I went, I had a dream about the beef that they served there and that the owners told me that it beef was actually not vegan and that they were serving emu meat to vegans/vegetarians, but I'm happy to report that it tasted nothing like what I imagined emu meat to taste like!

Go to Thai Idea!! Nowwwwwwww!
author: Amanda F.

description: Cannot say enough good things about this place! We were visiting from the east coast with two vegans. We called about reservations and the guy nicely told us there was only one table of customers at the time. That made us hesitant, but we decided to give it a try. The place quickly filled up after we arrived. Every single thing we ordered was delicious. The only negative is that we don't have this restaurant back home!
author: Ellen L.

description: Imagine: Thai food, great taste, reasonable price, cool interior, good atmosphere, AND free of MSG, so you don't get a splitting headache. How awesome is that? Winner!
author: Nor C.

description: We ate here last night before the opera and thought  the food was solid and the service was very good.  The cold spring rolls were decent but the corn tower was way too greasy.  We tried a "beef" and a "duck" disk - both solid and good enough that we would come back here again (but not make a special out of the way trip to do so).  LOVED the fact that it was ALL VEGAN!!!!!!!!
author: Wendy K.

description:
I don't say this easily, but Thai Idea could very well be fast on its way to being one of my favorite restaurants in SF, and I'm not that easy to please.

The BYOB aspect is awesome once you realize the implications.  The waiter informs you that you can get beer next door, where you pay $4 for a 22 of a local IPA.  Much better deal than any restaurant and so easy.  This also gives Thai Idea a leg up over other vegan Asian restaurants in SF, which are typically completely dry.

There's enough reviews on here that I probably don't need to go into too much detail about how the portions are great for the price (not to mention the presentation) and the staff are super friendly.  But I have to mention two things.

One, this is the first restaurant I have been to, in my memory, period, where I ask for extra spicy and they really BRING IT. (Though not too many items on their menu are marked as spicy, you can make anything spicy to your desired level.)  In that, I'm sucking air and eyes watering.  That I can't finish my meal and have to take 3/4 of it home.  That I order dessert merely to calm the burning in my mouth because the beer I'm drinking alternating with water (attentively proffered) is not sufficient. I really enjoy spicy and most places don't seem to take me at my word.  Next time I go to Thai Idea I'll know to order medium spicy.

That said, this exposed me to my next favorite thing about Thai Idea: the coconut ice cream.  I had the vegan Thai crepe with ice cream, and the crepe itself was a bit forgettable, but the ice cream was amazing.  It has chunks of toasted coconut meat and a wonderful texture and flavor.  Because of the chunks, I had to ask them if they made it in-house.  The waiter said he didn't think so and insisted on checking on the source for me.  Apparently they get it from a distributor in LA who imports it from Thailand.  It is pretty amazing, and I look forward to trying it with the fried banana next time.

Nice big windows so you can keep an eye on your bicycle locked up outside.
author: Tamara F.

description:
I was looking for a good Thai place in SF to hang around with friends and being a Hindu I prefer Vegetarian places. I found this place on yelp and it is totally worth it. The ambiance is very calm and soothing and the food is awesome.

I would totally recommend this place.
author: Bhargav T.

description:
This is not only vegetarian but can be vegan, and has the typical Buddhist "fake meat".  The decor is cool enough for date night, the Thai iced coffee (soy milk option) is served in lovely glasses and right on. 

Not being a vegetarian I think Pad Thai misses the fish sauce. The "Duck" curry was yummy -- like my previous experience with Buddhist fake meat, it would have been just as good with tofu. 

Wing Bombs were entertaining.
author: Spark T.

description: Nice ambience. Served lunch very quickly. Waitress was very friendly. Food was good too. Good sized portions.
author: Kusuma A.

description:
It's a little scary walking to this place, but once we got inside it was beautiful! The ambiance was elegant and intimate. The meal was so tasty and well-presented and the servers adorable (if a little rushed). We will absolutely be back. 

But why is there a huge tv messing up the decor they had so carefully chosen? Not only was nobody watching it (truly not a single person in the place, throughout our entire leisurely meal), but lame entertainment news shows about a gruesome corpse being found on the queen's property was very unappetizing. 

It was clear that this is the type of restaurant that people go to enjoy each other's company, not catch up on the news. Lose the tv and you'll deserve 5 stars - I'm sure more customers will be relieved to see it gone than will miss it.
author: Michaela P.

description:
Pretty good food. Had 2 appetizers - the wingbombs and the firecracker balls. wingbombs were ehhh, a little sweet, which i didn't love. the firecracker balls were DELICIOUS.

loved the pumpkin curry and the pad see-ew. massaman curry was a little sweet but also good.

friendly service though i couldn't understand a word our waitress was saying. the track lighting above our table was WAY too bright but she adjusted them for us and made them dimmer, which definitely improved our experience.

i don't love the neighborhood where this restaurant was located. i think if it were somewhere else i'd be more inclined to come back.
author: Latte Queen W.

description: Excellent food, prices, service (very friendly) and decor. Located on the fringe of the Tenderloin. I recommend the basil chicken, eggplant, brown rice (very good), and Thai ice tea.
author: Brian C.

description:
outside before i came to the restaurant, the area is a lil' sketchy..oh well which part of sf downtown is not sketchy? :D
so i went to go inside the restaurant, it feels like spa but it's not, it's a restaurant. i felt comfortable right away, this place has good energy.
when i came in to see the menu i said cheerfully to myself "this is heaven for vegan/vegetarian peeps"
i have no idea if this place is good food or not, but my sense of adventure came rushing and i had to satisfy it  :p
decor is decent, interesting and unique from thai owners.
they have a very big tv on the wall but i dont know why they didnt turn it on, maybe it's still brand new?!?
the staff speak with thai accent so she must be from thailand, she's nice, nothing pretentious or anything, just go there to do her job well.
food: presentation is beautiful, it's just evry dish gotta kill 1 piece of orchid i feel a lil sad about that because i love orchid ;p
chicken satay with peanut sauce is good if you eat with plain rice, it tasted rather sweet.
appetizer wing bomb is really the bomb! taste like real meat, even my meatarian friends love it!
i also ordered spring rolls and they're good as an appetizer. i ordered pad thai vegan because i dont eat egg. in the menu it said with egg, but i requested without, you may do that by request.
oh don't forget to order also pumpkin/butternut squash curry, it's very tasty & fragrant, do smell it, i love the fragrance, very interesting. If you order curry, make sure you order brown rice too.
for dessert, i tried the fried banana & also the crepe w coconut ice-cream. love the crepe, it's awesome!
that's it!! next time i'll definitely be back! love this place, i wish they do delivery in the future. oh well i'd like to come back to try some more interesting dish from here; thai idea see you soon :)
author: Ms C.

description: Super nice service (though chipped bowls and plates), love the free corkage, but the food was all sweet, sweet, sweet. Sad to not give this place a higher rating, but it just was not to my taste.
author: Ara S.

description:
Excellent food, great service. Large portions. 

We found the pad Thai fried rice sweet so they replaced it with one that was much better. 

Will repeat.
author: anish m.

description:
Thai samosas, good flavor inside. The presentation was a little complicated at first, toothpick held the tower of samosas together.

Panang shrimp and avocado curry, wouldn't have ever thought of it myself. Love avocado!

Pumpkin curry, ordered with tofu but got the veggie beef or something, still good, but wished they got the order right since other dishes already had veggie meat. Curry base tastes the same as shrimp one, but I love spicy sweet coconut curries.

Veggie meat Vindaloo curry with naan. It had a more Indian curry flavor, sweet and creamy. Need to ask for more spicy next time. 

Pineapple fried rice, nothing I haven't tried before. Typical Thai fried rice.

Thai iced coffee, Eh. I'm not a big fan of the thai coffee flavor, but had to try.

For the spicy lovers, I'd ask for the 2 and 3 star spiciness, the dishes didn't have any real kick to count as spicy in my book, but since the flavors are great it didn't matter.

Tip included, $70 for 4 people, 4 entrees and an app.
author: Jocie M.

description: I don't understand where are those good reviews came from . They couldn't even cook the green curry right . Green curry is the basic dish in Thai food, but their green curry is too sweet and not spicy at all . I meat every dish are way too sweet . So boring.
author: Ju C.

description: Amazing food, beautiful presentation, lovely ambiance, and excellent service! Couldn't ask for more!
author: Veg V.

description:
Absolutely an excellent "idea" of a vegetarian restaurant (with veggie meat options)....by this I mean, while it's very cozy, this newer restaurant has attention to detail in all areas. From food taste, food presentation, the ambiance, cleanliness, the friendliness of the staff, ability to order online, and the prices of all the dishes, this restaurant far exceeds most of the Thai restaurants in SF. While I am a vegetarian (so this place is the only place I would order from, now on), most reviews from other, otherwise carnivore, Yelpers should attest to how good this place is. 

So far, I have only had Take-Out several times (Green Curry and Pad Basil) - all super well-made): 

* The *Biggest comment is on the food portions. For the same price you would pay at Thai Express, Zen Yai, T2J, Ozone Thai, you get approx. 2 or 3 times the food, depending on the comparison restaurant. The portions are in-line (if not exceeding) what you would expect to get for $8-9. 

* As a vegetarian, I don't have to worry about fish sauce in anything, or about cooks re-using the same cookware to prepare my veg. dishes as they've used for non-veg. dishes. If you're a vegetarian, you would appreciate this. 

* If you order a non-curry entree, the presentation of the food in the take-out container was (surprisingly) nice...it just *looked* well-placed in the container. This might be silly comment, but, again, this is attention to detail even in a take-out order!

While it's location may not be ideal, everything else is....
author: M s.

description:
This is one of the best vegetarian resteraunts in the city. Atmosphere was terrfic, service great and the food was very good. Presentation was impressive. We were able to meet the owner who really impressed us with his focus on creating fantastic vegitarian Thai Food.  We plan on taking our not veg friends to this place as the food was so delicious. 

Get the fried banana and coconut ice cream for desert.
author: Dave W.

description: Delicious food. The restaurant is artfully decorated, the food is tastefully presented and the service was prompt and courteous. The portions were larger than most typical Thai restaurants, so we ended up with a lot of leftovers that served us well for lunch next day. We tried a variety of entres including green curry (delicious!), pumpkin curry (superb!!), wing bomb (fantastic). The food is all vegeterian, and although we are fully carnivorous, we didn't miss meat at all. We will go back their again.
author: Joe M.

description: OMG you got to be kidding me!!! Totally in love with the vegetarian food and services here. Feel like $15-$20 per dish !!!! lol I will go back for more.
author: K S.

description:
Amazing! Amazing. Amazing. Period. 
Great (and delicious!) vegan options, extremely friendly, staff, fantastic ambiance, very clean. 
Amazing.
author: DarkNGay H.

description: The golden cauliflower starter was to die for! The fresh spring rolls were divine and the papaya salad was very aromatic and tasty (although, a bit on the spicy side). All the dishes were made fresh using the best ingredients! Simply out of this world!
author: J C.

description: Have been vegetarian for 13 years, and regardless if you are or- this place is heaven. The food is amazing the atmosphere is cozy comfortable and inviting, and there is soo much to choose from. Its like you are exploring a new world of food. I eat the satay chicken for starter, and Bangkok duck as main course - delicious. If you are vegetarian trust me, you won't be disappointed.
author: Jasmine O.

description:
Food was good though the appetizers were just OK.
We tried the red curry and the tom yam soup both were great.
In the appetizers we tried the firecracker ball and the wing bomb , I gave them one less start for those. 
But on the whole servers are very friendly and food presentation is great.
I will go back there again for the main course.
author: sonali a.

description: I love Thai food and although it is pretty easy to find vegan options at any Thai restaurant there is something special about Thai idea!  I've been here about 3 times since discovering it 2 weeks ago, it is that amazing!  The ambiance and decor make you forget you are in the TL while you enjoy an awesome meal.  The wait staff, which from what I can tell is one lady, is amazingly nice and pretty attentive.  And most importantly the food is delicious.  I highly recommend the firecracker balls and crab cakes as appetizers and the beef vindaloo curry and the roasted duck curry have been my favorites so far but I plan to keep going back until I've had everything on the menu and everyone else should do the same.
author: Eric H.

description:
Don't be mistaken it IS exclusively a vegan restaurant. They have "meat" on the menu, but it's all artificial meat.

There is no wine or beer, but it can be purchased at the liquor store next door (no charge from the restaurant), don't expect a wide choice :)

Now to the good thing: it is very tasteful, extremely well presented, and the staff is super nice.

All in all, a very surprising refreshing new experience.
author: Yo D.

description:
Awesome restaurant in creepy neighbor  hood.

Quality of ingredients is the best.
Presentations is awesome.
Pas Thai was a bit greasy.
Soup is awesome.
author: prats a.

description: This place is amazing. The interior is pretty. Service is wonderful and quick. The food is beautifully presented and tastes wonderful. The pumpkin curry was a favorite as well as the dessert crepe!
author: S O.

description:
I just had the most lovely meal here!  I live in the neighborhood, and have been wanting to try it since I peeked in shortly after they opened....and I'm so happy I finally had the opportunity!

The restaurant itself is beautiful - lovely decor, and I felt like I was transported out of the TL for an hour.  The staff was so friendly, and amazingly attentive.  Now onto the good stuff...

The food was amazing.  The presentation was more beautiful than anything I've seen before, and I regretted not bringing my phone/camera.  But that was just the beginning.  We ordered the Thai samosas and Som Tum salad to start...completely flavorful, and the best papaya salad I've had hands down.  (That's saying something considering I spent three months in Thailand!)

Our main courses were the tofu pad thai and the meatless chicken praram with jasmine rice.  Wow.  I'm ecstatic that we have leftovers! We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and a Thai iced tea (made vegan!)...perfect date spot!

My only critique is the very large and prominent flatscreen TV.  Though I appreciated it was on mute, and they had some nice music playing instead, I felt like it took away from the decor and ambiance that they had obviously spent a lot of time and effort on...but that's just me, I'm sure there are people that might appreciate that.

Overall, I loved this place, can't wait to go back and take my friends here.  Do yourself a favor and check it out!
author: Natalia P.

description: Must visit restaurant!! This place has a lot of vegan and vegetarian friendly dishes and a beautiful ambience. We tried the hot tea, green curry and vegetable combination which we loved. The dishes were beautifully decorated with thinly sliced or serrated vegetables and each dish looked pretty creative. I would definitely drop by here again pretty soon.
author: S K.

description:
Oh, Thai Idea Vegetarian.
Oh, your Pad Kee Mow noodles. I want to dive into a swimming pool full of them and eat my way through it.
I love your "chicken." It is the only "chicken" that I both would put in quotation marks and also eat buckets of any day of the week.
You have such nice mushrooms.
Your carrot and beet shavings are works of art.
You make me so happy.
Let's run away together.
author: Leo V.

description: Great spring rolls and lava tofu thing, nice atmosphere and I love the no corkage fee. Will definitely eat again
author: Matt K.

description: i'm not really a vegetarian,but I like vegetarian diet more than meat.sometimes make the vegetarian diet  be delicious is a difficult thing,but they did it,I'm very enjoyed the soup and tofu,so great,the taste likes my grandmother.
author: Shmily Z.

description: i loved this place and the food. it was freaking incredible. they don't have alcohol, but they let you go to the convenience store next door and buy whatever you want - NO CORKAGE FEE! huge plus :)
author: Elise H.

description: With less than an hour's time before a 3 hr class, I needed to fit in some dinner, fast. Thai idea vegetarian looked much nicer than the other places around it and had good reviews, so I went in. I hate eating alone!! But sometimes it's a necessity. It was 6pm on a Tuesday, but the restaurant was mostly empty and I was seated right away. Comfy pillow seat! The inside was nice and restful. What I personally didn't like about the menu was that it was full of imitation meat. I'm a part time vegetarian, but even if I were full time, I'd not want to eat that stuff. If they are making plant matter to taste and feel like meat, what on earth are they doing to it? It seems scary. I'd rather eat real meat, or just eat vegetarian things that look and taste like vegetarian things. I wish they had more real vegetarian options on the menu. So I got sweet and sour tofu with veggies and rice. Good choice. Many sweet and sour recipes are super sweet, but this was not (it was sweet, but not cloying). Great sauce, without being over sauced. Cucumbers, tomatoes, pineapple..and the tofu super yummy. Great presentation as well. The thai iced tea was pretty good too! The only drawback was, it was hard to get the waitresses attention. There were only a few of us in there, and there was a waitress just standing at the register staring into space, while I sat there with my menu down, looking at her intently to try to catch her eye, willing her in my head to come over so I could order (after all, I was in a rush). She walked around aimlessly, not even thinking about me, even though it was pretty easy to see me, and finally another waitress came out, not the one who had started waiting on me, and took my order. So, the service was a bit iffy, but not too iffy because no one was rude, but it definitely wasn't great. I only had time to eat less than half before doggie bagging it and heading on my way, but the rest tasted good at 11pm when I got home! I would come here again, if I were in the area and give them another try. Oh, and not sure why some people were saying it's pricey, my meal came out under $20. I think $16 for the drink, rice and entree.
author: Merredith L.

description: So glad we found this place on Yelp! After a fun afternoon at the Asian Art Museum we walked four quick blocks to Thai Idea and got a seat, no problem. We had good service and the decor is nice, bathrooms clean and comfortable. We ordered the spring rolls, Tom Kha with tofu & chicken, and the Pad See Yu with beef. The "meats" are gluten based, and very juicy and tasty. The rolls were served cut in half standing in a martini glass (cute and easy to grab): they could be a little fatter with more filling, but the sauce was super yummy with nice chili bite. The Tom Kha was a standout: hearty, full flavored base with great variety of veggies, mushrooms and silky tofu and gluten chicken. Terrific! The Pad See Yu was very tasty too.
