For dessert we had the fried bananas with coconut ice cream: a little disappointing as the bananas tasted flat, would suggest a nice seasoning like cinnamon/clove/nutmeg in the batter. The Thai iced tea was delish, served in a tall thin glass. All the presentations were lovely, with flowers and touches like ribbons of beet on the Pad See Yu. Just a lovely meal and we look forward to returning to try the many other items on the menu! A real treasure. And only $40 for two, with lots of leftovers for lunch!
author: Marlene R.

description: I love me an all vegetarian menu, especially with my thai favorites with no worries about oyster or fish sauce. I've only been once but I'm dying to get back, however the location is a real downer. The restaurant was empty with the door locked when we came by for dinner on a weeknight. My friend and I shared the veggie chicken satay, the panang curry with veggie chicken and pad see ew with veggie beef. The satay appetizer was tasty, the peanut sauce had excellent flavor and was thick and creamy. I believe the veggie meat was more similar to veggie duck. The plate was very beautifully presented and came with cucumbers and an edible flower. The panang had great flavor and came with a delicious hearty brown rice. The pad see ew was also good but the veggie beef + soy flavor became too salty. We loved the friendly service and chic interior. If only they were located in a nicer neighborhood or even nicer corner of the TL.
author: Cori W.

description: Beyond amazing!  REALLY good Thai.  I had pretty much given up on Vegan fake meats (ew), but some if it came with the meals we chose, and I was really impressed.  In fact, the tofu shrimp and chicken tasted BETTER than most overcooked meat that usually comes in Thai dishes.  Easily the best vegetarian place I have EVER eaten at, and definitely ranks among the best Thai food restaurants.  They also served complimentary red beet soup, which had this beautiful color and lightly spicy taste that was an instant January comfort food.  The service was excellent as well.
author: Alyssa S.

description: Started with two soups. Both nice but not fantastic. BBQ chicken with fried rice  was poor replete with bottled thai chili sauce. Pumpkin curry  okay. Quite salty and sugary throughout. First Yelp disappointment on an otherwise very yelpful SF foodie weekend. My stomach didn't love the food either.
author: Jeff T.

description: I'm not a vegetarian. I love red meat. Fake meats taste awful to me. But they seem to present it very nicely to look at. Indian vegetarian food taste better to me because they don't use fake meats. They use beans instead for the protein.
author: Robert S.

description: Lifelong vegetarian. I didn't feel like our meal was comprised because this restaurant didn't serve meat. We tried the wing bombs, but a someone who has never eaten meat, I couldn't wrap my mind around it. It looked too real. Fresh rolls were fantastic. Sauces were great, service was spot on. Great recommendations, courteous, and generous. Thai basil was our favourite dish, but all were very tasty.
author: utpal d.

description:
This Thai place is even better than most non-vegetarian Thai places.  Always amazingly fresh.  When I moved to San Francisco, I got really excited to try so many of the Thai restaurants in this city and I was pleasantly surprised to discover this place.  I didn't think one of the best Thai restaurants in the city would be vegetarian but it is - definitely it is one of the best Thai places in the city.
I highly recommend the fresh salad rolls - not boring like most places salad rolls and with really beautiful presentation.  I also really like the green curry with tofu and vegetables - I crave this curry all the time.  The red curry is really tasty too.  I prefer the tofu and vegetables options though to the mock chicken in the curries.  The mock beef is really tasty in the spicy pan-fried noodle dish.  I never walk out of here feeling too oily or too salty - it is always perfectly seasoned and really fresh tasting.  The prices are pretty decent too.
author: Heather K.

description: I totally agree with Marsha Z's review. Friendly service, beautiful presentation, nice and clean atmosphere, and vegan Thai niche are all big pluses. I found the food tasted pretty good, but did not match the presentation. I would go here again, but I would not go out of my way to do so.
author: Andrew Z.

description: Thai Idea has it all down perfectly, from the variety in the menu, to the cleanliness of the space, to the gracious service, to the artful and colorful presentation, to the delicious food itself.  Vegan, vegetarian, or just exploring, this is the place to go for a great Thai meal.
author: Bob G.

description: I am a regular here and really enjoy the foot and atmosphere inside. Only thing I wish is they would make it full vegan....
author: Joshua s.

description: Finally found my favorite Thai restaurant in the city! We ordered the Wing Bombs and Chicken Vindaloo and they were both so flavorful and delicious. My husband, who eats meat, really enjoyed the meal as well. Both of us can't wait to go back for more!
author: Seeta N.

description: Extra points for being vegetarian friendly. The fried rice is flavorful, the pad thai is good, and the papaya salad is probably the best I've had. This place is really cute inside. The complimentary carrot soup they serve at lunch was not my favorite and made me nervous for the rest of my meal. BBQ "chicken" was just OK. This is near my place of learning and so I will definitely return.
author: Erin M.

description: It's bonding time...my aunt and me! After some wine, she brought me to this amazing restaurant (she's a vegetarian! ) and since I'm carnivorous, I expected the worst...but Oh, my! I was speechless! The restaurant was very well decorated and the presentation was fabulous! But what really surprised me was that vegetarian foods are actually good! We had firecracker balls as starters, then I had the shrimp and avocado curry ( hmmm! Yummy!) and my aunt had the pumpkin curry which looked so delicious! My descriptions for the food: yummy...yummy...yummy!
author: Adele V.

description: Great food, whether you're vegetarian or not. Very clean, very accomodating to special requests. Gluten free knowledgable. After a friend brought me here, I had to go back the next day it was just that delicious!
author: J. S.

description: This place is incredible. New to SF and I was on a quest to find somewhere I can eat that I don't feel completely guilty. Their mock meat is tasty although I don't know if its GMO free. Had the pumpkin curry and it was as good as everybody on here said. Highly recommend this place, I would be an addict if I lived any closer. Area is kind of funny. During dinner some black dude was throwing fire crackers at people every couple of minutes.
author: Diver D.

description: First of all, I got to lean against a pillow while eating, which is awesome and very comfortable.  Then the appetizers.. so beautifully displayed that I had to photograph them before they were eaten.  I had the chicken satay and the wing bomb.  The wing bomb was the best, but I have been dreaming about both for a week.  The menu is very well labeled what is vegan (V), and what can be made vegan if you ask (VO).  I had the fried rice and something with tofu for my entree and it was really great, but not as good as the appetizers.  When I go back, I'm definitely choosing a different entree.  The service was quick and very attentive.  My water was filled constantly (maybe too much?) and plates were swifted off my table right as I was done with my last bite.  That part was a little weird but I guess you have make room for the next course IMMEDIATELY!  The inside of the restaurant is very cute and comfortable.  I'll be back soon!
author: Janey F.

description: Went with a vegetarian group a week or so back and had an amazing spread of food.  I'm vegan and they also have great options on the menu - in fact the whole meal we shared that night was vegan including papaya salad which I rarely get to eat at most Thai restaurants!  It was delicious. The atmosphere is cool and the service was excellent.  Even though we're so lucky with Thai restaurants all over the city, I can't wait to get back to this one again!
author: Marc M.

description: For someone who is scared of the word Vegetarian, I think this restaurant is one of my new favorites! The food is sooooo flavorful and meat is absolutely not missed!  The restaurant is clean and very cute. Not to be missed!
author: Jennifer A.

description: Just had a meal at Thai Idea that featured probably the best curry I've had in years. I ordered the pumpkin curry with faux chicken and it was buttery, melt-in-your-mouth goodness.  I also got the white rice (which sadly, is NOT Thai sticky rice boooo!...just normal rice.) and a nice vegan Thai iced tea in an extremely tall and narrow glass. A+ for presentation on the whole and for the great decor.  I DO wish they would frost the street windows so you couldn't see the unattractive sights and passerby hobos outside the doors, but inside it was modern and chic, the service was really great from the chef and waitress/hostess, and my partner enjoyed the meal as much as I did.  We both agreed, this is our new favorite place!  The menu is about 10-15% overpriced compared to other Thai places, but it's worth it for the taste (it's like buttery coconut heaven!) and the peace of mind you get from knowing there are no fish or meat products in your food. Now, if only they would replace the white rice with sticky rice, I'd send them a love-letter...
author: Lisita P.

description: This place is pretty good. I ordered the Pad Kee Mao with faux chicken and shrimp. I am a vegetarian as well as a serious thai consumer. The food was great but I think it would be better if the veggie meats were cooked more and perhaps maybe a little bit more crispy. Also, I am not sure I fully like their choice in faux chicken yet. I think they could do better with their choice as a serious vegetarian. Also, their peanut sauce is a little too flavorless so far. I think that in a few months their food will be perfect. They should consider macrobiotic vegan cooking combined with authentic thai styles. Also, their drink selections could be better. I would recommend that they added things like Kombucha, healthy energy drinks, ginger beer, and things of the health food variety. It will earn them profits and up their value. Take Love & Haight Deli for example. That place has the right idea. If they insist on serving pepsi and coke they should serve pepsi and coke with real sugar in glass bottles. Little things add to appeal. I think this place is off to an excellent start and really love the way they chop their vegetables. Their preparation is 5 stars.
author: Sashy R.

description: is this place open today? on Xmas eve?
author: bradford l.
